loans.name: Ta-Lap Group

texts.en:
This group, named Ta-Lap, consists of two members: Aminata B. and Mariatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni, and they have already received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Such previous loans provided a great deal of assistance to the members of this group: they enabled the members to expand their businesses and to generate more profit; accordingly, the loans worked to improve the living conditions of both group members. Having successfully repaid their last loan, they are hereby requesting another loan in the amount of $650 total (1,000,000 SLL each).

Aminata, pictured on the left, is the leader of the group. She is 42 years old, and she was born in Sanda Loka, a series of small towns in northern Sierra Leone. She is married, and her husband is a professional teacher. They have five children: one child is married, one is in Senior Secondary School III (SSS III), one is in Junior Secondary School (JSS), one is in primary school, and their last child is not old enough to attend school. Aminata sells food items such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil in her area) and rice. In addition, she sells firewood from their home. With the proceeds from this loan, Aminata is hoping to diversify her business by purchasing dishes and cotton for resale purposes.

Aminata thanks God for her business. She explains that her business is doing well, and that she enjoys operating her business. Her goal is to grow her business in such a way that she could generate a sufficient amount of income to build her family a house.

loans.use: To expand and improve the business by diversfying her product offerings

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda V. has a small "sari-sari" store (general store). She is 49 years old already and not yet married. She started her business in 2001 using the money that she has saved while working in Silver Smith store in Cebu City, host of the 12th ASEAN Summit held last January 2007. She has been a CEVI client for such a long time time already that she could no longer recall the exact date she joined the program. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks to attract more customers. The loan will truly hep Esmeralda expand her business. In that way, she could support her siblings who are already married.

CEVI is a nonprofit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own business. They provide all their clients not only credit but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her store

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
El señor Nazario Z. tiene ya más de 11 años dedicándose a la venta de tacos este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Don Nazario solicita un préstamo para poder acondicionar el puesto ya que le están haciendo falta mesas y sillas para que sus clientes puedan con sumir sus alimentos cómoda mente y tengan una mejor atención.  
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio ya que le ayudan su esposa y dos hijos.
texts.en:
Nazario Z. has worked selling tacos for more than 11 years. This business is the main source of income for his family. Nazario is seeking a loan to improve his post since he is missing tables and chairs to allow his customers to eat comfortably and receive better attention. He plans to repay the loan with the profits from the business to support his wife and two children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair food vending post

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio F. is managing a small piggery business. He is 48 years old, married, and has four children. He is the caretaker of a building and is paid Php 600 a month. In 2004, he started his business by raising one pig. Now, he has plenty of pigs in his backyard, which helps him provide for the needs of his family.

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy two additional piglets and pig feed. The loan will help Bonifacio grow his business even more and earn a bigger income for his family.

CEVI is reaching out more pig farmers to grow and sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides credit assistance. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage services to all its clients to help them grow their business.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and two piglets.

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en: Sampson A., single with no children has received a junior high school education.  For eight years Sampson has worked as an auto electrician selling electrical parts, such as wire, at Siwdo in Cape Coast.  Sampson uses his income to support himself and pay his bills.  He will use the loan to purchase more electrical parts for selling and with the new profits, expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase parts for selling

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is a 40-year-old married mother of three children, one daughter and two sons, who are currently in senior high and junior high school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in the town of Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Grace's husband is a farmer and Grace is a trader in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, and sells it in the local market on a table top. She also treks to other towns to sell. Grace has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy assorted fishes in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Pedrito

texts.en: Mr. Pedrito S. is 57 years old with three dependents. Mr. S. is a good husband and good father to his family. His only source of income that he has to support the needs of his family, especially the education of his three children, is a "motorcab" operator or motorcycle operator. Due to lack of transportation in his municipality and the demand of the commuters, Mr. S. decided to request a loan in Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative amounting to PHP 25,000.00. He believes all his plans will be realized and through this, he can surely continue to support the needs of his family, especially the education of his three children.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Nurmahmad

texts.ru: Халифаев Нурмахмад проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 53 года. Жент, имеет 7 детей. По специальности Нурмахмвд "инженер-механик". В данный момент он занимается торговлей. Он в основном торгует мебелью. Ему в этом помогают его 2 сына. Клиент просит кредит, дял увеличения товараоборта.
texts.en:
Nurmahmad H. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 53 years old. He is married and has seven children. Nurmahmad is a mechanical engineer. At this time he is in retail. He mainly sells furniture. His two sons are helping him in this. The client is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La elaboración de tamales es el negocio al que se dedica la señora Dolores Velasquez en la ciudad de León donde elabora una gran cantidad para colocarlos en sus canastos y exhibirlos a sus clientes para que estos puedan comprarlos para su alimentación.

Ella actualmente espera en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito que ha solicitado por lo que será invertido en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los deliciosos tamales y de esta manera ofrecerlos a todos los clientes que con mucho gusto le compran el producto por ser de alta calidad y por tener un sabor inigualable.
texts.en:
Ms. Dolores Velasquez makes tamales in the city of Leon, where she prepares them in great quantities, puts them in baskets, and displays them to her patrons who purchase them to eat.

She is hoping that Ceprodel will give her the loan that she has requested, which she will invest in purchasing the ingredients she needs to make her delicious tamales. This way, she can sell them to her patrons who go to her for her high-quality products and their incomparable taste.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make tamales

loans.name: Ubaldina

texts.es: Ubaldina cuenta con 37 años de vida, es madre soltera, vive con su hijo Faire de 10 años y con su anciana madre, en la casa de esta última. La madre de Ubaldina es propietaria de varias extensiones de tierras, de las cuales, algunas siembra ella y la otra parte, su hermano. Para ello, Ubaldina madruga diariamente a las 4 de la mañana para preparar los alimentos para su propio almuerzo y para el de su hijo cuando regresa del colegio.  Esta labor la realiza desde hace muchos años atrás y la llena de mucha satisfacción, sobre todo las veces que comercializa sus productos en el mercado de mayoristas (el más importante de la ciudad de Tarma), donde acumula muy buenas  ganancias, con las que educa y mantiene a su hijo y a su madre. Ubaldina tiene sus anhelos puestos en su trabajo, para que cuando crezca su hijo, ella pueda incrementar sus cultivos hasta alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, en los ciclos pasados pagó responsablemente sin dificultades, por ello ha pedido el incrementando de su préstamo con el consentimiento de los integrantes de su banco comunal, donde demostró mucha nobleza y seriedad. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de papas.
texts.en:
Ulbaldina is 37 years old. She is a single mother and lives with her son, Faire, who is 10 years old, and with her elderly mother. They live in her mother’s house. Ulbaldina’s mother owns several pieces of land; Ubaldina farms some of them and her brother farms the others. She gets up very early each day, at 4:00 in the morning, to prepare her own lunch and her son’s for when he returns from school. She has done been farming for many years and it fills her with satisfaction, especially when she sells her products in the wholesale market (the most important one in the city of Tarma). She makes good income there, which she uses to take care of her son and her mother. Ubaldina has her dreams pinned on her work, so that when her son is grown she can increase her crops until she can achieve a higher standard of living. This is her fifth loan with MFP. In the previous cycles she has paid responsibly and without difficulties. Because of this, she has requested an increase in her loan amount, with the consent of the other members of her communal bank, where she has demonstrated seriousness. The money she is requested is to buy chemical fertilizers for her potato crop.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao C., age 61, is a widower and has five children. He lives with his children in Phnom Penh City. To make a living, he works for a poor community, earning approximately US$4 per day. The family is also assisted by Chea Mariya, one of his children, who runs a business in front of her house with her husband (pictured). Mariya's husband is a skillful mechanic, and he is able to generate an income of US$10 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Cheab included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, Cheab is seeking to increase his income. He is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase motorbike spare parts for his son-in-law to expand his business. By doing so, he believes that his son-in-law will be able to raise a good standard of living for the family.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts for his son-in-law's business

loans.name: Matim Group

texts.en:
Ndubulai is a member of the Matim borrower group in Ngaramtoni, Arusha. She is 45 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 18,13 and 10 years old.


Ndubulai has owned a crops business selling maize and beans for 10 years. She works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Ndubulai`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more crops for sale.

With the additional profit she gains fom the use of this loan Ndubulai hopes to save more money and expand her business.

Napili is another member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crops

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El Señor Jaime  de 24  años de edad, vive en pareja hace 2 años con la Sra. Maria Morinigo de 23 años de edad.
  Jaime, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropas. En el 2007,  fue cuando  decidió abrir para su despensa un pequeño ahorro que contaba del trabajo anterior que realizaba.  Actualmente, además de su despensa, también vende repuestos para motos, con un hermano. 
 Como sueño personal desea  ampliar más su negocio, así poder tener un mejor ingreso. 
  El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para motocicletas.

loans.use: Para la compra de repuestos para motos.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.es: Sarita es una mujer  colaboradora y  emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 53 años y es madre de cinco hijos todos mayores de edad. Se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y también vende productos de limpieza, en esta actividad trabaja junto a una de sus hijas, este negocio funciona en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Activas” desde hace cuatro años. El primer crédito fue de 300 soles, dinero que utilizó para invertir en gaseosas, ahora Sarita necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de limpieza. La meta de Sarita es incrementar sus ventas y seguir aportando en la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sarita is a collaborative and entrepreneurial woman. She lives in the Manantay district, in the Ucayali region. She is 53 years old and has five children who are all adults. She sells soda and cleaning products together with one of her daughters. She runs this business from her house, and she counts on her husband's help.

She has been part of the community bank "Las Activas" for four years. Her first loan was for PEN 300, which she invested in soda. Now Sarita needs a loan of PEN 1500, which she will use to buy cleaning products. Sarita's goal is to increase sales and continue to contribute to her family's finances.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in buying cleaning products

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James M. is 29 years old and married to Grace Wanja. They have a 2 year old baby girl. James has operated his tailoring shop in Njabini town in the outskirts of Naivasha town for the past 11 years.

James was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 4th loan. He plans to use this loan to buy more cloth to make new clothes to sell.

One day he plans to open other tailoring outlets in major towns, thus increasing his income.

About KADET

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their families across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy cloth to make new clothes to sell

loans.name: Fanny Rosmery

texts.es:
Fanny tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad en casa de su madre, ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 15 años se dedica a vender agua a diversos pobladores de las zonas alejadas del distrito que no cuentan con este servicio básico. El agua la extrae de un pozo hecho por sus abuelos en la casa donde reside. Ella la vende a un precio cómodo y las personas siempre recurren a ella, e incluso cuando se corta el suministro de agua en el distrito sus  vecinos acuden a su domicilio a solicitar el agua que necesitan.

Por otro lado también se gana la vida haciendo limpieza en algunas Instituciones de la zona, durante el dia divide su tiempo y visita a los locales e incluso casas que previamente han solicitado sus servicios. Estos dos ingresos son la única fuente de ingreso con la que su familia se sostiene.

Ella está solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles para brindarle mantenimiento al motor que extrae agua del pozo. Ella ya ha trabajado con nosotros anteriormente y ha demostrado ser una cliente responsable.

Su más grande anhelo es terminar de construir su casa y brindarle a sus hijos una educacion de calidad.
texts.en:
Fanny, 35, is a single mother. She lives with her four children; 13, 10, 8, and 6. They live in her mother’s house, which is in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclay. For 15 years she has been selling water to the diverse inhabitants of the outlying areas of the district that do no have this basic service. She extracts the water from a well that her grandparents made at the house where she lives. She sells at a comfortable price, and people always turn to her. Even when they cut the water supply in her district, her neighbors come to her house to ask for the water that they need. She also earns a living cleaning in some institutions in the area. During the day she divides her time. She goes to the locations, including houses, who have previously asked for her services. These two incomes are the only source of income that supports her family. She is asking the Edpyme Alternative for a loan for 300 PEN to provide maintenance to the motor that extracts the water from the well. She has worked with us previously, and she has demonstrated herself to be a responsible client. Her biggest aspirations are to finish building her house and to give her children a quality education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on the motor that extracts the water from the well

loans.name: Layidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Layidou est  composé de quatre femmes mariées dont deux dans des familles monogames. Elles ont  en moyenne  39 ans, 3 enfants et habitent dans le quartier Bagadadji Sud communément appelé ATT-Bougou de la ville de  Ségou  (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens d’amitié car elles ont fait leur enfance ensemble à Bougoufié et de voisinage avec l’avènement des logements sociaux (ATT Bougou). 
Après six prêts de groupe tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 7ème prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce prêt  servira à acheter, 52 sacs de charbon de bois,  15 pièces de pagnes wax, des produits pour la  restauration (tels que du couscous arabe,  30 sachets d’1kg, 60 sachets de spaghetti, 25 sachets de macaroni Sobipal, 25kg de haricot, 1 bidon de 20l d’huile alimentaire sans cholestérol) et des ingrédients (75 bols  de « gueni », 15flacons d’eau de Cologne, 15flacons de parfum) pour l’encens varient selon les périodes.  
Elles s’approvisionnent en pâtes alimentaires dans une Alimentation à Hamdallaye, le haricot est fourni à domicile par les forains des villages voisins, en pagnes wax au grand marché de Ségou  chez les  « Djogoramé », en gueni, eau de Cologne, parfums au marché château, en charbon de bois auprès des exploitants de Sakoïba. Les aliments sont vendus  les jours de foire de Ségou au marché de Médine et les jours ordinaires à domicile surtout au comptant, les pagnes wax sont vendus au marché de Ségou- Coura et à domicile, l’encens est vendu sur commande à Bamako et dans les structures telles :Alpha log,  le Trésor, l’APSRU (Association pour la Promotion du Secteur Rural et Urbain), l’INPS (Institut National de Prévoyance Sociale), le charbon est vendu à domicile en détail et en demi gros à crédit. La vente de leurs marchandises se fait   au comptant et  à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel  de 37.000FCFA à 42.100FCFA   qui servira à rembourser les prêts, à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux, à l’achat de fournitures scolaires et à participer aux événements sociaux (baptême, mariage et funérailles).
texts.en:
The Layidou group is made up of four married women, two of whom are in monogamous families. They average 39-years-old, with 3 children, and live in the Bagadadji Sud quarter - usually called ATT-Bougou - in the village of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They are friends as they grew up together in Bougoufié and were neighbors in public housing (ATT Bougou). After six repaid group loans, they are together for their seventh loan with Soro Yiriwaso. This loan will serve to buy 52 bags of wooden charcoal, 15 pieces of wax pagne cloth, catering products (some Arabic couscous, 30 1-kilogram bags, 60 bags of spaghetti, 25 bags of Sobipal macaroni, 25 kg of beans, 1 can of 20L cholesterol-free cooking oil) and ingredients for various types of incense (75 bowls of gueni - good smelling roots that grow in humid areas and are used in making incense - 15 bottles of perfume water, 15 perfume bottles). They stock up on pasta in a shop in Hamdallaye; the beans are produced at home by neighboring village farmers; the wax pagne cloth is from the Djogorames at the grand market of Ségou; the gueni, perfume water and perfume come from the castle market; and the wood charcoal is from farmers in Sakoiba. The food is sold at the Ségou-Coura market fair and from home; the incense is made-to-order in Bamako for the following organizations: Alpha log, le Trésor, l'APSRU (Association for the Promotion of the Rural and Urban Sector), l'INPS (National Institute of Social Forethought); the charcoal is sold at home at retail and wholesale prices. Their merchandise sales are done in both cash and credit to male and female customers. They plan on making a monthly profit of 37,000 to 42,100 FCFA which will serve to repay the loan, support their small family needs, purchase school supplies, and participate in social events (baptisms, marriages, and funerals).

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of varied items

loans.name: Chran

texts.en: Mrs. Chran L. is a villager in Pou Bay village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Leng Bros, is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare field to cultivate rice on. Aside from this plantation, he is a fisherman. Now Mrs. Chran L. is requesting a loan to buy two cows, a piglet, and pig feed. She hopes to increase the family income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school.  Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: buy two cows, a piglet, and pig feed

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia T., age 44, has three children. Her eldest is 15 years old and studying in high school. She and her husband have been married for almost 16 years now. Lucia has a farm and she needs additional capital for her business.

She would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. She likes the CEVI program because the interest rate on her loan is only 2% and she was able to buy insurance, too.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 25-year-old single man. After achieving his university, he opened a learning center in his town. He specializes in English language training and computer skills. His business is helping the students of the village. Today, Khodor is requesting to borrow $1,200. The funds will go towards buying more computers for the center in order to help more students.

loans.use: To buy more computers.

loans.name: 6 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo  “6 D. Agosto” esta representado por la señora Lorgia y conformada por 15 miembros muy responsables y capaces como lo han demostrado en estos dos ciclos pasados, tienen mucha experiencia y son gente con muchas ganas D. salir adelante y seguir creciendo gracias al apoyo que les brinda la institución. 

Cada uno D. los socios tienen diferentes actividades como la venta D. ropa, cosméticos, promotores D. revistas, venta D. comida, leña, tarjetas telefónicas y a la prestación D. servicios como la reparación D. motos y en el caso D. la señora Lorgia que se dedica a al elaboración D. horneados en general, ella elabora desD. muy temprano masitas, salteñas, cuñapes y empanadas en la puerta D. sus domicilio, ella es casada pero lo que gana su esposo no abastece para mantener a sus cuatro hijos y es por eso que la señora se dedica a la educación D. sus hijos y lo que genera sirve para pagar las cuentas D. servicios pero ella desea poder tener un horno industrial para poder efectuar mas masitas y salir a las ferias locales para venderlas y generar un mejor ingreso que les D. a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida es por esta razón que requiere del préstamo para poder efectuar la compra D. sus horno; al igual que ella las demás socias desean el crédito para incrementar sus insumos, mercadería y su capital D. trabajo para poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. 

En cuanto a competencia se pueD. mencionar que si bien esta presente las socias no se dejan intimidar por ella ya que saben la calidad D. los productos que ofrecen y la experiencia que tienen les favorecen bastante. La mayor expectativa que tienen los socios es hacer crecer sus negocios D. manera que no les falte nada a sus familias y puedan darles una mayor comodidad en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The group, "the 6th of August" is represented by Lorgia and maD. up of 15 very responsible and capable members who have shown in the past two cycles that they have a lot of experience and are people who have much desire to get ahead and to continue growing thanks to the help offered them by the institution. Each one of the members has different activities like selling clothing, cosmetics, promoting magazines, selling food, firewood, phone cards and providing services like scooter repair and in the case of Lorgia, who works making baked goods. Usually, she makes them very early - pastries, salteñas (meat empanadas), cuñapes (bread roll with cheese and yucca), and empanadas - in the door of her house. She is married, but what her husband earns isn't enough to support their 4 children and that's why she works - for at the education of her children and to pay the utility bills. But, she would like to have an industrial oven to be able to make more pastries and to go to the local fairs to sell them and make better money to give her children a better quality of life. It's for this reason that she requires a loan to be able to purchase their oven. Like her, the other members would like the loan to increase their investments, merchandise and their working capital to be able to better their earnings and be able to give their families a better quality of life. As to competition, it can be mentioned that if this loan is granted, the members don't allow being intimidated by it. They know that the products that they offer and the experience is enough help. The greatest expectation that the members have is to grow their businesses in a way that their families aren't in need of anything and they can proviD. them more comfort in their homes. .

Translated from Spanish by Kimberly Baker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Luzma Capundag Group

texts.en:
Luzma C., 40, is from the village of Senor, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Luzma is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Luzma owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Luzma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Luzma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Luzma is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Luzma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Joel's Group

texts.en:
Joel A. is from the village of Catugay, Baggao, Cagayan. He is 32 years old. Joel is the leader of a 13-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Joel is married and has one young child. To make a living, Joel owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Joel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Joel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joel is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Joel from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Martiriano

texts.es:
EL Señor Martiriano A. C. tiene 55 años y está casado con la Señora Victoria Zapata López de A.  por más de 30 años total tiene 9 hijos lo cual 5 casados y 4 dependientes de el, que estudian, El señor se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,  papa liza y lleva a vender a la feria semanal de colomi, su esposa le ayuda en la producción agrícola aparte de ser ama de casa y cuidado de sus animales.   
                                                                                                                                                                                     El señor Martiriano A. C. vive en Colomi calle Cbba zona sud a media cuadra del Estadium Municipal  es una zona que está dentro de la urbanización  del pueblo de colomi, el crédito que está sacando de CIDRE; El señor Martiriano A. C. utilizara este para compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y compra de semilla de papa  para agrandar mas su producción agrícola.        
                                                                                                                                                           El señor Martiriano A. C. nos comenta que su sueño es seguir mejorando sus recursos económicos así para que sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta salir profesionales, también mejorar su calidad de vivienda para vivir mas cómodos con su familia; Por ultimo nos cuenta que sembrara en mas superficies sus cultivos de producción agrícola (aumento de producción), porque son los primeros de la canasta familiar a nivel Bolivia, a la vez es un recurso económico para mantener y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Martiriano A. C. is 54 years old and has been married to Señora Victoria Zapata López de A. for more than 30 years. He has a total of 9 children of whom 5 are married and 4 are still students dependent upon him.

The gentleman is engaged in the production of potatoes, beans, oca (an edible root), and papa liza (a tuber grown in the Andean region). He sells his crops at the weekly market in Colomi. His wife helps him with agricultural production, in addition to being a housewife and caring for their animals.

Señor Martiriano A. C. lives in Colomi on Cbba Street in the southern zone of the town a half block from the municipal stadium. It is an area which is within the housing development in the town of Colomi. He will use the loan that he is getting from CIDRE for the purchase of organic fertilizer (poultry droppings) and potato seed in order to in order to increase his agricultural production.

Señor Martiriano A. C. tells us that his dreams are to continue improving his economic resources so that his children can continue studying until they become professionals and also to improve his quality of life so that he can live more comfortably with his family. Finally, he tells us that he wants to increase the amount of land that he has under production because his crops are the most important for Bolivian family pantries and, at the same time, are an economic resource for maintaining and feeding his family.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of organic fertilizer and potato seed.

loans.name: Younis

texts.en: Younis S. is a 32-year-old married man from Gaza. In 2009, Younis opened his own electric store and now is in need of new electrical equipment. He is hoping that through this loan, he will be able to buy all the supplies he lacks. Doing so will bring in more customers, which will increase his income.

loans.use: buy all the supplies he lacks

loans.name: El Halcón Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Halcón lo conforman Cristina del Carmen M., José Isabel Jiménez Díaz y Miriam del Socorro Narváez tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y luchadoras que se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras que varían de acuerdo a la temporada. Ellos desde tempranas horas empiezan sus labores en el mercado de Masaya y terminan a altas horas de la noche acomodando la venta del día siguiente.

Este grupo tiene varios años de trabajar con Adim donde han sido participes tanto de los beneficios financieros como del proceso de capacitación y formación sobre genero y desarrollo empresarial. Ambos servicios les han ayudado mucho comento M., coordinadora del grupo, principalmente porque cuentan con dinero para invertir y el aprendizaje para administrarlo. 
 
Actualmente ellos invertirán en perecederos en flota como mamones, jocotes, aguacate, mango etc.
texts.en:
The group “El Halcón” (The Falcon) consists of Cristina del Carmen M., José Isabel Jiménez Díaz, and Miriam del Socorro Narváez. They are three hardworking, strong, and determined individuals who are in the business of selling fruits and vegetables based on the season. From the early morning hours, they begin their work at the market in Masaya and finish in the late hours of the evening arranging the items they will sell the following day.

This group has been working with ADIM for several years and has reaped the financial benefits of participating in training classes such as gender education and business development. Cristina, the group coordinator, says both services have helped them because they have money to invest and are learning how to manage it.

They currently plan to invest in perishable items in bulk such as “mamoncillos” (a fruit native to the Caribbean and Latin America), plums, avocados, mangoes, and other products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits & vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Babatunde

texts.en: Babatunde sells drinks at retail prices to make a living. He hopes to expand his business.  He is 40 years old, married with 2 children. He is requesting for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.  He says thank you to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara A. is the leader of a loan group. She is 40 and married. Because of the high unemployment rate her husband was obligated to go to Russia in order to make some money. Gulnara has a son and two daughters. Her son is a student and the daughters are preschool age. Fourteen years ago with the initial investment of 4000 soms (87.16$) Gulnara began to sell children's wear. Now, she also sells different fruits and vegetables. In this way she makes 1500 soms (32.68$) a month. With the money received from the loan Gulnara will purchase cattle, which she plans to sell after fattening it. In the future Gulnara wants to repair her house and buy a vehicle.

Mamrasul S. is 42, he is married. His wife went to Russia to make some money. They have four children, all of them are students.  Mamrasul has been breeding and reselling cattle for thirteen years. In this way he makes 700 soms (16.34$) a month. He started this activity with the initial investment of 1500 soms (32.68$). Now he wants to get a loan to purchase more cattle. 

Guluipa T. is 37, she is married. She has four children and all of them are students. When they are free, they help Guluipa with housework. Guluipa and her husband has been breeding and reselling cattle for thirteen years. In this way she makes 1500 soms (32.68$) a month. She wants to get a loan to purchase some cattle, in order to increase the herd.

Altynai K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 37 and married. Her husband works as a tractor driver. They have four children. All of them study at school. Thirteen years ago with the initial investment of 1800 soms (39.2$) Altynai started to breed and resell cattle. In this way she makes 1300 soms (28.32$) a month. With money received from the loan Altynai plans to buy cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jacqueline Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline Argentina M. G., tiene 32 años de edad vive en el barrio Waspan Norte habita acompañado de su pareja de vida y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, su esposo vende verduras en los departamentos, ellos tienen una venta de  fritanga desde hace 5 años, y fue con su marido que le apoyo económicamente para la apertura e instalación de su negocio.

Ahora ella solicita de un préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción, que le favorezca  la edificación de un muro con la intención de mejorar la formas de habita que actualmente tienen, sobre todo por la temporada de lluvia que en este mes les ocasiona diversidad de problemas. Esta construción les brindara mejores condiciones socio-economicas para toda su familia y la tranquilidad maternal de favorecer a su crecimiento en optimas condiciones de habitad.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Argentina M. G., 32, lives in the Waspan Norte neighborhood with her life partner and their two small children. Her husband is a vegetable merchant in various departments and they have had a fast-food business for the past 5 years. Her husband gave her the economic help to set up her business. She is asking for funds to buy building materials and supplies so that she can build a wall that will improve the living conditions under which they currently live especially during the rainy season that this month is already causing a variety of problems. This construction will improve the socio-economic conditions of the entire family and provide her with maternal peace of mind knowing that living conditions for her family are optimal.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: La Victoria  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Victoria esta conformado por un grupo de 8 socias que con el trabajo diario tratan de superarse poco a poco y entregarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro para que tengan una mejor vida, viven en la comunidad de la Victoria del Portete que es reconocida por sus llanuras ya que la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura son personas luchadoras como nuestras socias. 

La Señora. Rosa T. es nuestra socia y va por su segundo crédito siendo invitada por una compañera de la banca comunal, se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos de otras casas, actividad que le realiza ya 10 años, trabaja de 7 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de ganado levantándose muy temprano para entregar la leche e irse a trabajar, así ella obtiene dinero para comprar el pan diario de su familia, también ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa. Ella  cría pollos  los cuales vende en su comunidad.

Nuestra socia tiene treinta años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos que estudian en una escuela de la comunidad, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, el es viudo y heredo la casa de su finada esposa en la que actualmente viven.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en comprar un caballo y así poder cuidar mejor a su ganado en el cerro, su meta es tener más ganado para así poder tener una fuente de ingresos más grande.

La Señora María Pérez tiene cincuenta años de edad, es viuda por veinte años y tiene dos hijos, el primer hijo tiene veinte y ocho años de edad,  trabaja y le ayuda económicamente a su madre, su otro hijo tiene  veinte y dos años de edad, el estudia en el SECAP (Servicio Ecuatoriano de Capacitación Profesional) y vive en su casita propia la cual ha construido.

Nuestra socia se dedica a realizar los quehaceres domésticos de una casa, actividad que la realiza hace 5 años de lunes a sábado, trabaja  de ocho de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes. Es socia del banquito hace ocho años y los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en el negocio de  cuyes. Su nuevo  crédito lo va a invertir para comprar pollos ya que va a empezar con este negocio. Su meta es  agrandar su casa y también  tener agua potable para consumo de su hogar, se encuentran realizando mingas (Trabajo en grupo ) en la comunidad, están haciendo canales para llevar agua hasta sus hogares.
texts.en:
The La Victoria community bank is made up eight members who work hard each day to try to bring themselves up little by little; they all wish to give their children a better future and a better life. They live in the community La Victoria del Portete, which is known for its plains and fields, as the majority of the area’s population works in agriculture and animal husbandry. The residents of the area are strong people with a good work ethic, like the group’s members. Mrs. Rosa T., a member of La Victoria community bank, is going for her second loan, having been invited by another member. She has been doing domestic work in other people’s homes for 10 years, and she works from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. She also raises chickens, which she sells in her community, and cows; she must get up very early to go milk her cows before going to work. With these jobs, she has earned enough income to provide her family their daily bread, and also to help her husband with household expenses. Rosa is 30 years old, and she lives with her common law husband and their three children, who are studying in a school in the community. Her husband works in agriculture; he is a widower and has inherited the house of his deceased wife, in which they currently live. Rosa will invest the loan in the purchase of a horse so that she will be able to better take care of her livestock up on the hill. Her goal is to have more livestock and be able to have a larger source of income. Mrs. María Pérez is 50 years old, and she has been a widow for 20 years. She has two children. Her eldest son is 28 years old; he works and helps his mother financially. Her other son is 22 years old, and he studies at SECAP (Servicio Ecuatoriano de Capacitación Profesional, a professional training school) and lives in his own house which he built. María does domestic work outside her home, a job which she has been doing for 5 years. She works Monday to Saturday, from eight in the morning until six in the evening, and she also raises guinea pigs. She has been a member of the community bank for eight years, and the bank’s loans have helped her to expand her guinea pig business. She will invest this new loan in the purchase of chickens, as she would like to begin a chicken business. Her goal is to put an addition on her house, and also to have drinkable water inside her home. The community is organizing group work teams (“mingas”) to make canals to bring water to people’s homes.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and a horse

loans.name: Kishmish

texts.en:
Kishmish S. is married and has two children. She lives in Ijevan city. She works at Ijevan Polyclinic as a nurse and, at the same time, she and her husband are engaged in beekeeping. Thanks to income from beekeeping they have kept their family, bought necessary furniture for their house and also organized their children’s weddings. 

Kishmish has taken a loan from Nor Horizon four times and now. She is asking for a 900,000 AMD loan that she will use to buy some bee families for her business.

loans.use: To buy some bee families for her business.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en: Ganbaatar T. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (a traditional Mongolian housing tent) in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife works as a baker in a local bakery shop while his son goes to a kindergarten in their town. Ganbaatar operates a taxi service between the countryside and the capital of the province. He has just started his business with a small car. Ganbaatar works very hard to provide for his family and says, “My only wish is to build a new house with my business earnings”. Ganbaatar is requesting a 250,000 MNT loan to purchase parts for his automobile.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie C. is from the town of Talibon. He is 31 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Charlie owns & operates a fishing business. He operates a fishing boat and sells the catch of assorted fish at the market. 

Charlie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be the second loan taken out by Charlie from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support his family. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 50-year-old married man with five children; 28-year-old Naomi, 26-year-old Priscilla, 24-year-old Gabriel, 22-year-old Nathaniel, and 13-year-old Hellen. Hellen is still in school but the rest have finished school. Peter has been operating a retail shop for fifteen years to earn a living. He has been able to expand the business through Elshaddai group in Faulu Kenya. This is because he uses his savings with the group to invest in his business. He has applied for his first loan which he will use to purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and soda. He hopes to expand his shop into wholesale in the future. He describes himself as a hardworking and honest man.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and soda.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en:
Artemio I. is from the village of San Isidro. He is 37 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twelve years and earns approximately $300 per harvest for these activities.

In 2010, Artemio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sr.de Torrechayoc - Mototaxistas Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC - MOTOTAXISTAS ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Juana;  ella tiene 23 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos;  La socia vive en Urubamba en el barrio tradicional de pintacha, ella se dedica a trabajar en una chichcarronería como ayudante en las labores domésticas y poco a poco ella ahorrado su sueldo con mucho esfuerzo y gracias a esta modalidad de banco ha podido comprar su moto taxi y ponerla al servicio público, ella trabaja alquilando su unidad vehicular y ella administra los ingresos de esta luego de pagar al chofer su parte de ganancias ella tiene su ingreso diario, la socia a futuro comprara otra unidad, pero mientras ella sigue laborando en la chicharronería  y administrando su moto taxi, ella deberá hacerle mantenimiento a su unidad vehicular para dejarla operativa y con combustible para la siguiente jornada de este ciclo y desea el dinero para que no afecte su economía diaria. La socia solicita el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento respectivo de su moto taxi y llenar el combustible para que comience una nueva etapa de trabajo.

Los otros socios son  choferes de moto taxis ellos mismos manejan las unidades vehiculares y en el caso de los varones son propietarios de sus motos taxis;  el mínimo grupo vende verduras y La socia Justina se dedica a la venta de ropas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This associate is a member of the “SR. DE TORRECHAYOC – MOTOTAXISTAS” communal bank, located in the Urubamba province, in the Cusco department.

Juana is 23 years old and lives with her cohabitant and two children, in the Pintacha neighborhood of Urubamba.  She works in a factory where they make fried pork rinds, helping with domestic chores.  Little by little she was able to save up her salary, and with great effort, and thanks to this [communal] bank, she was able to buy a moto-taxi and put it into service.  She leases out her vehicle and manages the profits that are left, after paying the driver his portion.  This provides her with a daily income.  In the future she will buy another unit, but in the mean time she continues working in the factory and managing her moto-taxi.

She must perform maintenance on her vehicle in order to keep it operating and must also pay for fuel for the next cycle.  She is requesting this loan so that these expenses will not affect her daily income and so that she can begin a new stage of work.

The other members are also moto taxi drivers and they drive the vehicles.  In the case of the gentlemen, they also own their vehicles.  This same group also sells vegetables and Justina sells clothing.

Our associate is grateful and values the loan provided through this means and is committed to making her payments on the established timetable.

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice B. is currently in the business of selling fish and chickens at Dar es salam market and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Loice is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a farmer. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a hotel.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Karina Estefania

texts.es:
Karina Estefanía Rodríguez Rodríguez tiene 21 años.  Es soltera vive con su mama  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza, no tiene cargas familiares. 

Karina es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Karina estudia y se dedica a la venta de ropa a domicilio desde hace un año atrás. Realiza sus compras en la ciudad de Guayaquil, y las ventas lo realiza en el cantón Ventanas.

Solicita el préstamo para surtir más su negocio de ropa. Piensa que el crédito le ayudaría para salir adelante con sus estudios en la Universidad y solventar también gastos varios. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios Universitarios y trabajar en su profesión de Enfermera. El desafió que enfrenta es tener mucha competencia en su negocio.

Le gusta estudiar y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Karina Estefania R. R. is 21 years old. She is single and she lives with her mother in the community of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios, Nueva Esperanza. She doesn’t have a family of her own. 

Karina is a member of the community bank named Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the village of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. It is a community bank with 10 members, and the great majority of the members are merchants. 

Karina is going to school and she has been selling clothing door to door for the past year. She makes her purchases in Guayaquil and carries out her sales in Ventanas. 

She requests a loan to add clothing inventory for her clothing business. She sees this loan as an opportunity to complete her University studies and to cover various personal expenses. Her dream is to complete her university career and find work as a nurse. The challenge she faces is steep competition in her business. 

She enjoys studying and listening to music.

loans.use: To add inventory to her clothing business.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es: Jhonatan, de 21 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es forjarse un buen futuro y para ello esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. La actividad principal a la que se dedica Jhonatan es el cultivo de cacao, café y hoja de coca, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano a trabajar sus tierras, ya que sabe que tiene que brindarles un buen cuidado, para que sus productos sean comprados más rápidamente en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con muchos ánimos y alegría lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus chacras de la plaga de insectos, que perjudican sus plantaciones. En adelante desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará insumos para cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga de insectos.
texts.en: Jhonatan, 21, is a down-to-earth, hard-working young man.  He lives with his parents.  Jhonatan's greatest hope is to create a better future for himself, a goal for which he is willing to work very hard.  He operates a farming business growing cacao, coffee and coca leaves.  He gets up early every morning to work his fields because he knows that he has to take care of his crop so that buyers in the Peruvian city of San Francisco will quickly snatch it up once it's harvested.  What he most likes about the business is sowing his fields, work that he does with a lot of joy and energy.  He has operated the business for 3 years and says that the most difficult thing about it is protecting his crops against the insects that destroy his plants.  In the future, he would like to buy more land so that he can increase his production.  This is Jhonatan's fifth MFP loan and he knows that he has to repay it in the agreed-upon time to secure future loans.  He is a responsible member of his community bank and committed to the well-being of the group.  He will use this two-thousand new soles loan to buy supplies to protect his crops against insects.

loans.use: Buy supplies for farming business to protect crops against insects.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres vive en casa propia en la zona de tembladerani de la ciudad de La paz con su hija menor; es viudo, tiene 74 años de edad y tiene un auto con el cual trabaja en transporte publico con el cual genera sus ingresos para subsistir.

El crédito que solicita es para reparar el motor y algunas otras partes de la movilidad que están fallando.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Andres lives with his young daughter in his own home within the Tembladerani zone of La Paz.  He is a 74 year old widower who uses his car to provide transportation services in order to generate income.

He will use the money from this loan to repair the engine and other parts of the car that have failed.

He has been an IMPRO client with a good payment record and is approved for a new loan.

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina, es socia del Bancomunal Imperios, tiene 38 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 16, 12 y 7 años.
Faustina tiene una ferretería, aprendió de éste negocio de una amiga, junto un capital inicial de S/.300.00 y comenzó a vender en la calle en el Jr. Grau. Ahora tiene un local alquilado en Enace, hace un tiempo sufrió un robo, pero poco a poco se está recuperando.El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para surtir su ferretería.
A Faustina le gusta las reuniones de su bancomunal porque puede ahorrar, su sueño es comprarse un carro para poder distribuir sus materiales de construcción y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Communal Bank “Imperios” (Empires). She is 38 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 12, and 7).

Faustina manages a hardware store. She learned about this business from a friend. With initial capital of 300 PEN, she began selling on the street in Jr. Grau. She is now in a rented location in Enace. On one occasion she was robbed, but she has been recovering little by little. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials to restock her hardware store.

Faustina enjoys the Communal Bank meetings because she is able to save. Her dreams include buying a car so that she can deliver construction materials and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase materials, bricks, and cement to sell at her hardware store

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua N. is married. Her husband is a technician.  Efua sells charcoal and fruits at Takoradi, which she has been doing for two years. Efua also assists her husband in the general upkeep of their home.

She is seeking a loan to purchase more charcoal for resale. With the new profits she expects from this expansion, Efua plans to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela has been practicing mixed farming for ten years now. She has a mixed farm in Kisii town in western Kenya that produces maize, tea, bananas and sugarcane, which are all sold locally. 

She has requested this loan of 45,000 KES through the Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve her family's livelihood.  She would like to expand her horticultural farming in the future to enable her to improve her income.

Pamela is 31 years old and married with three children who are between the ages of 4 and 12. Two of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn H., 52, is married and resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. 

H. is employed at the shoe factory, earning an income of $4 per day. Her husband is a lock repairman, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $32 on the other necessary expenses. 

H. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more locks and lock spare parts to resell and to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her fifth loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy locks and lock spare parts to improve her husband's business

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn M. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 36 years old, married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Ailyn raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Ailyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Ailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Ailyn is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be Ailyn's third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao K., 27, resides with her family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. K. is employed at a wooden furniture shop, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of USD 5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 5 on the other necessary expenses. 

K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to buy a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn B., age 32, earns her living by raising pigs for breeding. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. She is from the village of Rang-Ayan, Mallig, Isabela. Jovelyn and her husband have three school-aged children. 
 
In 2007, Jovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Jovelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the twelfth loan taken out by Jovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmer, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a 40-year-old single mother of six children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of looking after the family and her desire is to complete construction of her house and to educate her children. Margret sells fresh foods for a living and has been in this kind of business for 20 years. With her business income, she has been able to buy land, cattle and build a house. She faces the challenge of irregular sales. Her dream is to set up a food store. Margret is requesting a loan to buy fresh foods for resale.

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for resale

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 54 years old and married, with four children. Juditha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items like sardines, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

Juditha has already repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 19 years and also earns an income from ice cream making.

Juditha aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 42-year-old married man, living with his wife and four children in Saida. Mahmoud is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary wood for his business. This is Mahmoud's tenth loan with Al Majmoua, and all his previous loans were productive. 

Mahmoud is a hard-working man with a good reputation. He started his own business in 1987. He is working hard to expand his business in order to reach a size where he can retire and rest knowing that he has a small capital to rely on for the rest of his life, in addition to providing his children, Mohamad (20), Hussein (15), Fawziyah (16), and Aisha (15), with the best education and living standard.

Mahmoud hopes to expand his business so he can leave it to his kids when he dies.

loans.use: To buy wood necessary for manufacturing business.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy, de 32 años, es una valiente madre soltera, que cuida con mucho amor de su hija Katy, de 12 años. Con la que vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el caserío de Santo Domingo. Desde muy joven afrontó muchas responsabilidades; pues tenía que hacer frente a las responsabilidades de ser mamá. Comenzando así desde hace 12 años a sembrar papa, arveja, habas y lechuga, en sus terrenos propios; que heredó de parte de sus padres. Todas las mañanas se dedica a estas actividades, además que su tiempo lo dedica también a la ganadería, criando carneros, cerdos y vacas, que posee, alimentándolos hasta que estén gordos para luego venderlos a un mayor precio. Asimismo prepara queso con la leche que produce las vacas, realizando de 2 a 4 moldes diarios, obteniendo una ganancia de S/. 30 a S/.40 soles a la semana. Ahora se está preparando para la cosecha de maíz y lechuga, que dentro de un mes extraerá de sus tierras, de esa manera asegura una buena venta. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Santo domingo de Tapo”, y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde se agradece la oportunidad que le dieron de salir adelante. Susy, está pensando sembrar arveja, por ello con el crédito comprará semilla y varios sacos de abono orgánico, con los que comenzará a sembrar en la tierra ya preparada.
texts.en: Susy, 32 years old, is a brave single mother who lovingly looks after her 12-year-old daughter, Katy. The two of them live in her parents' house in the village of Santo Domingo. She has had a lot of responsibilities ever since she was young, since she had to face the obligations of becoming a mother. Twelve years ago she began growing potatoes, peas, beans, and lettuce on her own lands, which were passed down to her by her parents. She works in the fields every morning and also raises cows, pigs, and sheep, fattening them up so she can sell them at a higher price. She also makes cheese with the milk from her cows,  which earns her an additional 30 to 40 soles a week. Now she is getting ready to harvest the corn and lettuce crops, which will take place within a month so she can have good sales. She belongs to the village bank Santo Domingo de Tapo, and this is her first loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the opportunity they've given her to improve her lot in life. Susy is planning to plant peas, and will use the loan to buy seed and bags of organic fertilizer. She has already prepared the land for planting.

loans.use: purchase seed and bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and has 2 children. Rosemarie is 25 years old and has a child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rosemarie has a selling of softdrinks business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell to customers.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Zahara

texts.en:
Zahara, aged 30 is married to Nicholas and they are blessed with two children.She runs a salon business,which she has been doing for the last year. Zahara earns a monthly income of KES.20,000 from the business.

This is her second loan from KADET LTD. She has successfully repaid her previous loan.With the loan funds she will buy salon equipment like hair dryers, salon furniture and hair products.

Zahara intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and hopes to own a classic salon in the future.

loans.use: To buy salon equipment like hair dryers, salon furniture and hair products

loans.name: Yonny Alberto

texts.es:
Yonny siempre ha trabajado en el campo como administrador de fincas y conoce muy bien la producción de leche, luego de un tiempo Yonny decide dejar su empleo y comprar algunas vacas para comenzar su propio negocio.

Es por esto, que Yonny necesita no solo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia sino que necesita que su negocios crezca y para  esto va a comprar 2 vacas que le van a incrementar la producción de leche y así sus ingresos mejoraran.
texts.en:
Yonny has always worked in the fields running farms.  He is very knowledgeable about milk production.  After some time, Yonny decided to leave work and buy a few cows to start his own business.

Because of this, Yonny needs not only to improve his family’s quality of life but he also needs his business to grow and to accomplish this he will buy two cows that will increase milk production which will lead to improved income.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Juana De La Concepción tiene 61 años de edad, por lo que no es el primer financiamiento que realiza en Fundación León 2000 ya que han sido de gran ayuda para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio. Su actividad económica es una pulpería  ella ha ido aumentando su inventario, por lo que tenía mucha necesidad de obtener los productos necesarios y mejorar cada día en el servicio con sus clientes. Ella está solicitando este financiamiento para la compra de de gaseosas, jugos arroz, frijoles, aceite, leña, gas, jabón, detergente entre otros productos. Por lo que siempre sueña con que su negocio se mantenga activo y seguir adelante.
texts.en: Juana De La Concepción is 61 years old. This is not the first loan she has requested from Fundación León 2000, which has been a huge help in improving her business. Juana owns a grocery store and she has been expanding her inventory. She needs to get more essential products and improve the service she offers to her clients. She is asking for a loan in order to buy sodas, juice, rice, beans, oil, firewood, gas, soap, detergent and other products.  Her dream is that her business continues to succeed and grow.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juice, rice, beans, oil, firewood, gas, soap and detergent for her store.

loans.name: Aksante Mungu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Shabubake, leader du groupe d’affaire « Aksante Mungu »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est  pétrolière (vendeuse de carburant, essence, mazout en détail). En plus, elle vend aussi des souliers pour accroitre ses revenus. Son mari est un coiffeur, sociétaire d’un salon de coiffure (homme et dame). Elle installe ses marchandises au long de la boulevard  Karibu-Ulpgl. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec 8 bidons de pétrole (essence, mazout) et 10 pairs de souliers. En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et acheter une parcelle pour y construire confortablement. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Aksante Mungu» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Shabubake is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group "Aksante Mungu". She's 27 years old, married, and the mother of four children, who all attend school. She retails fuel, gasoline and heating oil. In addition, she also sells shoes to increase her income. Her husband is a hairdresser, he co-owns a hair salon for men and women.

Shabubake sets up her merchandise along the Karibu-Ulpgl boulevard. She's been running this business for more than five years. She just completed her tenth loan with Kiva's partner, Hekima. This new loan will help her to buy 8 cans of gasoline and heating oil, as well as ten pairs of shoes.

Furthermore, she ambitions to send her children to school and buy a land lot for construction. She thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor women who are excluded from classical banks. The business group "Aksante Mungu" is mostly made up of women.

loans.use: to buy 8 cans of gasoline and heating oil, as well as 10 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Jashan

texts.en:
Jashan is married and has three children, ages 7 to 28.  He sells fiber chemicals, does wiring, and welds. Jashan has been running this business for 15 years. He intends to use this loan to buy grinders to make his work more efficient. 

Jashan intends to use the profits from his business to pay for his children’s education. He hopes to own a private garage one day. Jashan describes himself as humble.

loans.use: to buy grinders to make his work more efficient.

loans.name: Ubaidullo

texts.ru:
Убайдулло порядочный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и ответственный отец 3 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, такие как морковь, кукурузы и разные виды фруктов. Он занимается этим бизнесом уже 7 лет и у него хороший опыт, чтобы расширить этот бизнес.  Убайдулло всегда хотел, чтобы его дети выросли хорошими людьми, стали образованными и культурными человеками. С этой целью он старается зарабатывать много денег, чтобы обеспечить все потребности и нужды своих детей. Чтобы все-все его мечты осуществились ему необходимо достаточный капитал, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и покупать минеральных удобрений, семена и горюче- смазочные материалы. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.
