And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Ubaidullo is a decent and honest man. He is married and is the responsible father of three children. He is involved in growing crops, such as carrots, corn and different kinds of fruit. He has been involved in this work for seven years and he has good experience in order to grow this business. Ubaidullo always wanted his children to grow up to be good people, to become educated and cultured folk. With this goal, he tries to make a lot of money to meet all the needs of his children. In order for all his dreams to come true, he needs enough capital to grow his business and to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, oil and lubricants. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers, seeds, oil and lubricants.

loans.name: 15 De Febrero Group

texts.es: Doña Carmen, es miembro del Grupo Solidario 15 de Febrero, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, y junto a su familia reside en la comunidad de Chiripa en el departamento de Colon. Carmen se dedica a la venta de comidas. Ella incursionó en el negocio de las comidas hace cuatro años y lo hizo porque tenia que participar y ayudar en una actividad escolar que consistia en la venta de hamburguesas, asi que como las ganancias fueron muy buenas, Carmen decidió dedicarse a esta actividad. Luego de unos años Ella instaló una pequeña galera en el patio frontal de su vivienda para vender comidas y golosinas, y aunque es un buen negocio practicamente pasa de pie todo el dia asi que termina sumamente cansada. Carmen tambien se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo, asi que mientras sus clientes esperan a que sus platillos esten listos, ella aprovecha y les muestra los catalogos. El prestamo que Carmen solicita lo necesita para comprar carnes, pollo, verduras, harina, maseca, refrescos, platos, cubiertos, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo Carmen podra surtir su negocio, ya que no cuenta con mucho capital para hacerlo y espera que este le genere las suficientes ganancias para cubrir sus gastos familiares y tambien el pago de las cuotas, y para ahorrar un poco porque su meta es aperturar una cafeteria en el centro de la comunidad. Este es el primer credito que recibe doña Carmen y se siente muy contenta porque podra mantener activo su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Carmen is a member of the February 15th Solidarity Group. She is married and has three children. Carmen and her family reside in the community of Chiripa in the Department of Colon. She earns her livelihood by selling food. Carmen started her business four years ago by helping out at a school event, which consisted of selling hamburgers. As a result, she earned very good profits, so Carmen decided to stay in this business. A few years later, she installed a small kitchen on the front patio of her house so that she could sell food and sweets. Her business requires her to be on her feet all day, so she is tired when her work ends. Carmen also sells cosmetics through catalogs. While her customers wait for their dishes to be prepared, she takes advantage of this time to show them catalogs.

The loan Carmen is requesting will be used to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, flour, cornmeal, soft drinks, plates, cutlery, and other supplies. With the support of this loan, Carmen will be able to restock her business since she does not have much capital to invest. She hopes that this will generate sufficient income to cover the family expenses and also complete her loan payments. Carmen is also saving a little bit of money because her goal is to open a cafeteria in the middle of her community. This is the first loan that Doña Carmen has received and she is very pleased because it will help her business remain active.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables, flour, cornmeal, soft drinks, plates, cutlery, and other supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three children.  Two of them attend school, while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a fish business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Rose dreams of expanding her business to increase sales. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

With the Kshs 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rhoda is 51 years old, married to Onesmus Mochama and together they have four children. Three of the children are already in college and one has completed. Her primary business is farming at Mwiki. She has been in the business for the past four years. Her monthly income is 6,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use it to purchase maize seeds and other farm implements. 

The anticipated profit will help her educate her children. Her hopes are to ensure all their children have completed their education through college.

loans.use: to buy more seeds and other farm implements

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old and a single mother of three.  She sells sand and ballast to earn a living.  She has been in the business for almost two years.  She has employed one person in her business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business with her loans.  Her desire is to expand the business further.

Eunice has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy sand and ballast.

loans.use: To buy sand and ballast.

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
The borrower is 39 years old. She is a widow with two children: one is younger than fifteen years. She has gone through very difficult times in her life like the death of her children and difficulties in single handedly caring for her children, theft and lack of capital with which to start a business of her own.

She joined GHAPE in 2010 and has received and repaid empowerment credit just once. She invested this loan in the sale of wood and the making of traditional dresses. She used the profits to feed, cloth and provide medication for her children.

Given a loan, she intends to buy and retail maize and also invest in her dress-making business. She believes that this business will succeed because it is well located and she has a good knowledge of this business. This business activity will be of great help to the community: her products will be  accessible to locals thereby saving the time it would have taken to buy them from the market. 

With the profit from her loan, she will open an account in the credit union where she will save some money. She will take care of her family and and also support her extended relatives. She prefers a GHAPE loan because the method of repayment is easier and because of the training that GHAPE gives its members.

loans.use: to buy maize, thread and fabric

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her four children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda requests a loan of 1,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an Envirofit cookstove.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to lessen the amount of firewood that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Luzviminda is aware that by using the envirofit cookstove, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase an envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Dan Mady

texts.fr: Monsieur Dan vit sur le territoire  Sénégalais depuis plusieurs années. Il y est marié et est  père d’un enfant d’un an.  Il évolue dans le secteur du commerce  et s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires dans le marché de la localité ou il vit. Il a choisi son activité par passion mais aussi dans le but d’aider sa famille a travers les profits que lui procure son activité. Il est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC  de la dite localité. Ill sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits alimentaires destinés à renforcer le stock de son local. Avec l’augmentation de son fond de roulement il compte accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. Dan has lived in Senegal for several years. He is married and has a 1-year-old child. He is involved in local commerce and has a business selling food products in the local market in the area where he lives. He chose this business both because of his passion for it and also in order to help his family through the profits he earns. He is a member of the local branch of U-IMCEC in his area. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 Frs destined to buy food products in order to increase his stocks. By increasing his working capital, he intends to raise his profits and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy and re-sell food products.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is 39 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Melvin owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests rice to sell. She has been farming for five years. She earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

Melvin is requesting a loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Melvin has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and pay for school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

location.town: Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 60 years old and married. She has owned rental houses for the last 20 years, and earns an income of KES 50,000 each month.

This is loan, from KADET LTD., is her first loan. She will use the entire loan to renovate her rental houses.

With the anticipated profits, she will purchase a plot and build more houses. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Lercy

texts.es: Lercy es una confeccionista que tiene mucha calidad en sus prendas, ella se esmeró y lo aprendió en su proceso de formación en diseño de modas, iniciado cuando llegó desde Ayapel, municipio donde nació en el departamento de Córdoba, el departamento ganadero por excelencia. Para Lercy, madre de dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 19 años, no todo ha sido fácil, ella debió esmerarse por responder a los desafíos que la vida le propuso y con su negocio de confecciones, ha logrado salir adelante. Desde  hace 15 años inició con su negocio de confecciones después de haber estudiado, confeccionando ropa sobre medidas de sus primeros clientes, que estaban conformados por sus vecinos, amigos y familiares, posteriormente ha logrado perfeccionar su arte hasta convertirlo en su mejor empresa, pues no solo genera ingresos que apoyan el bienestar de su hogar sino también genera empleos, porque con ella trabajan dos mujeres,  que hacen parte de sus operaciones; aunque Lercy es quien más trabaja, pues como ella dice, no tiene horarios. En la actualidad aunque atiende a clientes uno a uno, sobre medidas, también posee contratos con colegios, en la ciudad y en su natal Ayapel.  Su infraestructura ha ido poco a poco creciendo, de su máquina sencilla, ha pasado a tener 3 industriales y en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará una máquina industrial para optimizar los tiempos productivos y aumentar su producción, así mismo invertirá en telas para hacer los vestidos de grado productos de un contrato que ganó en el departamento de Cordoba.
texts.en: Lercy is a garment manufacturer whose garments are of high quality. She worked hard and learned the trade while studying fashion design when she arrived from the municipality of Ayape in the department of Cordobal, where she was born. Cordoba is well-known for its livestock rearing par excelence. Not everything has been easy for Lercy, a mother of 2 children aged 9 and 19 years. She had to work hard to overcome life's challenges and with her garment business has managed to get ahead. She started her business 15 years ago after finishing her training, sewing made-to-measure clothes for her first customers who were her neighbours, friends and relatives. Subsequently she perfected her craft to set up her best company as it not only generates income which ensures the well-being of her household but also generates jobs as 2 women work for her and form a part of her operations; although Lercy is the one who works the most as she says she has no schedule. Currently alhtough she sees clients one-on-one, about measurements, she also has contracts with schools in the city and in her native Ayapel. Her infrastructure has grown little by little, from her simple  sewing machine to having 3 industrial type machines. She is currently applying for her first loan with Kiva with which she will buy an industrial type machine to optimize production times and increase production. She will also invest in fabrics to make grade dresses, garments for a contract she won in the department of Cordoba.

loans.use: to buy an industrial type machine to optimize production time.

loans.name: Nkorias

texts.en:
Nkorias is 43 years old, married together with his wife they have four children. He is a wheat and maize farmer who has been farming for the last fifteen years.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals such as goats and sheep. He hopes to make a profit and to use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

In the future he hopes to open up another business. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maripaz

texts.en: Maripaz is 39 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the village of Rizal in Cauayan city. She has been running her hog-raising business for over four years. She earns about PHP 7,000 per piglet. She wants to have more piglets to raise, but she lacks the necessary capital. Therefore, Maripaz is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs. She hopes this will make them fit and nourish them so she can sell them at higher prices, and she hopes to grow her business to secure her family's living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccines for her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong, 62, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been running a grocery store for over ten years and are successful in their career. Three of her children are employed at a factory in Phnom Penh. Selling groceries is the main source of income for the family. In order to improve her family economy, Kong is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase more groceries to sell to generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and support her children to study higher.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Werekela, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, DJENEBA N’GNANTJI première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de mil.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 98,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to be the biggest supplier of fish within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.en: Yesenia Guadamó, a 29 year-old single mother originally from Vinces, Ecuador, has lived in Guayaquil for 15 years. Since she and her husband split, she has been responsible for their two children ages 6 and 7. A good friend of Yesenia’s encouraged her to open a fish market, and so she started a small business a few years back. Sra. Guadamaó opens shop at 4:00 am and usually sells out by 1:00 pm. With her revenues from one day, Yesenia will buy fish for the next, but she would like to expand her offering by taking out a $365 loan. She wants to buy seafood like fish, shrimp, and shellfish like crab and scallops. This microloan will allow Yesenia to buy in cash, whereas now she currently purchases goods on credit for a one-day period and pays nearly double to settle the debt. She wants to strengthen her business and build a board with which she can display her fish. One of the side benefits of making more profit is that Yesenia can save enough money to fix the roof of her house and send her children to a better school.

loans.use: Purchase more diverse supply of fish; Market products better with display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: PURCHASE A DAIRY COW

loans.name: Demeteria

texts.en: Demeteria is married with two children, both grown up and married. She started her business last year to support herself. She finished her first loan successfully. This is her second loan with PEMCI. Her first loan enabled her to increase her stock and even open up a cereal store at her home. She takes the cereals to the market during market days in addition to her fish business. With the second loan of $225 she wishes to increase her stock further and also buy tobacco from the local farmers in her community and sell it to the factory at a higher price since it’s the season of harvesting tobacco.

loans.use: Purchase cereals and tobacco to sell

loans.name: Mohammad Rahim

texts.en: M. Rahim lives in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with all the members of his family. He is educated, but he is also a tailor and wants to continue his tailoring. He wants to take an individual loan to buy machines and extra materials for his shop and also he wants to change the design of his shop to attract more clients and make a good income to help his family and support them better. He is happy now that he can help them.

loans.use: To buy machines and extra materials

loans.name: Nery Liduvina

texts.es:
My name is Nery H. and I have been selling tortillas for five and a half years. Here you can see me in my newly remodeled stand. It used to be wooden but now it is made of cinderblocks. My daughters help me in the shop. We sell tortillas to people from the neighborhood and surrounding area. Right now I need to buy firewood, corn and salt. Thanks to this business I can support my family and put my daughters through school.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Mi mombre es Nery H., me dedico a la venta de tortillas tengo mi negocio hace 5 años imedio. Como ustedes puede ver remodele mi negocio ya que antes era de madera con la ayuda de ustedes he podido hacer mi negocio de bloques. En el negocio tengo la ayudade mis hijas para vender a mis clientes ya que son mis vecinos de mi colonia y otras personas que que viven al rededor de la colonia. Ahora nesecito comprar mas productos como: Leña, maiz y sal. Gracias a este negocio he podido ayudar a mi familia y mis hijas con su estudio.

loans.use: To buy corn, salt, lye and firewood.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo is a milk producer and has a small vegetable farm. He sells both products in the city of La Paz., Bolivia. Sales from these two activities constitutes his income with which he supports his 4 children and wife. He lives in the town of Palomar Rio. Palomar is two hours south of La Paz.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow of an ordinary breed, so he can increase milk production and improve his income. This is Guillermo's first loan with IMPRO, but he has been approved for a loan in the credit evaluation process.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermo es productor de leche de vaca y pequeño agricultor de hortalizas, las mismas que son comercializadas en la ciudad de La Paz. Los ingresos provenientes de estas dos actividades constituyen su principal ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus 4 hijos y esposa. Vive en la Comunidad de Palomar Rio – Palomar, al Sur de La Ciudad de La Paz (A dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca de raza mediana para incrementar la producción de leche y así mejorar sus ingresos. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: My name is Kalsoom B.. I am married and I live with my family in Arifwala, a small city in Pakistan. I am a mother of seven children, all of whom attend school. My husband sells steel utensils and I own a few cows and I sell their milk. Last year, I took a loan and added a cow to the existing ones. The profits out of this business helped me enroll my children in school and pay off debts to one of the money lenders. Now, I want to buy another cow for my business. This way my income will increase significantly and I will make savings for my children’s future.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine K. is requesting a loan to allow her to open a new selling space beside her existing store where she sells fish and operates a restaurant.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Sukamah

texts.en: Sukamah, 47, and her husband, D., works as a brick printer and earn $75 a month. She requests a loan of $100 to expand her business and as a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Juan Luis

texts.es:
"With some sacrifice I was able to install protective metal grilles in the windows of my house; but now I need to install a metal grille in my house's main entrance. The area where I live with my family is a little unsafe because there are many young vagrants who break into the houses to rob, so I decided to work to ensure my family's safety". I'm asking for $500.00 in order to install a protective metal grille in my house's main entrance.

Translate from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva Volunteer

“Con algunos sacrificios logre poner las protecciones a las ventanas de mi vivienda, pero ahora necesito poner reja en la puerta principal, este fraccionamiento en donde vivo con mi familia es un poco inseguro ya que hay muchos muchachos vagos que se dedican a robar en las casas así es que yo decidí poner a salvo a mi familia”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner reja en la puerta principal de mi vivienda

loans.use: To install a protective metal grille in my house's main entrance

loans.name: Koku

texts.en:
Koku is 35 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 15 and 12 years old. Koku owns a small cafe, which she started in 2000. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $850 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more comodities for her business.

loans.use: To buy more comodities for her business.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is married with four children, aged 3 to 19 years. Mwanahawa owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $315 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
Dulce has always liked cooking, which is why she established a food preparation and sales business in her house 6 years ago. She started selling food to her acquaintances and neighbors. With the income generated from the business, she helps her husband cover the household expenses, as well as pay for her 4 children’s schooling.

She currently needs a loan of $250.00 USD, which she will repay in 3 months, so that she can buy an industrial stove because it is difficult to use big pots on the stove she currently has. Furthermore, the new stove will have a greater capacity, which means that she will be able to prepare more meals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Dulce, siempre le ha gustado la cocina, por loq ue haqce 6 años emprendio en su casa un negocio, preparar comidas para vender, inicio entre sus vecinos de la colonia y conocidos, con los ingresos ayuda con los gastos de su casa a su esposo, y pagan los estudios de sus 4 hijos

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar una estufa industrial por que la que tiene es normal, y se le dificulta subir y bajar las ollas grandes, ademas de que la nueva estuvo tendra mas capacidad, por o que podra preparar mas platillos.

loans.use: Purchase industrial stove

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 25 years old. He lives in a small village close to the city of Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Ali owns a small barbershop. Ali is also engaged, and will be married soon. He would like a loan of $1000 in order to renovate and repair his house, which was damaged in the July War of 2006. Ali has requested a loan before and paid it back on time, and takes the matter of repayment very seriously.

loans.use: To renovate and repair his house, which was damaged in the war.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 28, is married with two kids in school. She has been selling grocery products like rice, fresh tomatoes, tinned tomatoes, cocoa products, skimmed milk, body pomade, etc. in the market of Koforidua, Ghana, for five years. Her experience in business has made her one of the most successful entrepreneurs in the market.

Elizabeth considers this loan a great opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by customers. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables, and palm oil to increase her stock of goods available for sale.

Elizabeth belongs to the community group called “Ebe ba mu Trust Group” (It shall come to pass). In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and assist each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of milk, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetables, and palm oil

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
For a year, Miriam has painted pictures and decorative plates. She works in her house making these types of handicrafts from Trupan wood in order to sell them later with her husband and friends. She sells decorative plates, coat racks, and handpainted pictures.

Miriam ran a bookstore in her mother's house but she had to close it as it was far from her house and her children.

She has invested the loans she has received in the purchase of wood and painting materials. Miriam would like to have her own shop from which she could sell her decorative products.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam pinta cuadros y plato decorativos desde hace 1 año. Ella trabaja en su casa haciendo esta clase de manualidades en madera Trupan, para luego venderlas por medio de su esposo y amigos. Ofrece platos decorativos, percheros y cuadros pintados a mano. Miriam tenía una librería en la casa de su mamá, pero tuvo que cerrarla debido a que le quedaba muy lejos de su casa y de sus hijos. Los préstamos que ha obtenido los ha invertido en la compra de la madera y los materiales de pintura. A Miriam le gustaría tener un local propio donde vender sus productos de decoración.

loans.use: Purchase wood and painting materials.

loans.name: Catherine J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 31 year old Catherine N.. She is married with three children, aged 2, 6, and 9. In 1998, Catherine established a "genge" business. She is assisted by her husband. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about $170 a month from this business. Catherine has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requires a loan to renovate the business. In the future, Catherine also plans to invest in other businesses. She thanks you for your support.

Genge is a Swahili word for a type of outside shop, or stall. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, that sells general items, such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don't have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To renovate her business.

loans.name: Tupendane Group

texts.en: Fat-Hiya is a 23 year old mother of three.  Her children are 1, 3 and 5 years old.  She started selling charcoal this year from 6:30 am to 6 pm.  She earns $140 per month.  This will be her first loan from BRAC Tanzania.

loans.use: To expand her business into other products

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor  es productor de leche de vaca que comercializa a la empresa acopiadora  PIL Andina para la transformación en productos derivados como ser yogurt, mantequilla y otros productos; la esposa ayuda con la crianza de las vacas y la alimentación de las mismas. Esta actividad constituye su principal fuente de ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos. Vive en la comunidad Irama belen – Achacachi de la Provincia Omasuyo (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz).

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana calidad para que incremente su producción leche.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Víctor is a dairy farmer, supplying PIL Andina, a company that makes dairy products such as yogurt and butter. His wife helps to care for and feed the cows. Dairy farming is their principle source of income and helps them cover the costs of supporting their three children. He lives in the community of Irama belen in Achacachi, located in the province of Omasuyo (three hours from the city of La Paz). The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality so he can increase overall milk production. This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation conducted by Impro qualifies him to be granted the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a medium quality dairy cow to increase overall milk production

loans.name: Mrs. Soeurn Nem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn N. is the leader of an eleven-member group. All the members live in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Soeurn N. is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Some Phon, gathers firewood and sells it in the local village. They have six children; two children are employed in a garment factory, and the others attend the local school. Even though Mrs. Soeurn N. and her family members earn income from different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house. To provide better living conditions, Mrs. Soeurn N. requests a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: Add to savings to build a new house for the family

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua A., a 33-year-old young woman, is married, blessed with four children, and is a very hard-working trader. She enjoys selling and cosmetics sales have been her major source of livelihood for the past eighteen years. She says the selling of cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. 
Her shop is located at a strategic place in the market; fortunately she is the first contact on entering the community market where she sells. 
Akua believes that with the loan, she would be more resourced to purchase more stock of cosmetics like pomade, hair cream, lipsticks and jewelery to increase her inventory and her income for that matter. Akua also sees it as a need to add other things that her customers ask for frequently such as vegetables like onions and peppers.  
She is a member of a group called Adehye Trust Group. 
Her picture was taken when she was busily serving a customer in the market place of Babiani where she sells.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetic products and vegetables.

loans.name: Noyma Edid

texts.es:
Noyma es socia del Bancomunal Los viñedos
Noyma es de Ancash, tiene 38 años, casada tiene dos hijos de 10 y 3 años  que están en el colegio, 
Noyma estudio para asistenta dental como no conseguía trabajo, se fue a provincia a trabajar por un tiempo, pero tuvo que regresar por que es casada, con su esposo decidieron poner un taller de soldadura y mecánica en el garaje de su casa, “Auto Servicio Anthony “ ya tienen ocho años en el negocio, ahora han entrado en el negocio de compra y venta de autos usados, ya vendieron dos carros.
Desde que esta en Finca, siente un respaldo y trabaja tranquila por los prestamos, ha aprendido ha ser responsables.  

Necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  la compra de aceites para autos, pinturas para carro entre otros cosas.
El sueño que tiene es ella y su esposo es poner su laboratorio dental, ambos son mecánico dental, está programando dentro de un año alquilar un local.
texts.en:
Noyma is a member of the "Los viñedos" community bank. She is from Ancash, is 38 years old, married and has two children aged 10 and three who attend school. Noyma studied to be a dental assistant but because she could not find work, moved to the country to work for a short time but then had to return because she is married. She and her husband decided to open a welding and auto repair shop in the garage of their home; they called the business "Auto Servicio Anthony". They have owned this business for eight years and are now starting a business buying and selling used cars: they have already sold two cars. Since joining Finca she has felt their support and is able to work without worrying thanks to the loans; she has learned to be responsible. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 soles to buy car oil and car paint among others. She dreams that she and her husband will be able to open a dental laboratory: both are dental technicians. She has plans to rent a location within the next year.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy car oil and car paint among other items.

loans.name: Jazmines Group

texts.es: Las socias D.  la banca comunal "Jazmines" estan representadas por la señora Lourdes y son socias que  se conocen entre si ya que residen en el mismo barrio,  existe un parentesco consanguíneo entre la señora Santa Cecilia y Florencia las cuales son hermanas pero ambas cuentan con ingresos totalmente independientes por lo que no existe riesgo en el grupo. En cuanto al rubro que desempeñan es más del ámbito comercial y venden productos como comida, ropa, cosméticos por catálogos y al transporte público .en cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que ellas están conscientes D. la misma y también mencionan que la capacidad D. administrar bien el crédito, favorece para mejorar su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.  El crédito que se les otorgó  esta destinado para aumentar su mercadería, comprar material D. trabajo y compra D. herramientas para desempeñar mejor sus funciones. Efectivamente las socias comentan que ya tuvieron créditos anteriores  en otras entidades financieras similares y una mayoría D. las socias ya estuvieron con otros grupos en la fundación agrocapital demostrando responsabilidad y cumplimiento en sus planes D. pagos.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Jazmines' community bank are represented by Lourdes. The members know each other well as they live in the same neighbourhood. There is a blood relationship between the members Santa Cecilia and Florencia, who are sisters, however both have incomes completely independent of each other and so there is no risk of dependence within the group. The members mostly work in the commercial sphere, selling products such as food, clothing and cosmetics by catalogue, or offering public transport services. In terms of competition, it can be said that the members are conscious of this, and they also mention that their capacity to manage credit well helps them to improve their businesses and increase their income. This loan will be used to expand their merchandise, buy materials for work, and buy tools to better carry out their services. The members say that they have previously received loans from other similar financial entities, and a majority of the members have previously participated in other groups with the Agrocapital Foundation, thus demonstrating responsibility and commitment in making their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva E. is a "sari-sari" (general) store owner. She is 37 years old and has 2 children. Her husband, Presco E., is a farmer. They work together to support the needs of their family. She started her store in 1997 and her business is doing so well that she is planning to make it larger to store more goods for sale. All of her children are studying; she uses her income to pay the school fees like tuition, books, laboratory, and other school projects. She wants her children to graduate in college for them to have a better life when they are old.

Eva is asking a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock for her store. In that way, she said, "I could have more customers. The loan will truly help me grow my business."

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines that helps people start and have their own business. They not only provide credit to their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El señor Sergio tiene una familia integrada por 2 hijos y su esposa la señora Juana; el señor trabaja para Comisión Federal de Electricidad desde hace 11 años, su esposa es pequeña comerciante ya que vende zapatos por catalogo.
Están solicitando este crédito para construir un portal en el frente de su casita para mayor comodidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio has a family comprised of 2 children and his wife, Juana. He has worked for the Federal Electrical Commission for the past 11 years. His wife is a merchant who sells shoes by catalog. They are requesting this loan in order to build an entrance at the front of their house, so the family can live more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a front entrance for their house.

loans.name: Aliyu

texts.en: Aliyu is 31 years old and he is married with 3 children. He sells dried fish. He purchases the dried fish from the northern part of Nigeria to sell in Benin city, Edo state. He hopes for the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more dried fish to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro V. tiene 64 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad.

El Señor Pedro se dedica a la producción de ladrillos, a base de barro cocido, que es utilizado como material principal en la construcción de una casa.

Empezó esta actividad con su padre, ya que se dedicaba a la misma actividad, quien al fallecer le dejó dicho trabajo aparte del inmenso conocimiento.

En la actualidad es una de las olerías (como es llamada en la zona a esta actividad) más importante ya que produce aproximadamente 35 a 40 mil ladrillos en forma mensual. Su éxito se debe a que los ladrillos que produce, son los más resistentes y de mejor calidad.
Gracias a este trabajo logró hacerse de casa propia, vivir dignamente y a la vez dar trabajo a personas de la zona.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de trapiche, que es utilizado para mezclar el barro, materia prima principal para la elaboración de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro V. is 64 years of age and has four children, all adults. He works making bricks, made of fired earthenware, which are used as the principal material in the construction of a house. Pedro started out in this trade with his father, who was in this business, and when he passed away he left Pedro this business as well as his immense knowledge. Presently, it is one of the most important "olerías" (which is what they call the area where this work is done) since it produces approximately 35-40,000 bricks per month. His success is due to the bricks that he produces which are the most durable and best quality. Thanks to this work he has been able to build his own house, to live with dignity and at the same time to provide employment for people in the surrounding area. The loan being requested is for the repair of the "trapiche" which is used to mix the earth, the main raw material for producing the bricks.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the mixer.

loans.name: Tilobat

texts.ru: Тилобат работает преподавателем в средней общеобразовательной школе. Она преподает английский язык. Ей 41 год, замужем, имеет 3 детей. В свободные дни покупает косточки от абрикосов, перерабатывает их и потом продает. Кроме того занимается откормом скота дома, в чем помогает ее муж и старший сын. Для развития своего бизнеса Тилобат решила подать заявку на займ КИВА и собирается купить абрикосовые косточки оптом.
texts.en:
Tilobat teaches English at a public middle school. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. On days off she buys apricot pits to process and sell. She also raises livestock at home, which her husband and older son help with. To expand her business Tilobat decided to apply for a loan from Kiva. She plans to buy apricot pits wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Mrs. Arsenia M. owns and operates a business in picture wood lamination earning 8,000 per month. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Until now, her business has been doing well and she dreams that she could still have more customers. She is 67 years of age, married and blessed with four children who are now adults. She lives in Landing, Baliangao Misamis Occidental.

Mrs. M. has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since February 5, 2001. Recently, she's taken out her 18th loan of 10,000 PHP needed for additional capital and materials for her business. Her wish is to continue to support the daily needs of her family and that her children could finish their studies until college and some day find decent and stable jobs.

loans.use: Materials for a wood lamination business

loans.name: United Group

texts.en: Mamie W. has a table in the market where she sells small, small things (oil, rice, fish, etc), which she has managed since the beginning of the Liberian civil war in 1990. She’s the mother of five children and her youngest is 9 months old. She resides within the Motorkono Community and dreams of improvement in her business.

loans.use: To buy more oil, rice, fish, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La señora Gregoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Chua Chua”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad D. Chua Chua,  distrito D. Zepita, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 46 años D. edad, estado civil casada, es madre D. 5 hijos y tiene estudios D. secundaria incompleta (4to grado), vive en la Comunidad D. Chua Chua Sector Pampa D. Chua chua.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 1 año,  su préstamo inicial fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó  para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado menor, y compra D. verduras, como cebolla, zanahoria, apio, lechugas, zapallo, etc.

Su deseo es construir su casa en Puno, ya cuenta con el terreno.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las facilidades en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gregoria is a member of the communal bank “Santa Cruz D. Chua Chua” which is located in the Chua Chua neighborhood of Zepita, in the Chucuito province, in Puno. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Mrs. Gregoria studied up through the fourth graD.. She lives in the Pampa area of Chua Chua. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for a year now. Her first loan was for 300 soles and she used it to buy small livestock. Right now, she needs a loan of 500 soles to buy small livestock and vegetables like onions, carrots, celery, lettuce, pumpkins, etc. She would also like to build a house in Puno and already has the land. Mrs. Gregoria loves to save and she loves the ease of these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy onions, carrots, celery, lettuce, pumpkins, etc.

loans.name: Lydia Yunieth

texts.es: Lydia Yunieth P. Pérez tiene 27 años de edad. Su actividad económica es la venta de mársicos. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo que dependen de ella. Es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que todos los días recorre algunas calles y comarcas, porque la mayoría de sus clientes son de las comarcas. A pesar de que todos los días camina muchos kilómetros le gusta mucho su trabajo. Anteriormente su Mama se dedica a este negocio, pero Lydia con muchas ganas de ayudar decide hacerse cargo de este negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de camarones, punches, conchas, chuletas, pescado y langostas. Su mayor sueño es que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Lydia Yunieth P. Pérez is 27 years old and has 3 dependent children. She is a responsible and hardworking young woman who sells seafood door-to-door. She travels through the streets and neighboring regions where most of her customers are located. Despite the amount of walking she does every day, she enjoys her work tremendously. Her mother was previously engaged in this same business, so Lydia worked as her assistant before taking it over.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy shrimp, shellfish, fillets, fish, and lobsters. Her greatest hope is that her children have everything they need.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Rosemelita

texts.en:
Rosemelita is a vegetable vendor, selling her own harvested vegetables in their village. She wants to increase her merchandise and so she would like to borrow PHP 6,000. With the loan, she can start to buy more vegetables that she can sell not only in their village but also in the market for a bigger income. She is hoping that lenders will grant her request for her business to become sustainable.

Rosemelita lives peacefully in their village of Capellan, Ilagan, Isabela, together with her husband who patiently works as a farmer. They have five children and two are still studying.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ruhayima

texts.en: Ruhayima is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, a son and three daughters who are all in school. She is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings by the roadside in her community. She procures her raw materials from nearby towns. Ruhayima has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Animonyam Group

texts.en:
David is 55 years old he is married with eight children. Currently seven children are in school. He is a chemical seller and sells various kinds of drugs like blood tonic, pain killers, malaria drugs etc. in his neighborhood. He has been in business for six years now and he is among the people who supply pharmaceutical products in the community. His chemical shop is registered to operate by Ghana pharmaceutical council. He wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of drugs to include others that are frequently demanded by his customers. He hopes to raise good income to take care of his family. He would be grateful for your assistance.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Animonyam’ which literary means God’s glory. He is the one sitting in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers etc. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Fe Y Alegria Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal “Fe y Alegría” están representadas por la señora Karina y conformada por 12 miembros que radican en el mismo barrio, todas tienen negocios propios, pero una mayoría se dedica a la venta D. comida, joyas, celulares y joyas pero en general comida D. todo tipo ambulante y en puestos fijos. El entorno competitivo en el negocio es granD. pero depenD. mucho del gusto con que se prepare la comida la higiene y la experiencia en el negocio como lo han demostrado en los años anteriores. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. puestos fijos, compra D. insumos, y nuevas herramientas para realizar su trabajo con más eficiencia como una cortadora D. papas, cocinas, etc. para hacer crecer sus negocios y obtener mejores ingresos para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias van cursando un ciclo mas dentro D. la institución demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que saben como manejar bien sus fondos para que estos generen un mayor beneficio para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The members of the comunal bank "Fe y Alegría" are represented by Karina. The group is maD. up of 12 members that are from the same neighborhood and all of whom have their own businesses; however the majority are involved in selling food, jewelry, cellular phones, but mainly food as street vendors or in fixed locations. The competitive environment for the businesses is fierce but success depends on how the food is prepared, hygiene and experience in the business. The loan is to be used for the acquisition of fixed booths, the purchase of ingredients and new tools to perform their work with more efficiency, such as potato cutters, kitchens, etc. to allow their businesses to grow and earn larger incomes to proviD. their families with a better quality of life. In terms of the credit history of the members, they have demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in their payments showing that they know how to manage their funds to generate a higher income for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter has been running his retail store in Njabini, in the outskirts of Naivasha Town, for the last five years. He is 32 years old, married to Gladys Wangari, and has a 9-month-old baby boy. Peter was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his 6th loan from the organization. With the loan, Peter plans to buy more retail stock (in bulk which will be cheaper for him) to sell in his shop. Peter hopes to one day open a supermarket in Njabini. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy retail goods in bulk to sell at his shop

loans.name: José Jaime

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a 3 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se gana la vida trabajando en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), empezó alquilando una y luego con mucho esfuerzo puedo comprar la suya. Con el paso del tiempo ahorró nuevamente y adquirió otra unidad que es trabajada por un familiar. Usualmente se dedica a transpotar a sus clientes dentro de la misma zona e incluso llevarlos a ciudades y pueblos cercanos. Las ganancias de este negocio constituyen su única fuente estable de ingreso familiar.

El nos comenta que durante las temporadas navideñas compra panetones y los distribuye en su mototaxi por los pueblos situados alrededor del distrito. La temporada navideña ya empezó y el ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para empezar a trabajar nuevamente en este negocio.

Su más grande anhelo es poder instalar un puesto de abarrotes en el mercado de la ciudad y también adquirir un lote donde pueda construir su casa propia. El es un padre trabajador y responsable que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
José is a 27-year-old, married, father of a 4-year-old son who lives with his family in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, which is 3 hours away from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 6 years he has earned his livelihood driving a mototaxi (motorized vehicle used in the transport of passengers and cargo). He began with a leased one and, after much effort, was able to buy his own. As time went by, he saved up again and bought a second unit, which is operated by a relative. Usually, he transports his customers within the same area and even takes them to nearby cities and towns. The profits from this work is his only stable source of income to support his family. He tells us that during the Christmas season he buys panetones (an Italian sweet bread which is a Christmastime staple) which he distributes among the towns around his district. The Christmas season has already begun and he thought it convenient to request help, for the first time, from Edpyme Alternativa, in the form of a 1000 new sol loan to start this activity again. His greatest desire is to set up a grocery stall in the city market and to acquire a lot where he can build his own house. He is a hard-working, responsible father who always tries his best to ensure that his loved ones get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy panetones to distribute from his mototaxi during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Lovelina

texts.en: Lovelina is 35 years old and married with six children who are all excelling in school. Her husband is a pastor and she makes and sells local soaps called 'soda'. She is very happy because she is able to make local soap that is highly demanded in her community in Benin City, Edo state. Lovelina hopes for a loan amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more materials to make more local soaps to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make more local soaps to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from the village of Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 45 years old. Victoria is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector, selling AVON cosmetics and apparel. The main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics, apparel, and home products to tourists and local community members. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly comprised of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma O. is 19 years old and has a farm. She says that, when she started her business, she failed because she was not familiar with managing a rice farm. Through experience, she has gained knowledge. Now, she needs additional capital to run and sustain her business. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies so that she can increase her harvest. Her family relies on the income of the farm, so she is doing her best to make it productive.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Jean

texts.en: Jean is a 27-year-old man. He has been working as a farmer since 2002. His region is specified I agriculture. He learned this job a long time ago. Today, Jean is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy agriculture products and supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: To buy agriculture products and supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La señora Verónica V. M. es esposa del señor Eduardo y son una familia muy trabajadora y responsable ellos iniciaron un negocio de abarrotes establecido desde hace 3 años, el cual ha dado fruto ya que son preferidos por sus clientes, están tramitando este crédito para la inversión en la compra de mercancía por mayoreo y así obtener una mayor ganancia.
texts.en:
Verónica V. M. is the wife of Eduardo, and they are a very responsible and hardworking family. They started up a grocery store 3 years ago, and this investment has borne fruit, since they are preferred by their customers. They are taking out this loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise at wholesale so that they can have increased earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in the business (grocery store) by buying more merchandise

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em Y., age 39, is married and lives with his wife in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has three school-aged children. He transports passengers on his motorbike in the city, earning approximately $10.00 in revenue per day. He has been in this business since 2000. His wife is employed in a local soymilk factory and she is able to earn an income of $4.00 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Their standard of living has improved since they started these businesses, so they want a loan to expand their businesses. Y. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to repair his old motorbike and attach a passenger compartment to it. He wants to become a tuk-tuk driver because he thinks that this business will allow him to earn more income. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: To repair his motorbike and attach a passenger compartment

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mr. Kang C. is 49 years old, married, and a father. He presently lives with his wife and his kids in a small house located along the river, where he earns a living by fishing. He wakes up while it is still dark in the morning to prepare his tools, and then he goes to the middle of the river where he fishes. After his fishing is finished, he hurries to take his fish to his wife for selling in the busy market. Normally the family hires a taxi to deliver their fish to the market because they do not have a vehicle. Kang C. is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle in order to supply the transportation. (Kang C. was busy at his business operation when the photo was taken so his wife is shown instead.)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ragaya

texts.en:
Ragaya R. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and beans to sell.  Ragaya is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has nine children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal and beans to sell

loans.name: Maritchel

texts.en: Maritchel A. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 28 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Maritchel owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling specialty food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Maritchel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Maritchel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Erling Alexander

texts.es: Erling Alexander habitante de Nueva Guinea es casado con la joven Neysi con quien tiene un niño pequeño. Desde muy pequeño se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de taxis en este municipio, actividad que le enseño su papá  quien trabajaba en esta misma actividad. Ademas realizar viaje a San Carlos en donde obtiene ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  Está solicitando su 1er crédito a la institución de AFODENIC  para realiza mejora a su taxi,  para asi brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida  y que a su hijo no le falte nada y que cuando sea grande pueda coronar una carrera que le permita trabajar. Erling se caracteriaza por ser muy responsable  y honesto.
texts.en:
Erling Alexander lives in Nueva Guinea, he is married to Neysi and they have a small child. From a young age he drove taxis in his municipality; he was taught to drive by his father who also works as a taxi driver. He also travels to San Carlos where he gets additional income to sustain his family. Erling is asking for his first loan with AFODENIC (Kiva’s field partner) to make repairs to his taxi and so that he can give better service to his customers. His biggest dream is to be able to give his family better living conditions, that his son will not need anything and that when he is older he can have a career that will allow him to work. Erling is characterized by being very responsible and honest.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blocking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not disclosing his/her location and name, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

This borrower from Lebanon is a 30-year old single man who lives with his parents and one sibling. He and two members of his family work to generate income for their household.

The borrower has five years of experience working as a van driver and has owned his van since 2007. He has been a client of Kiva partner, Ameen, for several years and this loan will be his second Kiva loan. He was able to complete the remaining payments of his first loan early and is now requesting a loan of $1,200 so he can buy a new engine for his van.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his van

loans.name: Arc-En-Ciel Plus Group

texts.en:
Barli is the leader of a community bank named “Arc-En-Ciel Plus”, which means “Rainbow” in English and is composed of 23 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.

Barli is 44 years old and the father of five children ages 3 to 16. Three of them attend school. 

Barli runs a service of charging batteries. He has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1985. He runs his business in the Middle Eastern area of Kinshasa. 

He is working hard because his ambition is to become an excellent battery charger service in his area. The loan he’ll obtain next will be used to buy 50 liters of battery acid and some accessories for his service with the aim of increasing the profits. 

Since he wants to develop and diversify his business, he decided to join one of Hope’s groups in October 2009. Currently, he makes a profit of about $180 per week. Barli has succeeded with good strategies to build up permanent customers. He always talks with his customers, he knows them well by their names, and he never runs out of stock.

loans.use: To purchase 50 liters of battery acid to resell with the aim of generating the profit

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es productor lechero y a la vez trabaja como albañil, siendo estas actividades sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la comunidad Arasaya Chico de Achacachi, a dos horas de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar su producción de leche.
 
Es segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo
texts.en:
Edgar is a milk producer and occasionally works as a bricklayer. These activities are the main sources of income by which he supports his family. His home is located in the community of Arasaya Chico de Achacachi, which is two hours away from the city of El Alto.

This loan will be used to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase his milk production. He is requesting his second loan with IMPRO. His good payment history allows him to request another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Josefina Hortencia

texts.es: Josefina es de 30 años de edad, es casada, se dedica a prestar sus servicios como  maestra en un colegio en la localidad, la actividad lo realiza hace aproximadamente dos años, lo cual le ha ayudado para sacar adelante su familia, solicita su sexto crédito para sufragar gastos médicos ya que su salud es delicada, el préstamo anterior lo pago sin problema de atraso.
texts.en:
Josefina is 30 years old, she is married and she is a teacher in a school of her community. She has been working as a teacher for about two years, an activity that has helped her provide for her family. She is requesting her sixth loan to pay for medical expenses, as her health is very delicate. She repaid the previous loan with no delay.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
This is Rodel D., 40, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Rosanna D., a variety store owner, and is the father of two children, both of whom are already in college. By the grace of God, Rodel has managed to support his children's schooling up to the college level. This is a dream come true for most Filipino parents like Rodel, as he himself has been to college and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Rodel operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store selling groceries, toiletries and beverages in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 Philippine pesos (PHP) worth of cooking oil or an egg. Rodel earns money by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them retail. 

Rodel’s edge over other competitors is that he also owns a videoke machine (a karaoke with a television displaying entertaining scenery and song lyrics) alongside his store. Filipinos never miss an opportunity to sing, and a videoke session is what many Filipinos do to pass time and have fun. Rodel’s store is located next to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 200 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, Rodel is requesting a 18,000 PHP loan. He will be using the loan to buy more products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Rodel dreams of being able to give his children a high quality education through all his hard work in the business. He also hopes to have his house renovated by the end of the year.

loans.use: To buy more groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand his product inventory

loans.name: Carlosa

texts.en: Carlosa M.'s main source of income comes from selling specially manufactured products to local businesses and community members. She is 44 years old, married and has six children: some of them are adults and some of them are students. She is from the village of Balabag, Gulayon. Carlosa has been in her manufacturing business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2005, Carlosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Carlosa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw materials to manufacture additional products. This will be her ninth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel T. is from the town of Talibon. She is married and has 2 infants. Like most of the people in her town, she is involved in fishing. She helps her husband operate their fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish at the market. Sometimes she goes around her neighborhood selling their catch. Maricel wishes to have a stable income to support her family's needs.


Maricel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This will be the third loan taken out by Maricel from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to make improvements to their house. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
This is Lolita C., 52, resident of Commonwealth, Quezon City, Philippines, mother to a young adult currently enrolled in college.
