Lolita operates a computer shop. Computer shops mostly cater to students who need to do research and printing, but it is also open for people who need some relaxation through online interaction. She offers services to her immediate community and neighbors.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 49,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more computer units, repair some of the old units, and purchase new software/hardware for the shop. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lolita dreams of being able to help her family through her business. She also hopes that the business will continue to be more successful and stable. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy  computer units, repair some of the old units, and acquire new software/hardware for the shop

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members.    Jennifer has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Jennifer sells from home, wholesale and retail.    

Jennifer has requested a loan of 550,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.  The main business challenges for Jennifer include transportation and the rainy season which makes roads impassable.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to selling wholesale only.  

Jennifer lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, rent, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 24 years old and is married, having graduated from Intermediate School. She will use this loan to purchase a sewing machine and cloth. She has a good reputation and, in addition to her good work, good quality and suitable prices, it has generated lots of clients.

She has been able to develop her job and raise her family’s income. This loan will provide lots of benefits and encourage her to develop her job further.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Jane Jepkemoi

texts.en:
Jane Jepkemoi T. is 37 years old and married to Christopher Kipsat Chemweno, who is a businessman. Her business is a source of additional income for the family. They have one school-going child, age 15. They live in Iten - Eldoret, Kenya. Jane sells leather, clothing and shoes and has been in business for 10 years. She earns a monthly profit of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).

Jane learned about KADET through a credit officer. She is applying for her fourth loan of 75,000 KES from KADET, which she intends to use to buy more shoes of all sizes. With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business more and more. In the future, Jane wishes to open a supermarket in Iten - Eldoret town and to live a more comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: To buy more shoes of all sizes

loans.name: Angela Mayra

texts.es:
Ángela  Mayra Alarcón P.  tiene 27 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo tiene cuatro hijos Alberto de 9  años, Estefanía de 8 años,  Jorge  de 7 años y Ismael de 1 año 3 meses  de edad  en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de los Ríos en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza. 

Ángela es una socia de la ventanilla rural Nuevo Porvenir, se encuentra  en la ciudadela Nueva Esperanza perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla integran 10 socios,   en su gran mayoría se dedican a las actividades de comercio. 

Ángela trabaja en la agricultura y tiene un negocio de venta de Chuzos.  Realiza sus compras en el mercado de la localidad y vende en la ciudadela donde vive.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en una tienda de víveres y abarrotes.  Piensa que el crédito le cambiaria su vida porque pondría una tienda en el lugar donde vive. Su sueño es ver a sus hijos que terminen sus estudios y viajar a las playas de Esmeraldas. Al momento dice no tener desafíos. 
En sus tiempos le gusta coser ropa.
texts.en:
Angela Mayra A. P. is 27 years old. She is married and she lives together with her husband and their four children: Alberto is 9 years old, Estafania is 8 years old, Jorge is 7 years old, and Ismael is 15 months old. They live in the community of Ventanas within the Los Rios province in Nueva Esperanza. 

Angela is a member of the community bank named Nuevo Porvenir. It is located in the community of Nueva Esperanza in Ventanas. There are 10 members in this group and the great majority of them are merchants. 

Angela is an agriculturist and she sells prepared meat skewers. She makes her purchases in the market and she carries out her sales in the same city where she lives. 

She requests a loan to set up a general store. She feels that this loan will change her life because she will be able to have a store in her home. Her dream is to see her children complete their education and to travel to the beaches in Esmeraldas. She says she doesn't face any particular challenges at this time. 

In her spare time she likes to sew.

loans.use: To set up a grocery store.

loans.name: Margot

texts.es: Margot, de 24 años, es una joven madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Nalylz de8 y Rubén de 5 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Margot en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta en la ciudad de San Francisco, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, son la venta de cacao, café y hojas de coca, ya que son de muy buena su calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plaga de insectos, ya que éstos perjudican sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su banco comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao, café, así como sacos de abono y fertilizantes, para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Margo, 24, is a young, humble, and hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her two dear children Nalylz, 8, and Ruben, 5.  She wants to provide her children a better life.  The arduous work Margot does on her plot of land makes for well cared for crops so on sales days, in the city of San Francisco, her products go quickly.  Her main source of income is the sale of cacao, coffee, and coca leaves because they are of such high quality.  The thing she likes most about her work is cultivating her land since she feels her efforts are being rewarded.  She has done this work for four years and thinks the hardest part is protecting her crops from insects since they hurt what she has planted.  In time she would like to buy more land to increase her crops. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she has made her payments on time and has not had any problems with her communal bank.  She is charge of keeping everyone in her communal bank happy.  She will buy cacao and coffee seeds along with sacks of fertilizer and manure to improve her crops with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase chocolate and coffee seeds and buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayeta se formó hace un años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es del J.A. Saldivar , en estos un años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
 Han pasado por una prueba muy difícil en el ciclo anterior ya que dos de las compañeras incumplieron en los compromisos de pago semanal, cancelaron el crédito y asumieron el compromiso de levantar nuevamente y con éxito el comité al cual pertenecen. 
Para levantar el comite se encuentra en la cabeza la señora Laura quien una mujer muy emprendedora y capaz.
Ella realiza como trabajo para el ingreso familiar la venta de frutas y verduras desde un puesto que posee.
Es una actividad que a ella le conviene mucho, ya que todos los dias tiene buena venta.
Asi logró ayudar hasta hoy a su familia en muchos gastos de la casa, y solicita el prestamo con su comité para invertir en su negocio como las demas integrantes, desea adquirir, verduras y frutas del mercado como manzanas, cebollas, tomates, zanahorias, y otros.
texts.en:
The San Cayeta Group was formed a year ago with the support of another group that was working in the same place. This group is from J.A. Saldivar. Many years of hard work have allowed them to grow socially as well as economically and they are known in the area as very hard-working women. They had a challenging time with their last loan since two of their partners did not make their weekly payments. They canceled the loan and assumed the responsibility of successfully reforming their group.

Mrs. Laura has been the leader in restarting this group. She is a very entrepreneurial and capable woman. To support her family, she works selling fruits and vegetables from her own stand. It is a good business for her and every day she sells a lot. In this way, she has been able to help her family with a lot of the expenses of the home. She is asking for a loan with her group to invest in her business (just like the other members) and she desires to obtain vegetables and fruits from the market like apples, onions, tomatoes, carrots, and others.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes, carrots, apples, pineapples, oranges, and more.

loans.name: Lurgia

texts.es:
Lurgia es socia del Banco Comunal Nacer, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos de 11 y 3 años.
Lurgia tiene una bodega, la cual decidio abrir para ayudarse con  los gastos de la casa. El prestamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías surtidas como arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideos , aguas gaseosas y bebidas alcohólicas.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco comunal porque puede ahorrar y acceder a los créditos y también las capacitaciones aprendió sobre el negocio y familia. Su sueño es poder ampliar su casa y ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lurgia is a member of the 'Nacer' community bank.  She is 33 years old and has 2 children aged 11 and 3.

Lurgia has a small grocery store which she opened so that she could help with her household expenses.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying merchandise to stock her store such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, soda and alcoholic drinks.

Lurgia likes her community bank's meetings because she can save, access loans and also attend training sessions where she has learned about business and family.  Her dream is to extend her home and save for her children's studies.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil and drinks

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame N. is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Maame sells clothes and shoes at Takoradi. The loan she is requesting will be added to her capital to buy varieties of shoes to meet the demands of her customers. She wishes to build a shop with her additional capital.

loans.use: To buy varieties of shoes for sale

loans.name: Francis Nzenge

texts.en:
Francis, age 29, is married and has two sons; ages five and two. He operates a retail shop where he sells items like flour, detergent, tealeaves, cooking fat, and bread among other food items. He has been running this business for 3 years and finds it quite profitable. 

This is the second loan he is getting from KADET LTD and he intends to use it to buy more stock for the shop. If the loan improves the business, he hopes to open a business for his wife and educate his children.

In the future, Francis hopes to expand and have his business well-established so that he can give his family a better life.

loans.use: To buy flour, bar soap, and sugar

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the village of Magting, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Gemma is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk foods, detergents & toothpaste in the local community. She is also buying and selling green bananas. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & bananas. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & bananas

loans.name: Nhean

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhean S. (pictured above), is a widow with two sons and one daughter. She sells vegetables, and her daughter is a weaver. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Nhean is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase weaving materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her daughter’s weaving business.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael M. is from the village of Barucboc. He is 54 years old. Ismael is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ismael owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ismael has been engaged in his business for over 34 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Ismael joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ismael has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ismael is requesting a new loan of 28000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Ismael from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Nalamae Ene

texts.en:
Nalamae Ene is 42 years old, married and the mother of five children. She has practised farming in Narok town for the last six years. She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of abode. This will be her second loan, which she is planning to spend on maize seed and also fertilizer. She hopes to use her profit to expand her farming activity by adding more acres of land.

Nalamae Ene hopes to grow her business, achieve better living, and educate her children. She is a thorough woman who is determined to achieve her objective if supported financially.

loans.use: To buy maize seed and fertilizer

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William L., 44, is a married father of eight children whose ages range between 1 and 18 years. Six of the children are currently attending school. 

He is a farmer from the town of Litein in the Rift Valley of Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for ten years. He employs one farmhand and sells his milk to the local market. He also operates a retail shop in the same town.

He has requested a loan of 60,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will be invested towards the education of his children. 

He would like to have at least four pure breed dairy cows and a water pump in the future. His major challenges have been diseases and lack of enough animal feed and water.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Shelamar

texts.en:
Shelamar G. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 21 years old. Shelamar is separated from her spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Shelamar owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, powdered juice drinks, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2011, Shelamar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional instant noodles, snack foods & canned goods to sell. This will be Shelamar's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchase more instant noodles, snack foods & canned goods to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa K. is a mother of four and is married to a tailor. She was educated up to senior high school. For the past 15 years, she has been selling fried fish (as shown in the photograph) at her village in Mfuom, near Abura town. Her income helps pay for her children’s school fees and some of the household expenses. 

In order to save up enough for her children’s tertiary education, she needs to grow her business and earnings.  A loan from Kiva will allow her to purchase larger quantities and varieties of fish for sale to cater the demands of her customers. She hopes that this will also help her attract new customers. Any extra income she earns will be set aside for her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities and varieties of fish for sale to cater to the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 50 años, vive con su esposa y su hijo en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado muy ligada a las tareas agrícolas. Sus padres le heredaron un porcentaje de terreno donde puede cultivar papa, maíz, arveja y cebada; que con ayuda de su esposo e hijos procuran fertilizarlo y cuidarlo para que desarrollen bien. Lo que le agrada de su trabajo  es que  pude disponer de su cosecha para las múltiples necesidades que tiene, así también que le permite trabajar tranquilo aunque muchas veces ha sido muy sacrificado su trabajo, pero su mayor satisfacción es ver que cada tiempo su producción. En adelante quiere tener más extensiones de terreno y aumentar la cantidad de animales. Es su segundo crédito con MFP esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su cultivo de papa.
texts.en: Manuel is 50 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in their own home.  He has been linked to agricultural work his whole life.  From his parents he inherited a portion of land where he can cultivate potatoes, corn, peas and barley.  With the help of his spouse and children, he fertilizes and cares for the land to develop it well.  His job pleases him because he can use the crops to take care of his many needs, and it also allows him to work peacefully even though many times his job requires a lot of sacrifices.  His greatest satisfaction is seeing what he produces each time.  In the future, he wants to get more land and also get more animals.  This is his second loan with MFP and he is very happy knowing he has financial support.  He is also thankful to be part of his community bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive.  He thanks the people who will provide the loan he requests that will be very useful to the progress of his business.  He will use the loan to purchase sacks of fertilizer for his potato crop.

loans.use: buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 37 years of age and married with three school-aged children. Ricky is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns approximately PHP 5,000 per month. 

Ricky is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional crops to raise and to pay for services to increase crop yields . Ricky has been growing root crops for almost 13 years.

In the future, Ricky hopes to produce more crops during harvest time in order to earn income for the sake of his family. He believes that with his patience and strong determination, he can improve their living situation and give their children a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase additional crops to raise  and to pay for services to increase crop yields

loans.name: Maravilla Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Maravilla, inicia su ciclo 6 con 14 socios los cuales se dedican a la venta de ropa por pedidos, cosméticos por catálogos, celulares, desayunos, venta de comida.  
Vanesa, es soltera, tiene 30 años, es la Presidenta del banco para éste ciclo, se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, para damas caballeros y niños, cubrecamas, sabanas, etc, por pedidos. Está en FINCA Perú con éste el segundo ciclo, ingreso por iniciativa propia, le gusta por la facilidad de los préstamos, le prestan a base de confianza. Está ahorrando para tener más capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The “Maravilla” communal bank starts its 6th cycle with 14 members who sell clothes on order, cosmetics via catalogue, cell phones, breakfasts and food.

Vanesa, 30, is single and bank President for this cycle.  She sells clothes for women, men and children, bedspreads, sheets, etc. on order.  This is her second cycle with FINCA Perú.  She joined on her own initiative and likes it because of the ease of the loans which are lent based on trust.  She is saving up to have more working capital.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Isaías, de 32 años es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Gilma de 30 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Para Isaías los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, que junto a su moto furgón sale en busca de productos para transportar. Él trabaja para los almacenes de la ciudad de Pucallpa, a quienes les hace el servicio de transportar productos como arroz, azúcar, agua mineral, etc., productos que son muy pesados, pero que gracias a la practicidad de su moto furgón, puede transportar sin problemas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Pucallpa, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche y a veces es muy peligroso. Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar una nueva moto furgón. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querido por el resto de socias. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas llantas para su moto furgón, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en: Isaías, who is 32 years old, is a very modest and hardworking man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, 30-year old Gilma, and their 3 dear children.  He wants to be able to give his children a better quality of life.  For Isaías, the workday starts very early in the morning.  He goes out on his moto-van to look for products to transport.  He works for the groceries in the city of Pucallpa.  He offers the service of transporting products like rice, sugar, mineral water etc., products that are very heavy, but that thanks to the practicality of his moto-van, he can transport without any problem.  What Isaías likes most about his work is driving through the streets of Pucallpa; he finds it very enjoyable.  He has been in this business for 2 years, and he finds that the most difficult parts are having to work until late at night and that at times it is very dangerous work.  In time, Isaías hopes to save enough money to buy a new moto-van.  This will be Isaías's second loan with MFP.  He is aware that must be responsible for making his payments on time, as he doesn't want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank, by whom he is  well liked.  With the one-thousand two-hundred nuevos soles ($450 USD) that Isaías has requested, he will purchase new tires for his moto-van.  The ones he currently has are worn out from hard use.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his moto-van.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; la socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos de 14, 4, 4 meses; la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de botellas y a la venta de vidrios; la socia suele ir con su carreta a los diferentes barrios a comprar botellas y todo lo que fuera vidrio una vez obtenido una cantidad considerable ella los vende a las fabricas al por mayor. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vidrio y botellas.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Paulina, 35, is a member of the “Sumac Ayllu” communal bank located in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Department.

She has a spouse and three children who are 14, 4, and 4 months old.  She is a bottle and glass merchant.  She tends to wander through neighborhoods with her cart buying bottles and all sorts of things made of glass.  Once she gathers a significant amount, she sells it to factories at wholesale.  She requests the loan to buy glass and bottles.

She is grateful for the support that will be granted her and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy glass and bottles.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 year old a business lady. She is married to Gideon. They are blessed with three children ages eighteen, sixteen and ten years respectively. She has been running a retail shop for the past fourteen years with the monthly income of KES 5000 which she uses to support her family members.

Elizabeth is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to add a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to her shop. 

Elizabeth will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are concentrated on her children’s education. She also hopes to purchase a piece of land and build a house which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To add a stock of sugar, rice and wheat flour to her shop

loans.name: Electine

texts.en:
Electine is 28 years old and married with two children aged six years old and two years old. She operates a general store where she sells various items to the locals at Kakamega. She has been in this business for two years now. She says the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is low purchasing power by her customers.

Electine plans to use this loan to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, detergents and beverages to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to build rental houses in the future. She describes herself as a visionary lady.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice, detergents  and beverages

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 38 years old and is married to Michael. The couple has four children who all go to school. For the past three years, Veronica has operated a beauty salon. She was introduced to KADET by one of her friends and this will be her fourth loan. Veronica plans to use her loan to buy more cosmetics and hair products for her salon.

In future, Veronica hopes to expand her beauty shop to be able to handle many clients at once.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and beauty products

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela nació en la ciudad de Cotabambas del departamento de Apurímac (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad. Ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos. Ella tiene un puesto de venta de mariscos y todo tipo de pescados en el centro comercial el Molino II de la ciudad Cusco. Ya son 17 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Graciela requiere el préstamo para comprar pescado como por ejemplo jurel, caballa, truchas, pejerrey, pota, choros y otros más. Su sueño de la socia es abrir una distribuidora mayorista de mariscos y pescados.     
 
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Graciela was born in the city of Cotabambas in the Department of Apurímac, Peru. She is 42 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. Graciela has a vending stall where she sells shellfish and all types of seafood at the Molino II central market in the city of Cusco. She has been in this business for 17 years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work. Graciela is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy seafood such as scad, mackerel, trout, “pejerrey”, squid, mussels, and other products. Her dream is to open a wholesale shellfish and seafood distribution center.

The Communal Bank “El Molinito II” meets every 30 days in the city of Cusco in Peru. This city is known for being a tourist and business area. It is also known for the traditional festival of Inti Raymi and for being the home of one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy scad, mackerel, trout, “pejerrey”, squid, mussels, and other types of seafood.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 39 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her general store.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns income from fishing.

Lorena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like soft drinks and groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Llankasunchis-2011 Group

texts.es:
La señora Griselda nació en el departamento del Cusco. Actualmenrte, ella vive en la ciudad del Cusco. (En la fotografía la señora Griselda está levantando la mano). 

La señora Griselda tiene 60 años y es casada y fruto D. esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y responsable que saca adelante a su familia,  ella está trabajando en los laboratorios H&S en el área D. cobranza y le va muy bien,ella también tiene un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comida fría como por ejemplo papa rellena, causa y ceviche, ella tiene un local alquilado por la universidad donD. venD. sus ricos potajes. Ya son 4 meses que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Griselda requiere el préstamo para ampliar el local y para comprar insumos como arroz y azúcar.    

Las reuniones D. las socias del Banco Comunal “Llankasunchis” son cada treinta días en la ciudad del Cusco. El banco Comunal está conformado por personas que son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría D. los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y sus actividades económicas D. los demás socios son por ejemplo venta D. artesanía, venta D. comida, venta comestibles, venta D. cosméticos y otros brindan servicios varios.  

Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Griselda was born in Cusco department.  She currently lives in the city of Cusco (in the photograph, Griselda is raising her hand).

Griselda is 60 years old, married, and has five children from her marriage.  She is a hard-working and responsible mother who gets her family ahead in life.  She is currently working at H&S laboratories in the collections department and is doing very well.  She also has a small business selling meals such as 'papa rellena' (stuffed potatoes), 'causa rellena' (a layered potato dish) and 'ceviche' (a marinated fish dish).  She hires premises at the university where she sells her delicious dishes.  She has been in this business for four months and it is doing very well.  On this occasion, Griselda needs a loan to expand her premises and buy supplies such as rice and sugar.  

The 'Llankasunchis' community bank meet once a month in the city of Cusco.  The members of the community bank are hard working and entrepreneurial.  They are always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and, through their daily work, they aim to proviD. their children with a better future.  Most of the members live in the city of Cusco and are engaged in businesses such as: selling handicrafts, selling food, selling cosmetics and providing services.

Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world (Machu Picchu).

loans.use: to expand her premises and buy supplies such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is single and blessed with one child. For over two years, she has been managing a butchery to make a living. She has employed one person to help her in the business. She has grown her business because of her hard work and determination.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy more goats and cows to slaughter.

loans.use: To buy more goats and cows to slaughter

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal San Benito, tiene 64 años tiene 8 hijos, esta en Finca hace 2 años 
Alejandra es feriante, lleva cereales como maíz, trigo y demás cereales que encuentre, esta muy agradecida por todas las cosas que pudo aprender y también porque gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido ha podido educar a sus hijos, las capacitaciones que ha recibido en su Banco Comunal le ayudaron a poder mejorar su negocio y el ahorro le ayuda a poder aumentar su mercadería, ahora con el préstamo comprara quinua, trigo.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a member of the San Benito communal bank.  She is 64 years old, and she has eight children.  She has been with Finca for two years.  Alejandra is a merchant, and she takes grains like corn, wheat, and other grains that she finds to sell at the fairs.

She is very grateful for all of the things she was able to learn.  She is also grateful because thanks to the loan she has received, she has been able to educate her children.  The trainings she has received in her communal bank helped her to be able to improve her business.  The savings help her to be able to increase her merchandise.

She will use the current loan to buy quinoa and wheat.

loans.use: to buy various grains.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and has 1 child.  Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Maricel has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Maricel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional stocks to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es  soltera tiene 26 años de edad y vive en un barrio muy bonito y trabaja con un hermano a vender ropas deportivas.

   Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos de la marca Avon, en donde lleva trabajando un año y un mes y cometa que le está dando buen resultado  en sus ingresos para apoyar a sus padres en la economía.
 
   Su inspiración por esta actividad comenzó por una compañera con la que estudiaban y la invito a vender cosméticos en la que se animo y le va bien, ya que aprovecha en el momento que llegan los clientes a hacer pedidos de uniformes.
.
   Lo que ella desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda mejorar cada día sus ingresos para seguir apoyando a sus papas con los ingresos, así también con el tiempo tener su propio negocio.
texts.en: Gladys is 26 years old and single.  She lives in a very beautiful neighborhood and works with her brother selling athletic clothing.   This loan is to purchase Avon cosmetics, which she has been selling for just over a year now.  The business is going well and she uses her income to help support her parents.  Gladys' inspiration for the business was a friend whom she studied with, who invited her to sell cosmetics.    She wants to take advantage of the timing as customers are coming now with requests.  Gladys hopes that every day she can increase her income, so that she can continue to help her parents.  In time she'd like to have her own business.

loans.use: to purchase Avon cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Sreyleak, age 24, is a widow with no child.  She lives with her mother in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreyleak is a garment worker.  

She is asking for a loan of $500 to fill-in the land inside her house.  Tiny ponds need to be filled in.

loans.use: to fill-in the land inside her house.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en: Tigran is engaged in an agricultural business. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. Tigran lives together with his wife, parents and brother, who help him with daily agricultural activities. Tigran plans to purchase livestock, forage (bulky food such as grass or hay) for the cattle, and seeds to cultivate the land. This requires some financial investments. With the help of this loan, Tigran will expand his farm and successfully cultivate his land. This will allow Tigran to get enough income to sustain his family and ensure better future for them.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, forage, and seeds

loans.name: Adolfo Salvador

texts.es:
Adolfo es un hombre soltero de 22 años, el se dedica al negocio de taxista, eligio este negocio porque le parece que es muy rentable y económico, Adolfo es un hombre trabajador, empeñoso y muy luchador con muchas ganas de salir adelante,empezó en el negocio desde hace 2 años, gana semanalmente un promedio de S/. 310 soles .
Con el crédito que se le otorgará gracias a Kiva de S/. 1600.00 soles lo invertirá para hacerle mantenimiento general a su taxi, uno de sus sueños es tener su propia casa para que en un futuro no muy lejano tuviese una mejor calidad de vida.
Adolfo vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.
texts.en:
Adolfo is a 22 year old single man. He works in the taxi driving business. He chose this business because he thinks it is very profitable and affordable. Adolfo is a hardworking, persevering man, a real fighter with a strong wish to get ahead. 

He started in the business 2 years ago and currently earns a weekly average of S/. 310. He will invest the S/. 1600.00 loan that he will receive thanks to Kiva in the general maintenance of his taxi. One of his dreams is having his own house, so that he can enjoy a better quality of life in the not very distant future. 

Adolfo lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

loans.use: to pay for the general maintenance of his car.

loans.name: Imomkul

texts.ru: Имомкул примерный отец и на воспитании имеет троих сыновей и одну дочь. Его жена домохозяйка, а он сам занимается бизнесом, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Более 21 года Имомкул занимается выращиваем лука, пшеницы и риса. Отходы от сельхозкультур идут на откорм скота, Ведь кроме этого он занимается скотоводством. В бизнесе помогают ему его сыновья. Имомкул запрашивает займ для покупки минеральных удобрений и семян лука. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам за вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Imomkul is an exemplary father and is bringing up three sons and one daughter. His wife is a housewife, and he is engaged in business by himself to provide for his family. Imomkul has been engaged in growing onions, wheat and rice for more than 21 years. Wastes from the crops go to feed the livestock as he is also engaged in raising animals. His sons help him in his business. Imomkul is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and seed onions. He looks forward to your help and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seed onions

loans.name: Zenah

texts.en:
Zenah is a 24 year old woman.  She is married to Steve, who is also a businessman, and they have one 2 year-old child.

Zenah has been in the retail shop business for the last three years, making a monthly income of Kes 9000. She is taking her first loan of Kes 10,000 from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the loan to increase stock.  The anticipated profits she will use to expand her business.  She hopes to have a very stable business that can support her family without struggles.

loans.use: To add retail stock

loans.name: Khamtheo Group

texts.en: Phin’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Phin and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Phin and her village also understand the impact that unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Phin’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Surrounded with a poor financial circumstances she needed to start her own business to increase her purchasing power for meeting her household expenditures financially. Musarat  is 46 years old, married woman and a mother of 5 children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a Murabaha loan of 40000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 56 years old, married with 1 child.  She has been a member of Kabuta Ladies in Action since 2001. The group runs a group revolving fund where she received a loan of USD100 in 2003 fortunately paid in time. Her first loan helped her to buy pesticides for her coffee which at the end of the season she sold and made a profit of USD200. She grows and sells tea leaves, cabbages, and potatoes. In addition to vegetables, Jane also sells milk in Gakira which gives her USD 30 as profit in a month.

loans.use: Jane wants to improve her farming by buying fodder for her dairy cow, buy fertilizer and agro chemicals for her cabbages to keep high quality vegetables.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a very active member of the PEMCI family. She is married with 3 school age children. This is her third loan with us.

Regina's first loan was repaid earlier than programmed. She used the second loan of $429 to boost her second-hand clothing business during the festive seasons in December 2006.

Although Regina is still repaying the earlier loan, she has approached us with a proposal to venture into New Clothes and Ladies Shoes, which we have agreed to fund in the amount of US$500. We believe that the combined income from the previous loan and this additional one will uplift her standards and business to a higher level.

loans.use: Diversify business into new clothes as well as second-hand clothing

loans.name: Roqia

texts.en: Roqia is 25 years old. She is single. She has lots of customers. She is doing different types of embroidery. She wants to get a loan to buy an embroidery machine to make more nice designs according to customers' orders. She wants to expand her business and wishes to have a nice shop in the future.

loans.use: Buy embroidery machine, thread, cloth

loans.name: Ey

texts.en: Mr. Ey T. is 31 years old, single, and lives with his older sister in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, since his parents passed away many years ago. Her sister works in a laundry shop and makes a moderate income: about $1.2 each day. He is, meanwhile, a motor-taxi driver and makes around $3/day. Currently, he is asking for $500 to purchase a motor bike to operate a business. In the future, he and his sister hope to have enough money to open a cafe shop, where it would enable him to make additional profits to assist his sole family member.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to run a business.

loans.name: Maria Bersedaba

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Maria Bersedaba N.. In my neighborhood they call me Mrs. Marillita. I am a wholesaler of achiote, also known as Aploppas, pepper, curry, safflower and soybean. This small business venture is four years old and it helps pay for my medication and my family's food. At this time, I need to be able to purchase more grains in order to fullfil customer's orders.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Hola, minombre es Maria Bersedaba N., pero en mi vecindario me conosen como Doña marillita. Yo tengo la venta de varios condimentos como; achote, pimienta, curri, asafran, chrrus de soya, estos productos los vendo por mayor. Este pequeño negocio lo tengo hace 4 años, el cual me ayuda para poder comprar mis medicinas de la presion y alimento parami hogar. Ahora nesecito comprar mas ya que tengo varios encargos.

loans.use: compra de churros de soya, condimentos como: achote, especias curri, anis, y otros

loans.name: Pupu

texts.en:
Pupu is a 47 year-old lady, married, and has four kids. She is very talented in sewing different types of patterns and clothes. She takes orders from shops in town, flea markets, and other people who frequent her business.

Her first loan of $300 USD was used to buy the materials, threads and needles for her business. She works six days per week and takes Sundays off, however, if she is busy then she will work nights as well.

She hopes that her next loan will be used to improve her business so that she can maintain a good flow of customers. She is very thankful for the financial support she has received from SPBD through its loans, because without them, she could not continue her business. She wishes be a part of the program for a long time and receive further loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase engine parts for a matatu (small bus)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase products in bulk

loans.name: Ati

texts.en: Ati, 36, raises chickens at her house. She could earn $10 in two weeks while her husband, M., sells fried snacks everyday and earns $3 a day. She requests a loan of $75 to buy more chicks. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Señora Judith is a member of the communal bank "Santa Rosa de Lima". She lives in the region of San Martín in the district of Juanjui. Her business is located at 390 Prolongación Dos de Mayo Esquina and she is dedicated to selling groceries.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her kids she succeeded in increasing her business little by little. At the beginning it was small, but now she has many clients thanks to her competitive prices.

With the loan of 3000 Soles, which she will pay back in six months, she will buy various products of everyday needs like sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of milk, olive oil, preserves, etc., in order to satisfy the needs of her clients who live in her neighborhood and community.

Señora Judith is 31 years old and lives with her husband and her kids. She works daily to show that there are no limits to reaching her goals and she can reach all of them with effort and dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui, su negocio está ubicado en la Prolongación Dos de Mayo Esquina P. Aguirre No. 390 y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos logró aumentar su negocio poco a poco ya que al principio era pequeño, tiene mucha clientela gracias al precio competitivo con que vende sus productos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, el cual pagara en 6 meses, comprará productos variados de primera necesidad como sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de leche,aceite, conservas ,etc para satisfacer así las necesidades de sus clientes que viven en su barrio y la comunidad.

La señora Judith tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, trabaja diariamente demostrando de esa manera, que para cumplir las metas no hay límites y se pueden alcanzar con esfuerzo y dedicación.

loans.use: With the loan she wants to buy products that are everyday necessities.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa is a forty-three year old father of two children.  He informed us that his third child recently passed away.  

Yaa has been operating his small clock store for four years.  The store is located in a crowded alley in central Kumasi.  This is his second loan with Sinapi Aba Trust.   He hopes this loan helps him to further expand his business by increasing his variety of clocks.   By increasing his income, he hopes to provide more savings for his family's needs.  

Yaa is a member of the trust group Pillar of God.   The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral to ensure that each member pays its share of the group loan.  

Yaa's loan officer, Annastasia is pictured next to him.

loans.use: To increase his inventory of clocks

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old and married. She and her husband also take care of one other person who is 33 years old. Jane runs a small electronics shop, which she started in 2004. She works from 7am to 10pm every day and earns a monthly profit of about $225.

Jane would use this loan to buy more electronics items for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more electronics items for a successful shop

loans.name: Ly Kim

texts.en:
Heng Sovy, 37-years-old, has resided in Phnom Penh for many years with her family. She has two children, one a student and another too young to attend school. She has a small business selling snow cones on the street near the school. Snow cones are one of the favorite foods among young children, because it tastes sweet and cool. Normally she makes about $5 per day. Her husband, Ly Kim L., age 38, has a business renting musical instrument to other people in the village. He earns most from Jan to May, the dry season. Most people get married during the dry season. He earns less during the rainy season. On average, he earns $7 a day.

He is requesting a loan to purchase more musical instruments. This will allow him to arrange big parties and weddings for people and earn more from his business. (Heng Sovy is pictured because her husband is not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more musical instruments.

loans.name: Susana Rafaela

texts.es:
Susana Rafaela M. runs a food business, making and selling her products from home in Somotillo in Chinandega. She creates delicious meals which are sold to her loyal clients who visit her on a daily basis.

She is the mother of two children, both of school age, and is looking for a way to provide them with the things they need in life. Therefore she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan in order to buy ingredients for her dishes, which she can then sell from home. Ultimately she will then be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Susana Rafaela M. se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega. Se ha caracterizado por elaborar exquisitos platillos los cuales los vende a sus clientes fieles el cual la visitan a diario en su hogar.

Ella es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares y busca la manera de proporcionarles las cosas necesarias para que estos se desarrollen. Por esta razón es que ella ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los platillos y venderlos en su casa de habitación y además para la ampliación del negocio.

loans.use: To invest in ingredients for her business and for expansion

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es:
Wilmer was born with a talent; he is a great painter and artist. Ever since he was young Wilmer developed this talent, and was famous for it while attending school. Now at 59 years old, Wilmer continues with the art that has become an integral part of his life, and for which he's well known. Some time ago, Wilmer offered to paint family portraits, which he turned into a means of earning money. He also has a small store in his home that earns supplemental income. In his paintings, Wilmer applies a new technique, adding chrome to make the portrait appear shiny like a photograh. Wilmer consideres this his profession and his happy to do it. With age, Wilmer's work has decreased, as he can no longer paint as rapidly as when he was young. Because of this, he ias asking for a loan of 1300 soles to buy materials for his art works and merchandise for his store. Give a hand to Wilmer so that he can continue to follow his passion.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Wilmer nació con un gran talento, es un gran artista del dibujo y la pintura, desde muy pequeño desarrolló ese gran talento, que fue reconocido en su época escolar. Hoy a sus 59 años sigue con el arte que lo caracteriza, y por el cual es reconocido. Desde hace tiempo atrás, él va de casa en casa ofreciendo el servicio de retratos familiares al óleo, actividad que se ha convertido su forma de ingresos económicos. También cuenta con una pequeña tienda que ha instalado en su casa que le permite obtener ingresos extra. Para sus pinturas, Wilmer aplica una técnica novedosa, que es el cromo, imitando la pintura al óleo, dándole un efecto semejante al de las fotografías. Wilmer considera este trabajo su vocación de vida y está contento con lo que hace. Y como el tiempo no pasa sin dejar huella, este ha mellado en la rapidez del trabajo de este artista, pero no en la calidad, Wilmer ya no pinta tan rápido como lo hacía de joven, y esto baja un porcentaje sus ganancias, por esta razón solicita en préstamo 1300 soles para la compra de materiales para sus trabajos artísticos y además mercadería para su tienda, actividad en que se apoya adicionalmente. Bríndale una mano a Wilmer para que continúe realizando lo que más le apasiona.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to keep painting portraits.

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Mrs. Huot S. is a basket maker in Bompong Phchoek Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Prak Poch, is a farmer and pig breeder in the local village (pictured on the left). Mrs. Huot S. and her husband are building a house, but they do not have enough money now to buy timber to make the walls. So Mrs. S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

Mrs. Huot S. is 38 years old and the mother of two children who attend school. This is the third time that she has requested a loan because of a financial crisis in the household. Previously, Mrs. S. obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for breeding and she has fully paid it back.

loans.use: Buy timber to make the walls of her new home

loans.name: Ath

texts.en: Mrs. Ath S. lives in Kampong Chrey Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who faces a problem because her rice field is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Ath S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to support her rice plantation and produce a better crop. Aside from this farming, she sells fish in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Sam Sophaot, is a driver. Mrs. Ath S. is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en: Sophia has been selling snacks in Dodoma, Tanzania for 20 years.  She is now taking out her first loan in order to expand from a snack stand on the street into a small restaurant.  She hopes that this restaurant will allow her to increase her profit.  If she is successful, she will put this profit towards paying her children's school fees, getting more food for her family, and repairing her roof.  Sophia is 36 years old, married, and has four children.  Her children are 1.5, 9, 12, and 16 years old.  Sophia will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Tatu, Zawadi, and Tatu.

loans.use: To open a small restaurant

loans.name: Tusooka Kwavula Groupb

texts.en:
N. Regina, an executive member of the Tusooka Kwavula women’s group in Lugazi, is a married lady who has owned and operated a bar for over 10 years. She sells a variety of beverages ranging from a local brew with malwa, waragi, and tonto to bottled beers and wines.

Regina says that before the loans, she used to sell only local brew, but joining her lending group has helped her to transform the business. She now has a plan to make the brew herself for increased profits, but its feasibility depends on the availability of time, since she has only one person to help her out in the bar.

She is now requesting a loan to help purchase more beer and local brew in order to accrue more profits and savings.

loans.use: To buy more beer, spirits and local brew for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Bourey Khem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bourey K. has been selected by the members of the group as the village bank president. All eleven members live in the Da village in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.

Mrs. Bourey K. has a 1.8-hectare plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Heng Hon, is a fisherman, and his boat needs to be repaired. In order to restart his fishing business, Mrs. Bourey K. is requesting a loan to fix her husband’s boat. She plans to use the rest of the loan to buy more fishing tools. She hopes that her husband can catch more fish to support the family. Mrs. Bourey K. is 22 years old and the mother of a one-year-old child.

(Mrs. Mao B. is not requesting a loan, but her husband is, so he is in the picture.)

loans.use: Repair the fishing boat and buy more fishing tools

loans.name: Abida Parveen Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en:
Abida Parveen baji is a 35-year-old married lady and resides in a city called Borewala, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has lived in it with her family for the past 5 years. She is an uneducated lady but she doesn’t hesitate to mention the reason, namely, that her father had few financial resources. Her husband's name is A. R. and he is a driver and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters.

Abida Parveen baji's son makes bodies of vehicles called auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). The other children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Abida Parveen baji has a sewing business. She sews clothes for her neighbors, charging US$ 2 per dress. She uses her income to pay her children’s school fees. She is applying for a loan to repair the auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) of her husband.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Sugran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Rubina baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Nasreen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy land on contract to grow vegetables to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Inez Del Carmen's Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario G.S Seidy esta conformado por la Señora Martha Janet Menjívar y su compañera Inez del Carmen Hernández tiene la edad de 40 años y su amiga Martha tiene 48 años, el estado civil de Doña Martha es casada y tiene 4 hijos con las siguientes edades un varón de 30 años trabaja por cuenta propia una mujer de 26 años que trabaja por cuenta propia otro varón de 23 años que también trabaja por cuenta propia y su hija menor de 17 años que cursa el 1 año de secundaria en el caso de su amiga Inez su estado civil es casada y tiene 4 hijos sus edades son su hijo mayor de 20 años que cursa el 2 año de su carrera su otro hijo de 16 años cursa el 4 año de secundaria y su otro hijo de 13 año de edad cursa el 2 año de secundaria y su hijo menor de 7 años cursa el 3 grado de primaria, su compañero de vida labora como mecánico y el esposo de su amiga Martha trabaja como radio técnico por lo que sus propósitos son casi similares Doña Martha son de mejorar su nivel de vida y entre los propósitos de Doña Inez son mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que ya que ambas luchan por sacar adelante a sus familias los deseos de Doña Martha son de obtener su propio establecimiento y aumentar su inventario ya que así podrá ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de los diferentes productos que tiene para ofrecer los deseos de Doña Inez son de establecer una comideria con mejores condiciones y proporcionarle al cliente la comodidad que necesita ya que así podrá obtener mas afluencias de clientes.

La actividad económica de ambas es diferente Doña Inez se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida en cambio su amiga Martha se dedica a la venta de mercadería ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 20 años su amiga Inez tiene de poseer su negocio 12 años la ubicación de su negocio es en le mercadito de Santa Ana Doña Inez inicia este negocio con fondos propios ya que en sus ideas estaban el establecerse en el mercado ya que solo así podría obtener clientes ya que tenia que sacar a sus hijos adelante para que no les faltara lo necesario y es así como decide trabajar en la elaboración y venta de comida ya que inicio con poca comida como lo fue: arroz, frijoles, huevos pero al paso del tiempo es que decide realizar la venta de comidas como: pollo, carne desmenuzada y otros, la ubicación del negocio de Doña Martha es de forma ambulante ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia ya que siempre ha sido una persona que le ha gustado trabajar y pensó en la idea de vende ropa de forma ambulante y fue así como obtuvo este trabajo ya que al principio quería establecerse en un lugar donde pero debido a que el impuesto era muy alto decide no pagar por el ofrecer su mercadería de forma ambulante dio inicio con pocos productos como lo fue: ropa interior, camisolas y trajes para niños y  pero necesitaba obtener mas inventario por lo que se reúne con su amiga y deciden realizar un financiamiento  le ayude a las dos para sacar adelante cada uno de sus negocios por lo que Doña Inez accede al financiamiento y que este será destinado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes y gaseosas para ofrecer a sus clientes en cambio Doña Martha destina su financiamiento para la compra de mercadería en general que consiste en ropa, sandalias, cosméticos ya que la compra las realiza en Managua por lo que le resulta mas favorable realizar las compras.
texts.en:
The "G.S. Seidy" group is made up of Martha Janet who is 48 years old and her friend del Carmen Hernández who is 40 years old. Martha is married and has four children: a 30-year-old self-employed son; a 26-year-old self-employed daughter; a 23-year-old self-employed son; and a 17-year-old daughter in her first year of high school. Her friend Inez is married and also has four children: a 20-year-old son in his second year of studying for a degree; a 16-year-old son in his fourth year of high school; a 13-year-old son in his second year of high school; and a 7-year-old son in Grade 3. Inez's husband is a mechanic, while Martha's husband is a radio technician. Their goals are similar: Martha mentions improving her standard of living, and Inez wants to improve her families' living conditions. Both women are fighters who want to give their families a good start in life. Martha wants to have her own establishment and increase her inventory so that she can offer her customers a greater variety of products than what she now has. Inez want to open a diner with better conditions and make her customers comfortable so that she can attract more clients. The women have different businesses: Inez has been preparing and selling food for 12 years from the small market of Santa Ana while Martha has been a street vendor for 20 years. Inez started her business with her own money as she had in mind to establish herself in the market as this was the only way to get customers as she had to raise her children and so they would not lack for any necessities. Thus, she decided to prepare and sell food. Initially she sold a limited number of dishes such as rice, beans, eggs but with time she has been able to include dishes such as chicken, shredded beef and so on. Martha is a street vendor; she opened her business on her own as she enjoys working and thought of selling clothes in this manner. Initially she wanted to establish a set business locale but because the taxes were very high she decided it would be preferable to be a street vendor. She began with only a few goods, such as underwear, blouses and suits for children. She needs to increase her inventory and because of this she is joining with her friend in requesting this loan which will help them both in their businesse. Inez will use this loan as working capital to buy staple foodstuffs, vegetables, meat and soft drinks to offer her clients and Martha will buy merchandise such as clothes, sandals, cosmetics from Managua as these items will be less expensive for her to buy there.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely tiene 43 años, vive en su propia casa con sus  4 hijos. Realiza bordados desde hace 20 años, empezando con esta labor desde muy joven ya que se la enseñó su madre, es así que actualmente sigue realizando bellos trabajos que elabora día a día en su misma casa, trabajos que  una vez terminados, vende a los establecimientos que venden o alquilan trajes típicos. Nely está dedicada a esta labor porque le es muy rentable ya que sus bordados suelen ser muy cotizados, y obtiene las ganancias necesarias para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es la primera vez que Nely tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona muy solidaria, valor que comparte con los miembros de su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para invertir en la compra de telas e hilos  que son los materiales básicos para la elaboración de sus bordados. En promedio cada rollo de hilo está valorizado en 100 soles, ella comprará 2 conos y con los 300 restantes adquirirá la tela, esto hará que mejore la calidad y producción de sus trabajos.
texts.en:
Nely is 43 years old, she lives in her own home with her 4 children. She has embroidered for the last 20 years. She began this work from an early age and was taught by her mother, and continues to produce beautiful work everyday in her home. Once she completes pieces, she sells them to establishments that sell or rent traditional clothing. Nely is dedicated to this work because it is very profitable, since her embroidery is often highly valued, and earns the profits necessary to cover the costs of her household. This is the first time Nely has a loan with MFP, she is a very supportive person, a value she shares with members of her community bank. The money she is requesting is to invest in the purchase of fabrics and thread which are the basic materials used to embroider. On average, each roll of thread is valued at 100 soles, she will buy 2 rolls and with the remaining 300 she will buy the fabric, this will help her improve the quality and production of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for embroidery

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been a khanga and bites seller in the Ilala neighborhood of Dodoma for five years. She belongs to Migombani group loan (Group code 2023).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works for 10 hours at her business.
 
She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more khanga, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She hopes that with the loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to grow her business, save money for the future and pay school fees for her children.  


Rose is 40 years old, married, and has three children aged 20, 18 and 16. She also cares for three additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more khanga, wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Бурханов Фуркат 1969 года рождения, женат имеет 3 детей. Он чинит машины, перекрашивает  и выставляет на  продажу. Но в основном он ремонтирует и делает переоборудование машин.  Его мастерская  находиться дома, он считает, что аренда очень дорого обходиться и не оправдывает его расходы. Для этого он сам переоборудовал гараж в мастерскую и занимается своим ремеслом.  Начал свой бизнес он год назад. Нехватка собственного капитала побудила его получить кредит В Микроинвест , и он благодарен что поддержали  его в бизнесе.
texts.en:
Furkat B. was born in 1969, he is married and has three children. He repairs cars and paints them and then puts up for resale. But mostly he just refurbishes and upgrades cars. His body shop is at his house because he think that renting a space is expensive and is not worth this expense. He has remodeled his garage for the shop and practices his craft there. He started his business one year ago. He does not have enough working capital and this has moved him to apply for a loan at MicroInvest. He is thankful to all who support him in his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishment of vehicles

loans.name: Kankoè Dodji Atassé

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme célibataire exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de friperie, il a commencé cette activité en 2007, il s’approvisionne au marché local de Hedrzanowoé  où ce commerce est très développé , cette activité marche bien pour lui. Actuellement  le stock dont il dispose ne lui permet pas de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Il voudrait se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter  1 balle de chemise et 1 balle de pantalon.
texts.en:
This young man is single, and he sells used clothing to earn a living. He began this business in 2007. He buys his merchandise at the local market of Hedrzanowoé where this business is widespread. The business is going well for him. Presently, the stock he has at his disposal does not allow him to satisfy the needs of his clientele. He would like to refurbish his inventory and is asking WAGES for his first loan to buy 1 bale of shirts and 1 bale of trousers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Bancomunal Juan Pablo II
Karina  es casada tiene 45 años un hijo de 24 años que estudia instituto superior.
Karina estudio secretariado no pudo terminar por que salió embarazada y se dedico a su hijo,  y cuando su hijo estaba ya grande se puso a trabajar en la venta de ropa y zapatos previo pedido.  
Karina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de ropa y zapatos por el día de la madre. 
Desde que Karina esta en Finca aprendió administrar el dinero y ahorrar, antes no podía ahorrar se gastaba todo, en Finca pudo lograrlo.  
El sueño de Karina es tener una tienda para venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Juan Pablo II cooperative bank. Karina is married, 45 years old, and has a 24-year old son who is continuing his studies. Karina started in secretarial school, but was not able to finish because she started a family and instead dedicated herself to her son. When her son was grown, she began working selling clothing and shoes. Karina needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy clothes and shoes for Mother’s Day. Since Karina joined Finca, she has learned to manage money and save. Before, she wasn’t able to save and spent everything. That has changed, however, since she started with Finca. Karina’s dream is to one day have her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Karina needs a loan of 2400 soles, to buy clothes and shoes for Mother's Day.

loans.name: Abdulafis

texts.ru: Хотя Абдулафису 62 года он совмещает в себе несколько профессий. По профессии агроном он работает начальником в госучреждении, также дома он имеет парник, где выращивает различные овощи. Кроме того арендует землю, где выращивает различные сельскохозяйственные культуры. У Абдулафиса очень большая семья, кроме его жены у него 7 детей. Старшие дети уже имеют свои семьи. Чтобы прокормить свою семью Абдулафис откармливает дома скотину, для чего имеет хорошие условия. Для увеличения поголовья скота Абдулафис решил подать заявку на КИВА.
texts.en:
Even though Abdulafis is 62 years old he combines several professions. He is an agronomist by profession and works as a manager at a government organization. Also, at home he has a greenhouse where he grows different vegetables. In addition, he rents land where he grows different agricultural crops. Abdulafis has a very big family; in addition to his wife he has 7 children. The older children already have their own families. In order to feed his family Abdulafis fattens livestock at home, for which he has good conditions. In order to increase his livestock headcount, Abdulafis decided to apply to KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en:
You can see Shakhla's father in this picture. Shakhla is applying to Kiva for her second loan. She received her first loan from Kiva in 2007. Her father transports goods and she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the spare parts to improve her father's business.

She says, "Thanks!"

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye
