texts.fr: Ramatoulaye B. est âgée de 41 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait de la restauration de petit déjeuner et aimerait voir son activité renforcée. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ramatoulaye B., age 41, is married and the mother of 4 children. Her business field is catering, selling breakfasts. She would like to bolster her business. Her goal is to improve the standard of living of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Faire de la restauration

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: María Felix M., Sabina de los Angeles P. Hernández y Ana María R. Méndez.

El grupo solidario El Buen Pastor son originarios de la ciudad de Masaya en la comarca La Reforma, tienen varios ciclos de trabajar con Adim porque sienten que es una institución que ha confiado en ellos, expresan que se sienten como parte de la familia de Adim. Todas las miembros del grupo venden ropa ambulante desde hace varios años.

Doña María Felix es la coordinadora de este grupo, ella tiene años de tener esta actividad ha sabido como es el giro de su negocio, expresa que ella ha visto como en cada préstamo le va quedando un mayor inventario en el negocio. Ella es una madre, que mantuvo a sus hijos sola enseñándoles a trabajar, se dedica desde hace muchos años a la venta de frutas y verduras, las compra en el mercado de Masaya y vende a mejor precio en el mercado Oriental.
Todo lo que ha logrado le anima a seguir trabajando y quedando bien en Adim, esto se lo hace saber a su grupo y por eso se encarga de ir a dejar el abono para garantizar la puntualidad.

Doña Sabina de los Angeles P.  se dedica a la venta de  tamales, elotes, etc. ella lo elabora en su casa y muy temprano al siguiente día los ofrece en el mercado oriental. Tiene más de diez años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es madre de un solo hijo que es joven y ya trabaja, le ayuda con los gastos de la casa y también su esposo. Sueña con mejorar una parte de su vivienda que es necesaria. 

Doña Ana María R. es una señora muy trabajadora que vende ropa, es madre de un hijo que vive con ella, lo ha criado con su trabajo sin ayuda de nadie, expresa que hasta ahora logra obtener un crédito que es en base a la confianza y está clara que debe de ser puntual con su pago. 
Ella vende productos de ropa y cosméticos que es la actividad que le ayuda a percibir más ingresos.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María Felix M., Sabina de los Angeles P. Hernández y Ana María R. Méndez. The members of the united group, El Buen Pastor, are from the city of Masaya in the La Reforma region. They have worked with Admin for several loan cycles because they feel that is an institution that has believed in them. They feel like part of the Admin family. All of the members of the group have sold clothes as street vendors for many years. Doña María Felix has been the group’s coordinator for years. She has known the turns her business takes. She has seen how each loan has led to having a bigger inventory. She is a mother who raised her children by herself. She taught them how to work. For many years she has been selling fruits and vegetables. She buys them in the Masaya market, and she sells them for a better price in the Oriental market. Everything that she has achieved motivates her to keep working and doing well with Admin. She lets her group know this. She is in charge of going and leaving the installment to be sure of its punctuality. Sabina de los Angeles P. sells tamales and corn, etc. She makes them in her house. Very early the following day she sells them in the Oriental market. She has done this for over ten years. She has one young son who works. Her son and her husband help her with the household expenses. She dreams of improving a part of her house that needs it. Ana María R. is a very hard working woman who sells clothes. She has one son who lives with her. With the income from her work, she raised him without help from anyone. It is clear to her that a loan is based on trust, and she must be punctual with her payment. She sells clothes and cosmetics; this helps her receive more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perishables

loans.name: Lorena's Group

texts.en:
Lorena Q. is from the village of  Waterfall , Balingasag , Misamis  Oriental. She is 43 years old. Lorena is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lorena operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector, operating a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from operating a videoke machine ( sing-a-long business) in the local community. Lorena has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lorena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 21,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorena is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Lorena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jovielyn

texts.en:
Jovielyn has run a variety store for almost 11 years. Managing her store is her way of helping her husband with supporting the needs of their family. Her income from her store is very helpful in sustaining the growing needs of her family. Thus, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders for PHP10,000 as additional capital. She wants her store to grow and become more profitable for her family.

Jovielyn is 36 years old and resides simply in the village of Capellan Ilagan, Isabela. She is happily married to Carlos, a furniture maker. They have four children, three of whom are already studying. Their youngest child is just 1 year old. Jovielyn is hoping to continue sending all her children to higher levels of education for them to obtain better jobs one day. Through their own perseverance and diligence in working, she believes that they will be able to attain what they dream.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all girls and in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Konongo in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Dora is a trader. She trades in printed textiles – fancy, java and wax prints and jewels. She hawks (goes door to door) to sell in her community and treks to other towns to sell as well. She procures her goods from textile depots in Kumasi. She has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Business Friends Group

texts.en:
Kumba is a married woman with seven children. Her children range in age between 6 and 15 years old.

For the past 8 years, she has been operating a business where she sells oil goods. She notes that she has faced many challenges in recent years, both family problems and financial issues, but that she runs a successful business. She attributes her success to the fact that she is able to attract many customers by interacting with her customers and also by offering goods at reasonable/affordable prices. She hopes to improve her business in such a way that she will be able to better support her children.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional materials (e.g., tins and drums) for her oil sales business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda raises hogs in her village. She aspires to grow her business by increasing the number of hogs she raises. This way, she will be able to increase her profits. She hopes to avail a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (or about $100 US) so she can purchase additional hogs and hog feed. She hopes that her loan will be approved. It will help her business grow, which will be of great benefit to her child, who is presently studying.

Melinda, a 34-year-old businesswoman, is married to Danilo V.. Their child is now graduating high school. Hopefully, Melinda and Danilo can send her directly to college to finish her studies. The family lives peacefully in the village of Santa Isabel Norte, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more hogs and feed.

loans.name: Jennlyn

texts.en: Jennlyn E. is from the town of Aloran. She is 31 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Jennlyn owns and operates a videoke (also called karaoke - amateur singing to a music video background) bar business, selling soft drinks and other foods in the bar. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximatE. 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Jennlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Jennlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay for the installation of a security gate in front of her house

loans.name: Rosa Jakeline

texts.es:
La socia ROSA JAKELINE pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es original del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”.

La socia tiene 25 años de edad es soltera y vive en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco. La socia es profesora del nivel primario en el colegio “Niño Jesús” del Cusco, nuestra socia es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora pues con mucho anhelo abrió una pequeña librería. Ya tiene un año con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder aumentar el capital del negocio. Por estas fiestas navideñas quiere comprar y vender juguetes, arreglos navideños y peluches.     

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
ROSA JAKELINE is a client of the Community Bank “HATUN SONCCO”. The name of the community bank is from the Quechua language. "HATUN" means "Large" and "SONCCO" means "Heart", which translated into English means "Large Heart". Rosa is 25 years old, single, and lives in the imperial city of Cuzco. She is a first grade teacher in the “Niño Jesús (Baby Jesus)” school in Cuzco. She is a very hard worker, and very entrepreneurial, so she has very eagerly opened a small book store. She has done this for a year, and it has gone very well, due to the determination Rosa brings to her work. Rosa is requesting a loan to supplement her business capital. For the Christmas holidays who wants to purchase and sell toys, Christmas gifts and stuffed animals. Rosa is grateful for the opportunity offered in this way, and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital to sell Christmas gifts

loans.name: Teav

texts.en:
Mrs. Teav P. is 27 years old and she lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province. She is a tailor. Her husband, Mr. Im Sineth, is a farmer who owns 2.5-hectare (6.25-acre) plot of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces an obstacle because he needs some money to hire labor for plowing and to buy pesticides to support his rice field. In order to deal with these problems, Mrs. Teav P. decided to ask for a loan for these purposes.

This couple has a child who is three years old. Mrs. Teav P.’s husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To hire labor for plowing and to buy pesticides to support her husband's rice field

loans.name: Bebe Liala Group

texts.en:
This is Bebe Liala group. It is made up of five members. They all would like to expand their business and progress as well. Together, they have requested a group loan of 50000 Afghani.

Jamila is the group leader. She is a beautician. She has got a small beauty salon where most of her clients come. She would like to expand her business and to buy some more chairs and good quality cosmetics for her salon. This is why she has requested for a loan, to complete the necessities of her business.

The second member, Nadia, wants to take a loan for her husband’s mobile selling shop. With the loan, he would like to expand his business.

The third member is Zamir A., a hard working boy. With the loan he receives, he would buy more mobile seats for his shop.

Sheba, another member of this group, would like to purchase materials to design more beautiful things from beads.

Bebe Liala wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. With the loan, she wants to buy a new sewing machine. 

They are all thankful to the Kiva lenders from their support.

loans.use: For purchasing necessary materials for businesses

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein has owned a car repair shop in his village since 1994. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his two children's needs. Today, Hussein is requesting $1,000 to buy additional tools for his job.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is in need of additional capital for his business and that’s why he joined CEVI, a  micro-finance institute in the Philippines. He is 50 years old and married.

Reynaldo is engaged in rice farming. He wants to double his harvest so he applied for a loan of Php 6,000 which he will use to purchase farm supplies like fertilizer.

Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Reynaldo’s farming as he aims to double his harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Felilou's Group

texts.en:
Felilou R. is from the village of Palattao. She is 48 years old. Felilou is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Felilou R..

Felilou is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Felilou owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Felilou is just starting this business.

In 2010, Felilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Felilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gina's Group

texts.en:
Gina L. is from the village of General Balao, Solana, Cagayan, and is the leader of a ten-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Gina is 42 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells an animal she has raised.
In 2010, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Amaar

texts.en: Amaar B. S. 23 years old and single with a college diploma from Beta, Nablus. Amaar is currently living with his wife and parents. He is also supporting two other family members. In 2007 Amaar saw a need and opened a coffee and billiard shop. This shop is unique in that it provides free, unlimited internet access. He is hoping that with the loan he is asking for he will be able to refurbish the billiard tables. His future plans are to open two separate stores — one for billiards and the other a coffee shop.

loans.use: To refurbish billiard tables in his cafe

loans.name: Ritah

texts.en:
B. Ritah B. has owned and operated a retail shop for over three years. She plans to use this loan to purchase retail shop items such as sugar, salt, soap, flour, and rice for sale. She is a hard-working businesswoman whose dream is to expand her shop business. 

B. Ritah B. is married and is a permanent resident of Nkoowe. Her parents live in Kikiri.

loans.use: To purchase retail shop items such as sugar, salt, soap, flour, and rice for sale

loans.name: Romula

texts.en:
Romula B. is from the city of Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a flower vending business and she is now expanding delivery into neighboring towns. Romula has managed this business for more than 8 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it. Romula joined PMPC to gain access to financial help to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. Romula is requesting a new loan, her 13th, of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional flowers and pesticides.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old and she is a widow.  Beatrice has a beauty salon where she cuts hair.  She has done this business for about three years and her beauty salon is open from morning until late in the evening hours.  She employs five people in her business.

Beatrice is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy other machines for cutting hair.  With these additional machines, Beatrice expects to attract more clients and make more profits.  With these profits, Beatrice will start saving and creating as many sources of income as possible.

loans.use: Additonal machines for cutting hair

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Juntos residen en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, localizada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen  su propia casa a base de madera. Alejandra siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona original y creativa, por lo que sabe como llevar a cabo las relaciones con los compradores potenciales. En la actualidad comparte el liderazgo en su comunidad con otro productor, siendo el cacao, café y la hoja de coca, productos que trabaja con mucho esmero. Sin embargo una de las dificultades que se presentan son los continuos derrumbes que hay en el camino y eso le impide a vender toda su mercadería. Su mayor anhelo es ser la primera productora dentro de su comunidad, para ello piensa comprar terrenos de otros productores que no le estén dando buen uso, para que pueda producir allí en mayor escala. Por lo general su producto los vende en su misma chacra, con la finalidad de minimizar costo y tiempo, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo, pero generalmente tiene peones que se encargan de la cosecha. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus compromisos de pago, además esta conforme por la responsabilidad y puntualidad que ejercen cada de uno de sus socios dentro de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comrpará fertilizantes que le servirá para mejorar sus plantaciones de cacao y de esa manera prevenir cualquier inconveniente que pueda repercutir en sus plantaciones agrícolas.
texts.en:
Alejandra, 54, is married and has three children. They live together in Manitea Alta located on the Amazonian side of the eastern Andes where they have their own wood house. Alejandra has always been noted for being very original and creative; she knows how to relate to potential buyers. She is currently co-leader in her community with another producer. The main crops are: cocoa beans, coffee and coca leaves, all products that she grows diligently. However, a recurrent problem is the constant landslides on the road which prevents her from selling all her product. Her greatest wish is to become the main producer in her community and to accomplish this she plans to buy more land from other producers that aren’t maximizing their use so that she can produce there on a greater scale. Generally, she sells from her own fields in order to minimize costs and time. Occasionally her husband helps her but she usually has field hands to bring in the harvest. This is her 6th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is also quite satisfied with the responsibility and punctuality of her fellow group members. She will use the requested funds to buy fertilizers to improve her cocoa bean crops so that she can prevent any inconvenience that might adversely affect her plants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Javeriana Senarillos' Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Javeriana S. is from the village of Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years of age and the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Javeriana S.’ Group. Javeriana is married and was blessed with four children, two are adults and the other two are at school age. For their living, the couple is engaged in a corn production activity.  Aside from that, Javeriana is also working as a house helper. They earn approximately $108 a month. She’s been engaged in agricultural activities for twenty years.

In 2007, Javeriana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As an active member of the PDP-LP, a micro-finance program that reaches out to rural communities, she is now requesting a loan of 14,500 PHP which will be used for her son's wedding expenses. This will be her 8th loan from PMPC. 

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the wedding expenses of her son

location.town: Ozamis-Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Kukartuna Group

texts.en:
Ruth B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Kukartuna. She is 45 years old, married and has one child who is 11 years old. 
She was only able to attend school to 3rd grade due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling.

For 4 years she has been selling rubber bowls and cups in Cotton Tree Community in Harbel, Margibi County, Liberia.

She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more rubber bowls and cups. She describes herself as a determined woman.

Her goal is to improve her business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Joseph is inset at the lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more rubber bowls and cups

loans.name: John Seruma

texts.en:
46-year-old John Seruma K. is a dedicated, affable and foresighted gentleman with a clear sense of what he wants for his business in the short and long term. Before he began this business he was more inclined to carpentry, but for the last 10 years he has worked hard in his metal fabrication and welding workshop in Kayunga Town. John mostly makes products like metal doors, gates, windows and deckers, and in a week makes 100,000 shillings. The happily married father of five also concurrently operates a mowing business.

With this loan of 2,000,000 UGX, John wants to purchase more scrap metal. This, he says, will aid him in making most of the products he sells, such as metal gates, beds and windows.

In the photo John Seruma K. is seen standing besides some of the metal products he has made.

loans.use: To purchase more scrap metal

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella J. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil, tomatoes, dried fish and bread at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell.  

Stella is 31 years old and married to a businessman. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house to rent out.

loans.use: Stock onions and Irish potatoes to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells second-hand clothes at Takoradi. She is married and taking care of seven dependents. Esi has been through junior high school. Her husband is a tailor. She pays utility bills and does the cooking for the family. Her loan will be used to buy a bale of second-hand clothes for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a shop.

loans.use: buy a bale of second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: Ola

texts.en:
Ola is a mother and housewife from Gaza Strip. Ola is a mother of three daughters: Lina, Lana and Farah. Her husband, Yousef, is a Palestinian National Authority employee and runs a bookstore. The bookstore where Yousef appears in the picture is located in the schools' area.

Ola helps her husband manage the work at the bookstore when he is at work. As school is starting this week, Ola and Yousef needed a $1500 loan to purchase stationary and school new year preparations. Ola came to FATEN for the loan and was able to buy the needed goods for the new year.

The bookstore helps the family manage their expenses. Ola doesn't appear in the picture as she comes from a conservative background.

loans.use: To purchase stationary

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a thirty-two-year-old woman and single mother. She owns a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Pamela is very enterprising; for six years, she has been selling new clothes and the business is very profitable. However, she has the challenge of late payment by her debtors and this is a setback to her business goal of becoming a wholesaler.

Pamela therefore needs this loan to purchase more shirts, trousers and women’s clothing to sell in her shop at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more shirts, trousers and women's clothing for her shop

loans.name: Dam

texts.en:
Dam T., age 50, is married to Sokum, age 43. She has five children, two of whom are employed. One is a construction worker and the other, a garment worker; the other three are attending school. Her husband has been earning a living for many years by playing music for people who want him to play for their ceremonies, while Dam T. has a plot of land for farming.

Dam T. and her husband have earned a better income since her first two children grew up. Sokum has a motorbike, but he wants to put it to use to earn extra income, and it is a good time for that. Because of that, Dam T. has decided to seek a loan of $400 from Kiva, which she will use for her husband to buy a cart to connect to his motorbike to run a transport business.

loans.use: To buy a cart to connect to her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Hoflade A. Rosine

texts.fr: T. Hoflade A. Rosine est née le 27 Mars 1977 et est mariée à ZOUNMENOU Gilbert, un transitaire. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit depuis une quinzaine d’année au quartier Ayélawadjè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Rosine vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges de la famille, grâce au revenu de son activité.  Rosine n’a pas fréquenté l’école, mais a appris la coiffure. Parallèlement à cette activité qu’elle mène passionnément, Rosine vend des mèches, des tissus et des produits de cheveux dans son atelier. Rosine achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que Rosine sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un appui financier, en vue de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les trois premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Hoflade A. Rosine T. was born on 27 March 1977, and is married to Gilbert Zounmenou, a shipping agent. The couple have two children, both of whom are in school. The family has lived for about 15 years in the Ayélawadjè area of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Rosine helps her husband and joins him in providing for the family, thanks to the income from her business. She never attended school, but did learn how to be a hairstylist. Alongside this hairstyling business that she runs with passion, Rosine sells hair extensions, fabric, and hair products at her workshop. She buys these products at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. This is the fourth time that Rosine is seeking a loan with ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), with the goal of strengthening her business and better satisfying her clientele. The three previous loans were all repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair products

loans.name: Martha Heliodora

texts.es: La señora Martha Heliodora tiene 41 años es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas menores de edad. La señora tiene su negocio que es una pulpería, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación. No es un negocio pequeño, ya que ella tiene una gran variedad de productos. Ella ya tiene 8 años de tener este negocio, sin embargo es importante mencionar que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el pan de cada día, sin embargo tuvo que desistir debido a que muchos clientes no le pagaban. La señora está solicitando este crédito para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, pan, detergentes y sopas. Su sueño siempre ha sido que con su trabajo sus hijas puedan prepararse y llegar a estudiar en la universidad, brindándole una mejor vida con mayores facilidades.
texts.en:
Sra. Martha Heliodora is 41 years old and a single mother of two young daughters. She manages a store located in her home. It is not a small business since she offers a wide variety of products. Martha has already been in business for eight years, but it is important to mention that she has always enjoyed working and earning to supply for her daily needs. However, she has had to cut back because of several customers who did not pay.

Sra. Martha is requesting this loan so that she can buy candy, soft drinks, bread, detergents, and soups. Her dream has always been to prepare her daughters so that they can study at the university and have a life of greater ease.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María, resiD. en Yoloaiquin, departamento D. Morazán, es comerciante D. cosméticos, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos: Iris D. 16, Roberto D. 13, Yolanda D. 3 años D. edad, él es empleado D. la fuerza armada, y ella pues su negocio lo realiza a través D. revistas, visita a todos los vecinos y lugares cercanos casa por casa ofreciendo los productos.
En esta temporada que se acercan  las fiestas D. fin D. año quiere comprar productos que están en ofertas para vendarlas a precio normal, dándole una ganancia extra, por eso solicita un préstamo para comprar esta mercadería a bajo costo.
Sus aspiraciones son apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios, para que estos tengan un mejor futuro y mejores condiciones para su vida.
texts.en: Maria sells cosmetics and lives with her husband and three children (Iris age 16, Roberto 13, and Yolanda 3) in Yoloaiquin in the department of Morazan. Her husband works for the armed forces and she visits her neighbors nearby selling goods through catalogs. As the year end festivities draw near she wants to buy products that are discounted to sell them at regular price thus earning extra profit. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy this merchandise and a lower cost. She hopes to support her children in their studies so that they can have a better future and a better quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es: Eulogio, D. 32 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado D. su esposa Janeth D. 30 años y D. sus 3 pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día para salir adelante. Hace más D. 4 años, este emprendedor hombre se dedica al trabajo en su  taller D. mecánica D. reparación D. motocarros, aunque el local es alquilado, comparte los gastos con un socio, el cual ofrece aceites lubricantes. Esta muy satisfecho con su labor, pues el tiempo le ha permitido hacerse bien conocido por L. zona, lo que le ha generado gran cantidad D. clientes que prefieren ir a su taller por los buenos precios que ofrece. Se desempeña en su negocio D. lunes a sábado durante todo el día, y pueD. quedarse hasta altas horas D. L. noche, si tiene algún trabajo pendiente. Y esta muy satisfecho, pues las ganancias le permiten brindarle a su familia una buena calidad D. vida. Como es un hombre emprendedor para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda D. comestibles en su casa, para que su esposa L. atienda, D. esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Eulogio tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en el refaccionamiento D. un motocarro que espera brindar en alquiler para después revenderlo; así espera mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eulogio, 32 years old, lives in his own house that is next to his wife Janeth, 30 years old, and their 3 small children.  Together, they strive to succeed every day.  For more than 4 years, this enterprising man has worked in his auto shop repairing motorcycle taxis.  Even though the place is rented, he shares the costs with a partner, who provides the motor oils.  He is very satisfied with his work because through the years he has become well-known in the area, which has generated a lot of customers who prefer to go to his shop for its good prices.

He works at his business from Monday to Saturday all day, and can stay up late at night if he has some work to do.  He is very happy, as profits allow him to give his family a good quality of life.  An an entrepreneur for the future, he plans to install a grocery store at home that his wife can attend to, in order to improve their profits.  

This is his first loan with MFP and promises to pay his dues on time because he does not want to give a bad impression to the people who maD. this contribution possible.  This will allow him to continue working toward progress.  Eulogio plans to invest the loan requested in the repair of a motorcycle taxi that he hopes to rent and later sell, in expectation of increasing their income.

loans.use: To repair a motorcycle taxi in order to resell it.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A.  is married and has three children.  Her husband is a land surveyor.  Efua, a junior high graduate, sells tomatoes, pepper and other food items at Takoradi.  She uses her income to assist her husband in providing for the basic needs of their family.

Efua intends to use this loan to purchase food items which are often requested by her customers.  She plans to reinvest any new profits she makes back into her business so she can expand her operations.

loans.use: to buy food items such as tomato and pepper for resale

loans.name: Asomuddin

texts.ru: Нуров Асомуддин проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 62 года. Женат. Имеет 8 детей. Сыновья работают. Сам Асомуддин имеет среднее образование. Более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Он хочет посеять и получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en: Asomuddin N., 62, lives in Qulyab. He is married with eight children. His sons work. Asomuddin himself has high school education. He spent twenty years planting crops. He owns a piece of land where he plants wheat. Asomuddin is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and to secure a good crop for sale.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Cheoung

texts.en: Cheoung Y., 36, is married and resides with her family in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Y. sells fish, earning an income of 3.80USD  per day. Her husband is a teacher at a local school, earning an income of around 3.90 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 55 USD on food and 45 USD on the other necessary expenses. Y. is requesting a loan of  500 USD to purchase more fish to resell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy more fish to resell

loans.name: Maria Aida's Group

texts.en:
Maria Aida G. is from the town of Sibula,Lopez Jaena. She is 47 years old. Maria Aida is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Maria Aida is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Aida owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood pruducts such as fish and shrimps in the local community. Maria Aida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Maria Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Maria Aida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Maria Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Renalyn's Group

texts.en:
Renalyn B., 22 years old,  is from the village of Calaocan, Angadanan, Isabela. She is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Renalyn is married and has 1 infant. She owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. Renalyn is just starting this business.

In 2011, Renalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Renalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity, age 34, is a tomato vendor. She is a widow with nine children, all of whom go to school. Charity is requesting a loan in order to stock more tomatoes to sell. She hopes eventually to build a concrete house for the family with the extra profits she expects from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tomatoes to offer for sale

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda R. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Brenda is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Brenda owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like fishballs, kekiam, siomai and tempura in the local community. Brenda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture is Brenda and two of her children.

In 2010, Brenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Brenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed like cooking oil, raw kekiam and tempura. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Brenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed like cooking oil, raw kekiam and tempura

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: Fiorella Victoria

texts.es: Fiorella tiene 26 años de edad y es casada. Vive junto a su esposo en la casa de sus suegros en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana su vida como empleado en una botica en su comunidad. Tiene dos años de experiencia en este rubro. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacer unos arreglos en su domicilio para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Fiorella es muy trabajadora y responsable. Posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad. Ha manejado otros préstamos y cumplió con sus obligaciones de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Fiorella is 26 years old and married.  She lives with her husband in her in-laws' home which is in Olmos district.  This is an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Fiorella earns a living as an employee in a drugstore in her community.  She has two years experience in this line of work.  Fiorella's house is currently in a bad state of repair.  She would like to make some repairs to her home in order to improve her family's quality of life.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Fiorella is very hard working and responsible.  She has good personal and work references from her community.  She has had previous loans and paid them all back on time.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home

loans.name: Adjwoa

texts.en:
Adjwoa A. is a widow and supports her family through her palm oil business. In the photograph, Adjoa is pumping and filtering the oil. She has been doing this for ten years now. As the sole breadwinner of her family, Adjwoa wants the financial security of a higher income and increased savings. In order to do so, she has to expand her business.

Her Kiva loan will be used to purchase more palm fruit for oil extraction. She intends to save up the additional earnings for the security of her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit for oil extraction.

loans.name: Eddil Esperanza

texts.es:
Eddil es una madre D. familia D. 59 años D. edad, tiene casa propia donD. vive con su esposo e hijos, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo D. agua y luz. Su casa está ubicada en la calle Atahualpa sin número en el distrito D. Olmos  y aproximadamente a una hora D. la  provincia D. Chiclayo.  Esta zona es rural y la actividad que desarrollan sus pobladores es la agricultura y ganadería.

Eddil  ha puesto  en su casa su negocio donD. venD. cerveza, gaseosas y agua mineral,  sus  vecinos cuando tienen algún acontecimiento importante (cumpleaños y festividades en Olmos) la buscan para comprarle sus productos ya que es muy conocida en su distrito, el pequeño negocio con el que cuenta es el único medio D. ingreso que tiene para  mejorar el nivel D. vida D. su familia.

Mediante una visita a Edpyme Alternativa Eddil trata D. adquirir un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles para abastecer su tienda con mas cerveza, gaseosas y agua mineral y así pueda satisfacer a sus clientes, y D. paso incrementa sus ingresos para su hogar.

Eddil es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer  alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con elobjetivo D. que como familia salga adelante apunta D. esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Eddil is a 59 year old mother.  She lives in her own home with her husband and children.  Their home has water and electricity only and is located on Atahualpa street, without a number, in the Olmos district, approximately an hour from the province of Chiclayo.  This is a rural area and the residents work in agriculture and raise livestock.  

Eddil has a business in her house where she sells beer, soda and mineral water.  When her neighbors have an important event (birthdays and celebrations in Olmos) they buy her products as she is well-known in the district. This small business is her only means of income to better her families quality of life.  

Through a visit to Edpyme Alternativa, Eddil is trying to borrow 1500 nuevos soles [Peruvian currency] to stock her store with more beer, soda and mineral water to satisfy her customers and increase her household income.  

Eddil is known by her neighbors as a cheerful woman who is willing to help others and also, as a responsible mother whose goal is to proviD. for her family through hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more beer, soda and mineral water.

loans.name: Tura

texts.en:
Tura is 49 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Tura works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.

Tura has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 19 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading and farming of rice and coconut.

Tura aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: C4711 Tujyeheza Group

texts.en:
Alexandre is 36 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 2 and 14. He is the representative of a group called "Tuyjeheza" in the local language. Alexandre is the first person on the right who is raising his hand. He has been in this business for one year. His business is well-organized, and he is open from 8am until 5pm every day and employs one person to help him. 

Alexandre and his group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more quantities of fruits and vegetables to sell. He will reinvest the profits in his business and save for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zenabou

texts.fr: Revendeuse ambulante d’œufs de poules, Zenabou  a 02 enfants. Agée de 29ans, son conjoint est chauffeur. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et distribue à ses clients.  Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des marchandises. Il ya 6ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.
texts.en: Itinerant reseller of chicken eggs, Zenabou has 2 children.  She is 29 years old. Her husband is a driver. She stocks up in Lome and distributes to her customers. This loan will help her buy goods.  She has been in business for 6 years.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Lucia Guillermina

texts.en: Lucia lives in the San Lorenzo region of Honduras and has made a living for many years by making and selling tortillas out of her home. She has been a client of Prisma in the past and used previous loans to support her business and make home improvements. Lucia is currently requesting a loan of Lps. 15,000 to replace the dirt floor in her home with concrete.

loans.use: to purchase the materials for putting in a concrete floor.

loans.name: Mukisa Development Group

texts.en:
Thirty years running a successful tailoring business is no easy accomplishment. But a certain enterprising 48-year-old lady, who goes by the name of Joyce, has notched it. She operates in Mpigi. Longevity is not something most people talk about when they are discussing this kind of business. Most people involved in this business face stiff competition from local textile industries and the secondhand clothing markets. Most of the clothes they sew may not even be bought, if the price is not that pocket favorable. Most people would rather make do with secondhand clothing. This, however, was not a factor that could dampen Joyce's spirits 30 years ago, when she sought to earn her keep and obtain a footing in this business.

She has, by and large, had a chequered experience running this business. At the beginning, she was mostly sewing school uniforms for schools. With time, she diversified and starting sewing all sorts of clothes to sell. With orders from schools increasing, and her other clothes (mostly lady's clothes) selling favorably in her shop, Joyce knew that, with determination, she could make headway. The new lease on life in her business was translating into better sales profits. Given her nature, however, she could not rest on her laurels. This is one attribute which has kept her business afloat. Most of her friends say she is never complacent.

Weekly, her business sales revenue totals up to 60,000 Ugandan shillings. This is modest by her standards but she remains upbeat. The economic status quo in the country as of now is adverse and she knows most people are facing it tough. Once the situation improves, she envisages better conditions for her business. For Joyce's group, this is their second loan cycle. Joyce says she is requesting this Kiva loan money to purchase more clothes-making textile materials. With this, she reckons she will be able to make more clothes and school uniforms to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes-making textile materials.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos de 16, 13, 8 y 4 años de edad, todos son dependientes, ella se dedica a atender un chalet desde hace dos años en la escuela de la comunidad, ofreciendo a los estudiantes y maestros boquitas, galletas, dulces, jugos, gaseosas, su horario de venta es de 7:00am a 5:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería, con la intención de fortalecer los productos que ofrecen por ejemplo: galletas, jugos, gaseosa, boquitas y más. Esta inversión le permitirá tener mayor variedad de productos, su único problema es que este negocio funciona mientras haya clases, al momento de salir de vacaciones ella debe procurar otro negocio.
Su visión a futuro es mejorar a través del negocio la condición económica de su familia, también enseñarles a sus hijos el negocio, para que aprendan a vender y puedan en un momento dado suplantarla.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and their 4 dependent children aged 16, 13, 8 and 4.  She has had a stand for 2 years at a school in her community where she offers the students and teachers snacks, cookies, sweets, juices, and soft drinks.  Her stand is open from 7am until 5pm.

Now Maria requests a loan to buy merchandise with the idea of having more products to sell, for example: cookies, juices, soft drinks, snacks and other items.  This investment will allow her to have a greater variety of products.  The only problem with this business is that it only works when classes are in session.  During the school vacations she has to look for other business. 

Her vision of the future is to improve the economic condition of her family through this business.  In addition, she will teach her children the business, so that they can learn to sell and at some point take her place.

loans.use: to buy cookies, juices, soft drinks, snacks and other items.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 29-year-old farmer. He is married to Esther who is not working. They are blessed with one child who is one year old. He has been a mixed crop farmer for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.


He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Patrick will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his farm by buying another piece. His hopes and dreams are to export the farm produce, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso D. Juli”, ubicado en el distrito D. Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento D. Puno, tiene 55 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, cuatro D. ellos independientes.  La Sra. no cuenta con estudios.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace cuatro años, su préstamo inicial fue D.  S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. artículos artesanales en bordados.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/. 600.00 nuevo soles, comprará bayetas y lanas para sus bordados y así venderlos en la ciudad D. Puno y Juli.  En el negocio le ayudan sus hijos y su esposo, quien trabaja como albañil.
Su sueño es seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque están alegres e intercambian palabras entre las socias.
texts.en:
María Magdalena is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres al Progreso D. Juli” ("Women for Progress, of Juli"), which is located in the district of Juli, in the province of Chucuito, in the department of Puno.  She is 55 years old, and is married with five children, four of whom are financially independent.  The señora does not have an education.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for four years.  Her first loan was for 300 New Soles, money which she invested in her business selling handcrafted embroidered items.  With this new loan of 600 New Soles, she will buy cloth and wool for her embroidery, which she will sell in the city of Puno and in Juli.  Her sons help her in the business, as does her husband, who works in construction.

Her dream is to continue with her business and grow her income.

What she likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings, as they are happy occasions and she gets to exchange words with the other members.

loans.use: to buy cloth and wool for her embroidery

loans.name: Roukeyatou

texts.fr:
Roukeyatou est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée à un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants.  
Roukeyatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle vend des produits géneriques à toutes les personnes au marché. Elle travaille seule. 
Roukeyatou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits génériques. Elle veut étendre son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Roukeyatou voudrait agrandir son marché. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Roukeyatou, 31, is married to a retailer and has two children. She has been working selling generic products since 2002. She sells the generic products to all comers in the marketplace. She works alone. 

Roukeyatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy generic products. She wants to expand her business. 

In the coming years, she would like to reach more customers. She says that with the profit she intends to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy generic products for resale.

loans.name: Idalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Idalia, vive con sus dos hijos, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de tamales, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia, debido a la necesidad de trabajar para sus hijos.
Idalia, Comprara materiales para hacer tamales y enchiladas, la compra será específicamente en: pollo, maíz, condimentos, aceite, de esta forma continuara produciendo para vender y  espera que su negocio marche bien siempre con ganancias en las ventas.
Sueña con ampliarse en sus negocios, atender la tamalería y el comercio de ropa de la mejor manera, mejorando los ingresos y que su condición económica sea más solvente.
texts.en:
Idalia lives with her two children.  She is a single mother who sells tamales for a living.  She started this business on her own initiative because she needed to work for her children.

Idalia will buy ingredients to make tamales and enchiladas.  Specifically, she will buy chicken, corn, condiments, and oil, and this will allow her to continue producing to sell.  She hopes that her business will always do well with earnings from sales.

She dreams of expanding her businesses, of handling her tamale business and her clothing business in the best way, of improving earnings and of being in a more solvent financial state.

loans.use: to buy chicken, corn, condiments, and oil to prepare enchiladas and tamales.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es: Araceli tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. En la población en donde vive el día de muertos es una de las celebraciones más importantes en nuestro país, es una ocasión dedicada especialmente a los que ya no están. El 2 de noviembre la gente acude a los panteones para adornar las tumbas de sus seres queridos, comer con ellos y algunos más aprovechan para construir en torno a ellas un altar muy peculiar y significativo, porque a través de imágenes, objetos, olores y sabores nos dan una idea de como fue y lo que le gustaba a esa persona en vida. Araceli es parte de esa tradición ella se dedica hacer las coronas que adornan año con año las tumbas y todo el año se pone hacer estas lindas coronas de diferentes colores, diferentes flores. Platica que sus padres fueron quienes le enseñaron el amor por su trabajo que año con año las hace con mucho esfuerzo. Ella esta pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para comprar su material que ocupa para hacer sus coronas de muerto como le llaman en su población, comprara, madera, alambre, plástico, diferentes flores de colores, listones, hilo etc. la meta que tiene Araceli es hacer crecer su negocio y comprar un poco mas de material por que muy pronto se viene la temporada alta de ventas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Araceli is 29, married, with three children. In the town where she lives, and in the rest of the country, the "Day of the Dead" is one of the most important celebrations. It is an occasion specially devoted to those who are no longer with us. 

On November 2nd, people go to the cemeteries to decorate the graves of their loved ones and to eat with them.  Others take the opportunity to surround the grave with a very unusual and meaningful altar; as through images, objects, smells and tastes, they give us an idea of what the person was like, and what pleased them when they were alive. 

Araceli is part of that tradition. She works making wreaths that each year are used to decorate the graves, and all year long she makes beautiful wreaths of different colors and different flowers. She tells us that her parents were the ones who taught her to love this work, that year after year she does with a lot of effort. 

She is asking the institution for a loan to buy the material that she uses to make her "Day of the Dead" wreaths, as they are called in her town. She will buy wood, wire, plastic, different colored flowers, ribbons, thread etc. Araceli's goal is to make her business grow  and also to buy a little more material, because the high season for sales in her community is coming very soon.

loans.use: To make "Day of the Dead" funeral wreaths.

loans.name: Tanaiwa Group

texts.en:
Sonica is 61 years old. She is a widow and has two children, both of whom are grown up and have their own families. She lives in Mucheke, Masvingo with two dependents. 

Sonica is a vegetable vendor and has been in business for 32 years. She sells fruits and vegetables and the business faces a challenge of funds for restocking. With the loan, Sonica will buy fruits and clothes for resale. She will be able to pay for her grandchildren's school fees. In the next five years, she wishes to open a stall in the flea market in town for her granddaughter.

loans.use: To buy clothing and fruit.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
This is Flora, 44, a resident of Quezon City, Philippines. She is a single parent to a high school student. She manages her household while operating her business. She works hard to meet her family’s daily needs and expenses.

Flora operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition, but also a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and other foods cost less than raw food. 

Flora also retails electronic cell phone loads (prepaid cell phone credits) and operates a small variety store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,200 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 15, 000 that will help her continue her business.  She will be using the loan to buy raw meat, vegetables, and other products that will help her to meet the demands of her numerous customers. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs and her child’s educational expenses.  

Flora dreams that her business will continue to grow. She wants her child to finish studies and be able to have a comfortable life someday. She never fails to attend the fellowship* every week, as it helps her to be stronger and closer to God with all the Bible studies being conducted. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa, 57, is a widow with five children.

Josefa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Josefa has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for twenty years and also earns an income from food vending.

Josefa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Saturnina

texts.en:
Ma. Saturnina is a 25-year-old married woman with 2 young children. She and her husband have been running a fishing business in Nocnocan, Talibon for 10 years. This business earns 10000 PHP per month.

Ma. Saturnina has requested a loan to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and other materials. Ma. Saturnina hopes for this loan to help improve their fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, crab traps and other materials

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan is married and has no children. She is 53 years old and operates a grocery store from her home to financially support her husband, who works for the city's Municipal Corporation. At her shop, Siddiqan sells everyday household items such as spices, salt, soaps, cooking oil, and sugar at low prices. Her clients are very satisfied with her good-quality products and service. Along with running her business, she also performs her household duties very well. 

Siddiqan is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her business. With the loan investment, she will purchase grocery products in bulk quantities, which will allow her to fulfill the needs of her community clients and increase her sales and profits. She is very new to her business, having started it last year. She is confident that a loan will help her become established in her business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Siddiqan.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery business.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 33 years old and her husband, Tork, is 37 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one son and two daughters who are in school. 
 

Chanthy is a weaver and raises pigs at home, while her husband sells piglets. He buys piglets from the fellow villagers and sells in other districts. 

Chanthy is asking for her first loan in the amount of $400 to purchase additional piglets for her husband to sell.   

Photo: Chanthy is pictured next to her pigpen.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets for her husband to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 36 year old married woman with two children.  Both of them are in school.  She has had a business of selling food in Yambio South Sudan for the past two years.
Margret is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Porn's Group

texts.en:
The head of a big family in a village in the Ratanak Mondul district, Porn is the father of nine children, two of whom are married and the rest of whom work on the farm to support the family. Porn is a farmer who grows maize and beans as his primary business. He has been in this business for 10 years.

This is Porn's sixth loan from VisionFund. He took his first loan five years ago. The loans have helped him better support his family and afford sufficient food. He and his group member, who has been with VisionFund for six years, are applying for another loan. He will use his portion of the loan, US $250, to buy maize seeds and fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes that he will earn more income from his business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer for his farmland.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, solicita un nuevo préstamo con la intención de mejorar su negocio de tortillas comprando: maíz, leña, gas, bolsas, asi podrá tener lo necesario para el sostenimiento de su negocio.
Ella considera que los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque el negocio está estable logro tener mejores resultados en sus ganancias y en clientes.
texts.en:
Juana is requesting a new loan because she wants to improve her activity by buying maize, firewood, gas and bags to make tortillas; in this way she will be able to acquire what she needs to support her activity.
She says that the previous loans have been of great helped for her because her activity is now stable and she has succeeded in obtaining better results both with her earning and with her customers.

loans.use: To buy maize, firewood, gas and bags.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon, 56, is widowed and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She is a construction worker. Her daughter is a garment worker. Now, her son is getting a job in Korea. 

Therefore, Thon is requesting for a loan of USD 300 to pay for her son's medical checkup for his immigration to Korea. 

In the future, she would like to run a sewing shop for her daughter at home and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to pay for her son's medical checkup.

loans.name: Maria Agneli

texts.es:
Maria siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y siempre querer ofrecer a su hijo una mejor educación y mejor calidad de vida. Maria es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo, a quien siempre le ha tenido que ofrecer el sustento necesario, pues su padre los abandonó sin contribuir económicamente para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Maria desde entonces tiene su negocio de venta de fritos, snack y dulces con lo que garantiza los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Maria en su negocio ha podido tener muy buenos clientes, pues principalmente son los estudiantes quienes acceden a su tienda y esto le garantiza muy buenas ventas. Maria presenta al mismo tiempo el inconveniente de la ausencia de ventas cuando los estudiantes se encuentran de vacaciones, por lo que debe generar grandes ventas cuando los estudiantes se encuentran para poder soportar los gastos en los meses donde no hay estudiantes. Debido a que ha iniciado la temporada escolar, y Maria cuenta con muy bajo capital, Maria busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de snack, fritos, dulces, gaseosas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio en la temporada escolar. 
Maria espera que de esta manera pueda ofrecer a sus clientes todas sus necesidades, y de esta manera tener grandes ventas. Además, Maria espera que con ingresos adicionales pueda garantizarle a su hijo una educación de calidad y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.

loans.use: Compra de productos de snack, fritos, dulces, gaseosas, entre otros, para surtir su negocio en la temporada escolar.

loans.name: Bertha Angelica

texts.es:
Bertha es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 39 años de edad y vive enSan Martin junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como Obrera en los diferentes Fundos Agrícolas de la zona y le va muy bien porque es responsable, trabajadora, honesta y dedicada a su labor.
Bertha está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar puertas para incorporarlas en los cuartos que tiene la vivienda y de esta manera la familia pueda sentirse más cómoda viviendo en un ambiente más seguro.
texts.en:
Bertha is an enterprising woman. She is 39 years old and lives in San Martin with her family. For various years now she has worked as a laborer in different agricultural establishments in the zone. This is going very well because she is responsable, hard-working, honest, and dedicated to her work.

Bertha is grateful for her Kiva loans because with the help they have provided, she has begun to purchase doors to incorporate into the rooms of her house. And now, her family feels more comfortable living in a more secure environment.

loans.use: buy additional doors to install in her residence.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en: Lucille  is 34 years old, married, and has five  children. Her husband is a laborer  and she helps with a business in a farm growing vegetables. Lucille also manages a small backyard piggery. She grows pigs for fattening and sells them to the market. Lucille is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase pig feed, piglets and pesticides.  Lucille, hopes for her children to be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy  pig feed, piglets and pesticides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married with four children. She lives in Kijichi area in Dar es Salaam. The area has no reliable water supply. By the help of her husband and her own savings she managed to buy a water tank and an electric pump. The current size of the tank is not sufficient to meet demand of water from residents.  No public water system exist in the area. Erratic power supply which is experienced by all residents in Dar es Salaam also justifies the need for an additional storage tank and its accessories.  The additional tank will also provide an additional facility for treatment of water ready for domestic use. The project has a great value to the community as it provides a valuable resource need by each households and reduces incidences of water borne diseases.

loans.use: Purchase of Water Tank

loans.name: Abel

texts.en: Abel is married with seven children. He started his livestock trading business 4 years ago in order to supplement his farming activities. He initially started by trading in chicken locally and gradually expanded his business to goats and has subsequently included cattle. He intends to use the US$400 loan from PEMCI to expand his livestock trade. He is very encouraged by the availability of such services and facilities and he is full of expectations for a bright future. The growth in his business has given him good standing in his community and many now seek his advice. He has become a very strong promoter of PEMCI’s services wherever he goes.

loans.use: To Improve and Increase Livestock Trading

loans.name: Ese

texts.en: Ese T. is from the village of Lotofaga Safata.  She is 43-years old and has four children; two of her children are married while the other two remain in school.  She is pictured here with her small children and her grandchildren.  Ese runs a small retail shop in her village.  She is very focused on growing her business and so is her entire family.  By working together, her family ensures that the shop is able to stay open long hours to satisfy her customers and improve her profits.  Ese reinvests as much of her business profit as possible; she is working hard to expand her product line to ensure that the local villagers have access to a wide variety of products.  She will use a loan to buy more merchandise for her shop as well as to buy wood, paint, and corrugated iron to renovate her shop, as a portion of the structure is damaged.
