Matea owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling various food products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Matea joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.es:
Este unidad de desarrollo (UDE) se llama San Luis porque a si se llama la comunidad.  Las UDES son grupos de más de 10 personas que tiene una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunirse semanalmente o quincenalmente para realizar sus pagos.  Tiene un representante y un comité que lo gobierna.  Este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de San Luis estado de VeraC.  El grupo está conformado por  once integrantes.  

El representante del grupo se llama Juana R. A. es casada, tiene 38 años, estudió hasta el 3° año y tiene en total tres hijos 1 mujeres y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a venta de antojitos y necesita el préstamo para comprar lo que le haga falta como carne, masa, verduras, utensilios de cocina.  Sus clientes dicen que guisa muy rico y que tiene buen sazón. Aunque solo sea los fines de semana es muy aseada en su negocio. Doña Juana desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para invertirla a su venta de antojitos y poder así sacar mas ganancias y poder tener mejor vida para ella y sus hijos.

Emilia O. González es parte del comité de este grupo, San Luis.Ella tiene 46 años, estudió hasta el 6°primaria y tiene un total de 3 hijos 1 mujer y 2 varones.  Ella se dedica a venta de abarrotes  y necesita el préstamo para surtir su negocio, comprara arroz, aceite, frijol, sopas, refrescos dulces y galletas.  Sus clientes dicen que es muy amable, responsable y habré muy temprano su tienda. En un futuro desea agrandarlo mas ya que esta algo pequeño. Doña Emilia desea este préstamo para aumentar su negocio, para sacarse una ganancia para seguir invirtiendo y tener bien surtido y en un futuro agrandar su tienda.

Los otros nueve integrantes se llaman Hilda P. O., Elia R. Vázquez, Esperanza C. M., Susana B. R., Lucila S. R., Verónica M., Karla Patricia R. O., Edith Araceli E. U. y Grisel O. González y quieren el préstamo para venta de joyería, antojitos, abarrotes, venta de ropa y venta de pollo.
texts.en:
The name of this economic development unit is San Luis because that’s the name of the community. Economic Development Units are groups of 10 people that have a bank account and that meet weekly or bi-weekly to make their payments. The unit has a representative and a governing board. This group is in the San Luis community in the state of VeraC.. It has 11 members. The group representative is Juana R. A., 38, who is married and has three children, 1 girl and 2 boys; she finished third grade. She sells snacks and needs funding to buy the ingredients she needs like: meat, masa (dough for tortillas), vegetables, and kitchen utensils. Her customers say that she cooks delicious, well-seasoned dishes. Even though she opens only on week-ends, her establishment is very clean. Juana wants this loan so that her business will grow, to earn profits to reinvest in her snack sales, and to earn higher profits so that she and her children can have a better standard of living. Emilia O. González, 46, is on the governing board of this group. She finished 6th grade and has 3 children, one girl and 2 boys. She sells groceries and needs funding to stock her store. She will buy rice, cooking oil, beans, soups, sweet beverages and cookies. Her customers say that she is very kind and responsible and she opens for business very early. In the future, she would like to enlarge her store because it is a bit small. Emilia wants this loan to enlarge her business, to earn better profits to reinvest to have a better-stocked store and, in the future, to enlarge her store. The other nine members are: Hilda P. O., Elia R. Vázquez, Esperanza C. M., Susana B. R., Lucila S. R., Verónica M., Karla Patricia R. O., Edith Araceli E. U. and Grisel O. González, who need funding for their various business enterprises, such as: sale of jewelry, snacks, groceries, clothing, and chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, de 50 años vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposa Gladys (40) y de sus tres hijos; Robert (22), Karen (18) y Jurgen (7).
Desde hace 7 años se dedica al transporte de carga pesada, le gusta mucho su trabajo porque lo realiza durante los días útiles de la semana y descansa todo el fin de semana, también le agrada  mucho manejar y apreciar los hermosos paisajes naturales que ofrece cada rincón del Perú.
A pesar que sus ganancias las comparte con la empresa dueña del camión que maneja, el dinero que obtiene le alcanza para darle buena calidad de vida a su familia.
Pero Roberto tiene aun muchos sueños por cumplir y ya ha empezado a ahorrar para comprarse un auto propio y empezar a trabajar como taxista, pues así obtendría mayores ganancias.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy puntual en el pago de todas sus cuotas, ya que tiene muchos planes de seguir de progreso a base de estos créditos. Con el dinero que solicita incrementará el monto que necesita para comprar su propio auto, y también le hará algunas mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto, 50, lives in his own house with his wife, Gladys (40), and his three children. Robert is 22, Karen is 18, and Jurgen is 7. For seven years he has been working in heavy transport. He likes his work a lot because he works week days and rests the entire week end. Also, he really likes to drive and appreciate the beautiful natural scenery that can be found in every corner of Perú. In spite of the fact that he shares his earnings with the business that owns the truck he drives, the money that he gets suffices to give his family a good quality of life. But, Roberto still has many dreams to fulfill. He has started saving to buy his own car to start working as a taxi driver. That way he would get greater earnings. This is his second loan with MFP, and he promises to make all of his payments punctually. He has a lot of plans to keep progressing, and they are based on the loans. He will use the money he is requesting to increase the amount he has been saving towards buying his own car. He will also make some improvements to his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his next business and improve his house

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Зиодуллоева Шодигул проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 45 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает таксистом. Дети тоже предоставляют услугу, такси. Сама Шодигул занимается торговлей. У нее собственный магазин. Она продает продукты и одежду. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота, т.е. увеличение ассортимента товара. Таким образом Шодигул хочет привлечь внимание клиентов.
texts.en:
Shodigul Z. lives in the city of Dushanbe. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The children also work in the taxi service. Shodigul is involved in retail sales. She owns a store, where she sells food products and clothing. She is requesting this loan in order to increase goods turnover, i.e. expand merchandise selection. Shodogul wants to attract customer attention through this method.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo is 38 years old and a mother of two. Her husband works at the Ministry of Works, Lagos State. She sells cooked food; until recently, she hawked cooked food from place to place but could sell only the little quantity she could carry. After she joined LAPO Microfinance, she was able to own a sales point.

Iyabo opens her stall every week day, from the hour of 8am to 6pm except on Sundays when she normally takes her rest. Her greatest priority has been to feed her children and make sure their school fees are paid.

Iyabo is asking for a loan of NGN100, 000 to purchase more foodstuffs in bulk (at a reduced rate) to cook and sell. This, she said, will enable her to meet the demand of her customers and also increase her profit. She says thank you to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy sewing machines and work supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice and beans for her cafe business

loans.name: Lalitha

texts.en:
Lalitha is a 38-year-old woman who is married. She lives with her four children and her husband in the southern coastal town of Hikkaduwa.  

She has a plot of land on which she cultivates cinnamon.  She has been managing the cinnamon cultivation by herself and devotes her full effort towards this business. 

Lalitha is a very active and strong lady, which helps her in her business. Lalitha has requested a 40,000-LKR loan from BRAC in order to pay labor costs and to purchase chemicals and fertilizer for her cinnamon cultivation. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To pay labor costs and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Hernando

texts.es:
Hernando tiene 24 años, vive en su casa propia, al lado de sus padres y hermanos, en un barrio ubicado en la sierra central peruana.

Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, en la actualidad trabaja junto a sus padres en la siembra papa, alverja y habas. El trabajo de campo es pesado, ya que requiere de mucha  paciencia y dedicación en el cuidado de cada una de las  plantas para que no les caiga plaga y lleguen bien hasta la cosecha.  Según sus palabras: “en la agricultura se gana o se pierde, pero si se cuida bien el cultivo se llega a tener una buena producción”. A Hernando le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque las ganancias de lo vendido le permiten vivir cómodamente. Lo que no le gusta es que muchas veces el precio de la papa baja, se compensa con la venta de las alverja y habas.
Y como es un joven muy emprendedor piensa en el futuro y para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, sobretodo la alverja, ya que su precio se mantiene estable en el mercado nacional.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Además está muy satisfecho con el trabajo que viene realizando su grupo comunal porque todos los integrantes son muy organizados y realizan mensualmente actividades que les permiten juntar para sus ahorros. 

Hernando tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes para asegurar sus plantaciones, también adquirirá semilla de papa, alverja y habas para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Hernando is 24 years old and lives in his own house together with his parents and siblings in a neighborhood located in the central Peruvian mountains.

Since he was very young he has been a farmer, presently he works with his parents planting potato, pea, and bean. Farming is hard work as it requires much patience and dedication with the care of each of the plants not to be affected by plague and reach harvest in good condition. According to his words: "in farming you win or you lose, but if you care properly for your crop you will get a good production". Hernando likes his job because the profit from his sales allows him to live comfortably. What he does not like is that many times the price of potato is low, but the sale of pea and bean makes up for the loss.

And as he is a very entrepreneurial young man he thinks about the future and it is his plan to plant even more, especially pea as the price is stable on the national market.

This is his third loan with MFP and he is very grateful to all the people who made the money possible for him to continue his work. He is also very satisfied with the work done with his community group as all the members are very organized and work on a monthly basis to gather money for their savings.

Hernando plans to invest the requested money in buying fertilizers to assure his crops. He will also purchase potato seed, pea and bean to improve his production.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seed

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, aged 43, is the mother of four. She lives in her own house in Hoima, Uganda, which accommodates her family. She operates a restaurant from which she sustains the welfare of her family of five people.

Evelyn, like many parents and guardians in Uganda, faces the daunting task of looking for school fees for her children when the new school term is about to begin. In most cases, people do not have sufficient cash to facilitate payment of the fees. Evelyn will use the loan funds to pay school fees for her son, Wilbert, who is in high school.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who is in high school

loans.name: Bara De Oro Group

texts.es:
Facundina es socia del Banco Comunal Bara de Oro, su Banco Comunal esta integrada por 12 socias que realizan diferentes actividades.
Facundina es soltera, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y ella sola mantiene su hogar, tiene una casa de material rustico, Facundina brinda servicios de bordados en carteras, correas para una empresa, trabaja para una panadería repartiendo panes a las tiendas, actividad que inicia desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la mañana, también trabaja cuidando una huerta donde hay animales menores y F., por lo que recibe un pago. Además Facundina en sus momentos libres se dedica a lavar ropa ajena.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar para la comida de sus hijos.
Los sueños de Facundina es que su ultimo hijo sea profesional y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Facundina is a member of the Bara de Oro Communal Bank. Her communal bank is comprised of 12 members who do different activities. Facundina is 50, single, and has three children. Two of the children live with her. She supports the household by herself. She has a rustic house. Facundina embroiders purses and sashes for a company. She works for a bakery delivering bread to stores. She does this from four in the morning until seven in the morning. She also works taking care of a garden where there are small animals and flowers, and she receives payment for this. Also, in her free time Facundina washes other people’s clothes. Her loan will be used to buy rice and sugar to feed her children. Facundina dreams that her last child will become a professional. She also dreams of improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar to feed her children

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Якубчонова Малика проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 52 года. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает ткани. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Y. Malika, 52, lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She's a widow, has one child and a high school education. For over ten years she has sold cloth on the market, and is now requesting a loan to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
Hace 22 años, de manera casual y por la necesidad del momento, en que no trabajaba y estudiaba arquitectura, hizo sus primeras camisetas y dese entonces se ha dedicado a la confección de ropa en tejido de punto. Al principio tenía una sola maquina pero gradualmente,cuando se incrementaron sus ventas y a fin de mejorar la calidad de su producto y buscar la eficiencia del proceso, ha ido comprando y adecuando su maquinaria hasta tener las que hoy tiene doce; Asì empezó el negocio Jairo J. S. hoy confeccionando al lado de su esposa, quien después de ser secretaria  se preparó en el Sena para dedicarse completamente a su negocio; ella es quien patrona y escala y él se dedica al diseño, corte, estampado y a la comercialización, principalmente: así tiene como sus clientes a colegios importantes en la ciudad de Barranquilla, a quienes les confecciona sweaters, sudaderas y todo lo que tiene que ver con la línea deportiva, que es el enfoque principal de su negocio. Jairo  apoyado siempre por su esposa ha sacado adelante a su familia,  que la conforman juntos con sus tres hijos de 15, 17 y 21 años de edad. A ellos sueña verlos profesionalmente realizados y en la actualidad está solicitando  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, un crédito educativo, por valor de $1.355.500 COP,  pues su hijo va a estudiar la carrera de abogado. Este es su sexto crédito con esta organización y siente que le ha ido muy bien porque ha logrado darle a sus hijos estudios principalmente.
Jairo dice que la internacionalización de la economía, es su gran desafío, porque lo ha afectado, en la medida en que el mercado trae desde la China, camisetas a muy bajo costo, pero las que en su familia fabrican son de mayor durabilidad; Jairo adema´s de trabajar en sunegocio con su esposa e hijas, tambien trabaja su madre y empleadas que trabajan por producción, el siempre está en busca de estrategias para poner en marcha toda su maquinaria, seguir ganando dinero y lograr trabajo y su bienestar familiar, que es el suyo propio. Jairo  es un miembro de familia incondicional y además es un buen pintor de hermosos cuadros que exhibe con mucha alegria en las paredes de su hogar.
texts.en:
22 years ago [Jairo J. S.] did not work and studied architecture on a casual basis. It was then that he manufactured his first t-shirts and has been sewing garments ever since. He started with a single sewing machine and gradually increased his number, as his sales increased, so that he could increase his efficiency and the quality of his products. He now has 12 machines. And so began Jairo J. S.'s business. He now sews alongside his wife, who was once a secretary, but now works exclusively in this business. She does the measuring and hiring, and he primarily does the design work, cutting, printing, and sales. His customers include prominent schools in the city of Barranquilla, for whom he makes sweaters, sweatshirts; and everything having to do with sports, which is his business' specialty. Jairo, along with his wife's support, has managed to move his family ahead. His family includes his three children, ages 15, 17, and 21. He hopes that he will one day be able to see them all have professional careers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1.355.500 COP ($725), through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because his son is going to begin studying to become a lawyer. This will be his sixth loan though this organization and he feels that things have gone well, because he has managed to provide his children with a primary education. Jairo tells us that the global economy has been a great setback to him, especially because of the Chinese merchandise that has entered the market. Their t-shirts are very inexpensive, but the ones he and his family manufacture are of better quality. Aside from Jario, his wife, and daughters, his mother and several employees also work in production. He is constantly looking for strategies to keep all of his machines producing, creating work, earning money, and providing for his family's (and his own) well being. Jario is a member of a loving family and is also a good artist who proudly displays his paintings on the walls of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Nabingola Dembe Group B, Mubende

texts.en: S. Jamadah is the leader of his lending group in Mubende. He is 30 years old, married  and has 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. He also takes care of dependants. Jamadah sells maize and beans from the roadside market in Nabingola. Jamadah also sells cattle that he buys from the villages and sells to the township for meat and rearing. He is a committed and honest man and, in a month, he is able to make a profit of 190,000/= from produce and cattle sales. Jamadah felt that this was the easiest and most convenient business for him to do and does not regret his decision to do this. He needs a loan to be able to buy more beans and maize for resale. He believes that this will help him pay his children’s school fees as he has managed to build a house out of his savings.

loans.use: to buy more beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 51 years old and married with three children, ages 12, 15, and 22. Two of her children are still in school and one has graduated. Her husband is a farmer. Together they have purchased health insurance for the whole family.

Marie sells cassava in the local market. With the loan she hopes to increase the amount of cassava she sells.

With the profits, Marie plans to buy and sell cattle. She also plans to broaden the types of produce she sells. She will strive to pay off her loan and be able to qualify for larger loans in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cassava to sell

loans.name: C2694 Abafatanye Group

texts.en:
Sada is 45 years old and is married with four children who are 18, 20, 21 and 22 years old.

Sada is the leader of this group called Abafatanye. She and her team operate a business selling a variety of goods including foodstuffs. They have been in this business for about two years and the business hours are from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Although Sada and her team have been in business for about two years, their capital is still too low to expand their business meaningfully. To resolve this, they need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. Once given this loan, they will be able to satisfy the demand of their customers which will result in increased sales as well as increased profits.

If successful, Sada and her team will keep improving their business for better financial stability in the future and, in addition to that, each team member's living style will improve.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods including foodstuffs for their business

loans.name: Eudelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Eudelina C. de 43 años de edad, es casada, tiene una hija de 23 años de edad, ella se dedicaba a la venta de ropas de forma ambulante, después de muchos años y con mucho esfuerzo pudo comprar una casilla detrás mismo del Centro de Salud de Cnel. Oviedo.
Con la ayuda de su hija ella elabora alimentos como empanadas, sandwich, milanesas, y le da de comer a pacientes, parientes y enfermeras del hospital, gracias a su esfuerzo y el empeño e higiene que pone a la hora de elaborar sus productos ella pudo formar su clientela que día  a dia se van a desayunar, almorzar y merendar en su puesto.
La Sra. Eudelina agradece a Kiva y a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo brindado porque gracias a eso ella pudo comprar mas carne, fideos, arroz, lácteos, golosinas, gaseosas, etc. para seguir dando a sus clientes la mas rica comida y al mejor precio ,de esa forma ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Eudelina C., age 43, is married and has a 23 year old daughter. She used to sell clothes in an itinerant manner. After many years, and with much effort, she was able to buy a stall behind the Colonel Oviedo Health Center. With her daughter’s help she makes food like empanadas, sandwiches, and breaded cutlets. She feeds patients, family members, and nurses at the hospital. Thanks to the effort and hard-work she puts into making her products and her good hygiene, she was able to get her customers. They come to her stall day to day to eat breakfast and lunch and to snack. Eudelina is grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya for the support they have provided. Thanks to this support she was able to buy more meat, noodles, rice, dairy products, sweets, and soft drinks, etc. She bought these to continue giving her customers the most delicious food at the best price. This way she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, flour, eggs, sweets, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cleotilde

texts.es:
Maria tiene un pequeño taller de confección y costura, vive en una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas llamada así “Paraíso”.  

Su negocio lo comenzó cociéndole la ropa a una de sus vecinas poco a poco por su delicadeza y rapidez fue conocida por el sector como la costurera.  Comenzó a trabajar como costurera, en la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano hasta que termine todo los pedidos que le han pedido sus clientes. Confecciona pantalones, vestidos, blusas etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una máquina de coser y telas para hacer vestidos. En el futuro quiere cambiar de lugar su taller para que sea más accesible para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria runs a small sewing and dressmaking workshop. She lives on the outskirts of town in an area of dirt roads and hills called 'Paradise'.

She began her business by making clothes for one of her neighbours. Little by little, with her speed and delicate hand she became known in her area as the seamstress. She now works as a seamstress from very early in the morning until all her customers' orders are finished. She makes pants, dresses, shirts and other clothes.

With this loan she would like to purchase a sewing machine and fabric to make dresses. In the future she would like to move her workshop to an area which is more accessible for her customers.

loans.use: Sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Everylyne

texts.en:
Everylyne has a mixed farm which produces milk, vegetables and maize. She sells all her products to the local market. She has been farming for the last ten years in Kitale town, western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables and maize which she sells to the local market. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the basic needs of her family.

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and maintain a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help her pay school fees for her children. Her biggest challenge is disease which affects her production. She wishes to have a chaff cutter for cutting straw or hay into small pieces and also to buy four dairy cows in the next five years.

Everylyne is 44 years old. She is married with 5 school-aged children.

loans.use: To purchase and maintain a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolás, de 21 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su madre y sus hermanas menores, juntas luchan por salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años, este emprendedor joven se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte público y en la actualidad trabaja en una  línea de transportes de la zona por donde vive, con un vehiculo alquilado. Le gusta mucho su labor pues se entretiene con las calles y con las personas, y dice que se ha acostumbrado ya que obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su madre con los constantes gastos del hogar. Además dice estar muy satisfecho con su trabajo ya que le ayuda a mantener económicamente a su madre y hermanas. Como es un joven bastante trabajador, tiene planeado comprarse un auto para brindarlo en alquiler o trabajarlo él mismo. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Nicolás tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en mandar refaccionar una motocarro que brindará en alquiler, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Nicolas, 21 years old, lives in his own house next to his mother and his younger sisters.  They are all struggling to get ahead.  For the last 5 years this enterprising young man has been providing public transport and currently works for a transportation company in the area where he lives, using a rented vehicle.  He likes his work because he enjoys the streets and the people, and he says that he has become accustomed to the regular income and the ability to help his mother with the expenses of the home.  He also says that he is very satisfied with his work since it helps him to financially support his mother and sisters.  Since he is a very hard working young man, he plans to buy and auto to rent it out or use it himself in his work.  This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to comply with the payment terms on time for he does not want to look bad to the people that made this loan possible and enabled him to continue working and progressing.  Nicolas plans to invest the loan proceeds in refurbishing a three wheeled vehicle that he will rent out, this way increasing his income.

loans.use: Provide maintenance for his vehicle

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío Tiene 23 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus familiares. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de truchas, mercadería que obtiene en la piscigranja de su zona, y que los compra al por mayor para luego ser llevados a Lima para su comercializarlos, de esa manera se genera sus propios ingresos. Su madre la apoya en este negocio, ya que le ayuda a conseguir al mejor proveedor en donde le pueda proporcionar en mayor cantidad este pescado, por tener alto valor nutritivo, eso ha hecho que tenga mucha demanda. Por otro lado considera que este negocio le es muy rentable, y por tal motivo desea mejorar sus ingresos. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece asimismo a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará para comprar más mercadería en truchas y llevar más cantidad a la capital.
texts.en:
Rocío is 23 years old and lives with her son at the home of her relatives. For the past two years, she has been selling trout that she obtains from a local fish farm. She buys them in bulk and then takes them to Lima to sell so that she can generate income for herself. Her mother helps her with the business by looking for the best supplier that can provide her with the greatest amount of fish. Since this type of fish has high nutritional value, it is in great demand. Rocío considers this business to be very profitable, so she wants to generate more income.

This is her first loan with MFP. Rocío is pleased to know that she has financial support. She also enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive. Rocío thanks everyone responsible for approving her loan request since the funds will be useful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more trout that she can bring with her to Lima.

loans.use: Purchase trout to sell

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Nuevo Amanecer esta compuesto por ocho integrantes. 
La presidenta es la Sra. Esperanza,  tiene dos hijos  el padre D. sus hijos le pasa  una pequeña pensión que apenas le alcanza para la alimentación y ella tiene que trabajar para sus gastos  D. educación y personales D. sus hijos, la señora se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos y los fines D. semana se dedica a la venta D. comida   es muy trabajadora y su incentivo para seguir adelante son sus dos hijos, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara para la compra D. cosméticos que se encuentran en promoción  y después venderlos a un precio mayor y así poder obtener ganancias extras,  este banco D. emprendimiento este conformado por amigos  D. la zona  que  tienen una amistad D. hace varios años, cada una D. ellas tienen una actividad independiente trabajan todos los días   , se conocen bastante bien entre ellas en el grupo  existe la participación D. 1 varón D. igual manera es  muy conocidos con su respectiva actividad .es un banco muy organizado y  dinámico .
texts.en:
The New Dawn (Nuevo Amanecer) communal bank has 8 members.  The group President is Esperanza.  She has two children and she gets a small support payment from him that’s barely enough for their food.  She must work to cover her personal costs and the costs of her children’s education. She sells cosmetics and on weekends she sells prepared food. She is very hard working; her incentive to get ahead in life is her two children.

She will use the loan money to buy cosmetics that are currently on special promotion to later resell at higher prices thus obtaining extra profits.

This communal bank is maD. up of friends from the area who have been friends for several years.  Each of them has her own independent work every day.  They know each other quite well.  There is one male in the group who is also well known in is work.  The bank is very organized and dynamic.

loans.use: To buy catalogue cosmetics that are on special.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Juan Bautista tiene 40 años, su actividad es un taller de talabartería, esta no es la primera vez que solicita financiamiento pues ha sido muy gratificante el mejorar su negocio. Inicio este negocio por sus padres con el paso del tiempo fue decidió hacerse cargo del negocio que le ha permitido mantener su hogar es una hombre muy luchador y siempre le ha gustado trabajar. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de cuero, baqueta entre otros productos que son necesaR..
texts.en: Juan Bautista is 40 years old. He runs a harness-maker’s shop. This is not the first time he has asked for a loan, being it a very satisfying way for him to improve his activity. His parents started this activity, and in time he decided to take care of it, thus being able to provide for his family through this activity. He is a very hardworking man and he has always liked working. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy leather, calfskin and other products he needs.

loans.use: To purchase leather, calfskin and other sadlery products.

loans.name: Enhbat

texts.en:
Enhbat S. is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and four children in the Hovd Province of Western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. All four of his children attend the local school. 

Enhbat operates a construction business that specializes in interior and exterior decoration of buildings. His wife is an assistant to him in his business. He has owned this business for almost 10 years and, over this long time, he has earned a good reputation among his customers because of the quality of his work and service. Enhbat, a modest and hardworking man, says, “My only wish is to establish my own construction decoration company in the future.”

He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase equipment, such as a compressor and drill, for his construction business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary equipment, such as a compressor and drill

loans.name: Wisam

texts.ar:
وسام في عمر 40 سنة  متزوج وله اولاد يعمل في نقل الخضار الى الاسواق له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله كثيرا ويبرع
فيه فهو طموح مثابر ويريد تأمين العيش الكريم له ولعائلته متميز بعمله ما يميزه هي الدقة والصدق
له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد كان للقرض اثر جيد جدا له وكان يلقى الدعم من عائلته يريد من خلال 
طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تحسين وضع البيك الذي يملكه حتى يتمكن من تحسين نوعية عمله
texts.en: Wisam is a 40-year-old husband and father who wants to provide a dignified life for his family and who in turn is greatly supported by them. Wisam possesses ten years experience working in vegetable distribution. He is very driven and honest in his work, which he excels at. His last loan from Al Majmoua had a very positive effect so Wisam is now asking for another loan to upgrade his pickup truck.

loans.use: To upgrade pickup truck

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia A. is from the village of Gumabon, Gingoog City. She is 40 years old. Anastacia is widowed and has 8 adult-aged children. To make a living, Anastacia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, beverages, snack foods and toothpaste in the local community. She also sells green bananas. Anastacia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Anastacia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anastacia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Anastacia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like snack foods and canned goods. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Anastacia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell, such as snack foods and canned goods.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn A. is from the village of Panay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Jovelyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jovelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Jovelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jovelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovelyn is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Jovelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.ar: محمد في عمر 26 سنة اعزب يعمل في محل لبيع الخبز والمناقيش له في عمله 7 سنوات يحب عمله وهو مصدر عيشه يريد التجدد والتطور في عمله وزيادة مدخوله يعاني من منافسة عملية فهو يريد ان يطور عمله وان يزيد من مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى انشاء فرع جديد لمصلحته + تقوية المصلحة بشراء بضائع جديدة يتميز بالنظافة والدقة في العمل وهو مقصد لزبائنه من محيطه وجيرانه واقاربه
texts.en: Mohamed is 26 and unmarried. He works in a bakery and has 7 years experience. He loves his work and it is the sole source of income for him. He wants to rejuvenate and develop his business and increase his income. He faces a lot of competition in his business and with the loan he wants to establish a new branch. He also wants to improve his prospects by buying new stock. He is a clean person and pays attention to detail. His customers range from people in his local area, his neighbors and his relatives.

loans.use: To establish a new branch to his bakery and purchase new supplies

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema U. is 30 years old and is married with two children who are 3 and 7 years old. 

Rehema lives by sewing different styles of clothes. This business is well organized and she employs two people to help her. This is her fifth successful year in this business. She operates her business from 5 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day. 

Rehema needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase four sewing machines and some clothing items. Thus, she will create another job for the people in her community. 

By expanding her business and adding more equipment and workers, Rehema hopes to earn more profits, and these profits will allow her to expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase four sewing machines

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith S. is 59 years old, widowed and has seven adult-aged children. She is from the village of Kabatangan within the municipality of Wao, Lanao del Sur province on the Mindanao islands. Edith runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, bread, charcoal, biscuits and candies, plus vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes, bananas and also ice candy to the local community. Edith has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Edith joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase additional inventory and obtain some working capital. Edith is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, her second from HSPFI, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like beverages and canned goods

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is 40 years old, married and living in Baclayon, Bohol. She has a 9-year-old child. 

Annabel runs a tricycle (motorcycle with a passenger cab) business and has had this business for nine years. Her husband is the driver of the tricycle. Annabel also raises pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Annabel is asking for a loan to purchase tricycle spare parts and pig feed. This will help Annabel continue her tricycle business and keep the pigs healthy.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts and pig feed

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 36-year-old married man, living with his wife and three children in Saida. Moustafa has worked as car electrician for 23 years. He's an expert in his field since he started this business in his early childhood. Moustafa was very close to his big brother, he was his role model and seeks to be like him, that's why he started working with him and that's how he learned his first business knowledge. 

Moustafa is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua for the 11th time, in order to buy tools necessary to improve his business, in addition to buying new bedrooms for his children. 

Moustafa is a borrower in good standing, a man with a good reputation who deserves his business. 

He hopes to provide his family a good life filled with health, happiness and good education. He hopes to buy some land where he can build a house for each  of his kids.

loans.use: to buy tools necessary for his business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from abaca (a plant fiber) weaving. Vilma is borrowing 13,000 Philippines pesos through NWTF to buy more clothing to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more RTW (ready-to-wear) products to sell

loans.name: Romelia Floreca's Group

texts.en: Romelia is the leader of 10 members taking a group loan. Romelia is married and is 47 years old. She has a retailing business where she sells veterinary supplies like vaccines, de-worming medicine and animal vitamins. She has been operating this business for almost 15 years. Romelia is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional supplies like vaccines, de-worming medicine and animal vitamins to sell in their villages. She usually earns about PHP 8,000 each month in this business. She hopes that her business will improve while taking the loan to continue sending her children in school.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as vaccines, de-worming medicine and  vitamins

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor José Antonio tiene ya más de seis años con su taller de carpintería el cual le está haciendo falta herramienta de trabajo más moderna y comprar materia prima para trabajar. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar la herramienta y la madera que necesita para terminar pedidos de muebles que tiene que entregar, ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder esta inversión a su negocio.
Don José Antonio pagara el con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. José Antonio has managed his carpentry workshop for more than six years. However, he is lacking more modern tools so he plans to buy this equipment for his work.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy the tools and wood that he needs to finish the furniture orders he has already received because he does not have the necessary capital required for this business investment.

Don José Antonio will repay the loan using part of his earnings generated from his business. It is the source of income that he has to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and wood for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is married and has four children. She sells maize and charcoal at Abura, near nyame bekyere, which she has done for eight years. In the photo, she can be seen standing near her bags of charcoal.  Ekua's husband is a farmer. She uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more bags of maize to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi is 43 years old.  She is married and has 3 children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Gigi runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as biscuits, noodles, bread and other miscellaneous items.  She has been in this business for 2 years.   

Gigi has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store.   She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy more items to sell

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 29-year-old married lady with three children. Recently, she has started a small home business making handmade accessories such as necklaces, bracelets and other pieces. In order to keep up with the latest fashion, she keeps on looking for new ideas that will catch her customers' eyes. 

Maha has applied for this loan to buy more tools and materials such as gemstones to add a new collection to her accessories. Because Maha is a conservative person, her brother-in-law’s wife, Kefah, is in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: to buy more materials, such as gemstones, to make accessories.

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Sergio, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a vender de forma ambulante medicina y ropa, inicio con el apoyo de un amigo, hoy en día este trabajo le permite tener todo lo necesario para el hogar, no posee un horario fijo y actualmente necesita capital para invertir.
Él solicita un préstamo para compararse medicamentos para el negocio, invirtiendo en tabletas, frascos bebibles e inyecciones, que sean para diferentes enfermedades a tratar, con el préstamo tendrá la posibilidad de contar con diversidad de medicamentos para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio, proveer para su familia todo lo necesario que les permita tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Sergio lives with his wife and two children. He makes his living as a peddler of medicines and clothing. He began the business with the support of a friend. Now this job allows him to have everything necessary for his home. He does not have a fixed schedule. Currently he needs investment capital. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase medicines for his business, investing in tablets, drinking flasks and injections for the treatment of different illnesses. With this loan it will be possible for him to have a variety of medicines to be able to meet the demand.

His goals are to grow his business and provide his family with everything necessary to give them a dignified life.

loans.use: to purchase tablet medicines, drinking flasks and injections.

loans.name: Faithful Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Faithful” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Ramatu is the leader of this group. Ramatu is 37 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Ramatu sells market food like salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. With the help of this loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy salt, margi, palm oil, etc. in large quantities

loans.name: Ramatulai

texts.en: This is 37-year-old Ramatulai.  She is divorced, and has one child who is 17 years old.  She has one additional dependent who lives with her because she is her relative and she helps with her schooling.  In 2006, Ramatulai established her slippers, clothing, shoes and soft drinks business.  She began her business because she knows that she is not well educated and her husband who used to be very helpful to her abandoned her. She found this business to be her only option to support her child and dependent. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000.  Ramatulai requires a loan in order to improve her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.  In the future, Ramatulai plans to educate her daughter to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, slippers and drinks for her business

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 55 years old and raises pigs as her source of income. She is blessed with two children whom she needs to send to school and support. So Amelia, together with her husband, works to earn a higher income to improve their lives. Her husband works as a farmer while she focuses on her pig business.

She wants to provide good nutrition to her pigs so she is requesting a loan amount of PHP5,000 to buy feed and vitamins. By providing a nutritious diet for her pigs, she can sell them for a higher price. She hopes to gain higher sales and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ayewaho

texts.fr:
Ayewaho  est une femme de 32 ans. Elle est mariée å un  frigoriste. Elle a 01enfant.  
Ayewaho travaille revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générale(les bidons d’huile, les sacs de riz, les boite de sucre) depuis 6 ans. Elle vend ses produits à toute personne à la devanture de sa maison. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Ayewaho a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bidons d’huile, des sacs de riz et des boites de conserve. 
Dans les prochaines années, Ayewaho veut agrandir son activité et vendre encore de nouveaux produits.
texts.en: Ayewaho is 32 years old and married to a refrigeration engineer. The couple have one child. Ayewaho has been selling food products (cans of oil, sacs of rice, boxes of sugar) for 6 years. She sells her merchandise in front of her house and buys her supplies in Lomé. Her main challenge is the competition. She is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock on oil, rice and canned goods. Over the next few years, Ayewaho would like to expand her range of products and grow her business.

loans.use: to restock on food products for resale.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El Joven Rene  nacido en  Huaracal-Jorochito, el es soltero pero tiene un hijo pequeño  el cual vive con su madre, el vive en la localidad donde nacio en Jorochito y  tiene una parcela en Huaracal en la cual se dedica a la agricultura, siembra yuca, papa, y maíz. Con el dinero del crédito preparara la tierra para la siembra de yuca y los gastos que implica la siembra de la misma,  Mientras da frutos su productos el trabaja en una cervecería por las noches, en época de cosecha el lleva sus productos al mercado de la zona comercializa directamente del productor al consumidor es su primer crédito que esta sacando con emprender y se siente muy agradecido por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: This young man, Rene, was born in Huaracal-Jorochito. He is single, but he has a young son who lives with his mother. He lives in the town where he was born, in Jorochito, and he has a plot of land in Huaracal which he farms, growing yuca, potatoes and corn. With the funds from the loan, he will prepare the land to plant yuca and pay the expenses involved in planting that crop. While his crops are producing, he also works at a brewery in the evenings. In the harvest season, he takes his products to the market in the area where producers sell directly to consumers. This is the first loan he is taking out with Emprender, and he feels very grateful for the support provided to him.

loans.use: to plant yuca.

loans.name: Emperatriz Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes de 27 años, es una mujer dedicada a su trabaja.Empezó su negocio hace 1 año, su negocio es pequeño bazar ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda. Su horario es de lunes a domingo, empieza a las 8:00am hasta las 22:00pm.

Su dificultad de ella  es la competencia, ya que en su sector hay varios locales con su mismo negocio. Su esposo la ayuda en las noches, ya que él trabaja de electricista en las tardes. 

Ella solicita el préstamo para  el mejoramiento de su vivienda comprando cemento, arena, pintura y  con el dinero restante el incremento de su negocio. El sueño de ella es ver que su vivienda esté terminada.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 27, is a woman who is dedicated to her work.  She started her business a year ago, a small store located in the front of her house.  Her work schedule is Monday through Sunday from 8am until 10pm.

Competition is her problem because there are several similar stores in her sector.  Her husband helps her in the evening since he works as an Electrician days.  

She’s asking for the loan to do some home improvements; she’ll buy cement, sand and paint and any left over money will be used to expand her business.  Her dream is to see her house finished.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and paint.

loans.name: Kiet

texts.en:
Mrs. Kiet, 45, is in the business of farming rice. It’s a kind of annual crop and she can generate an average of about $3.75 a day from this activity. She lives with her husband and 3 single children in Ornlong Veng district, Siem Reap. This couple cooperates to earn profits and raise their children, all of whom are studying in a local public school. 

Kiet is a wise mother who always educates and takes care of her children to pursue the right principle of living. She wants to sustain her children’s education and lift her family out of poverty. Thus, she would like to ask for some funds from Kiva’s lenders to buy some pigs for raising. She hopes this new business will provide her family a good profit.

loans.use: to buy some pigs for raising.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a responsible housewife who engages herself in fruit and vegetable vending in their community. She is 47 years old and has three school-age children. With her husband, it is their ambition to improve their living status and give their family a better life. Farming is the main sources of their living. They plant vegetables and fruits and raise livestock for sale. They endure the problems and difficulties they've encountered in life for they believe that it is their stepping stone to reach their goals.

Delia aims to continue and improve her small business and she wants to ask for additional capital of 5,000 PHP to buy apples, grapes, melons, oranges, cabbages, tomatoes, beans and bananas to sell. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help to be able to make the business grow and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy apples, grapes, melons, oranges, cabbages, tomatoes, beans and bananas to sell

loans.name: Islatkan

texts.ru:
Ислаткан родилась в Токтогулском районе, в с. Озгоруш (юг Кыргызстана). После окончания средней школы 1983 году, Ислаткан поступила в Ошский Педагогический институт. Но к сожалению, когда она училась в первом курсе, ее украли замуж (древняя традиция кражи невест просуществовала долгое время, но в сегодняшнее время не распространена и карается законом). По этой причине, ей пришлось бросить учебу и заниматься домашними делами.  В 1984 году Ислаткан родила дочку, а в 1986 году развелась с мужем и начала работать в Жалал-Абадской больнице санитаркой. В 1987 году Ислаткан попыталась обрести счастье во втором браке и родила сына и дочь. К сожалению, семейная жизнь не сложилась и в 2004, после развода, она с детьми переехала жить в город Карабалта. Чтобы прокормить свою семью, Ислаткан купила швейную машинку и начала шить матрасы, подушки и продавала на рынке оптом. Благодаря трудолюбию и упорству, бизнес Ислаткан пошел в гору и в 2008 году, она смогла купить квартиру в селе Калининское. К настоящему времени,  Ислаткан выдала замуж двух дочерей и женила сына, которые теперь живут отдельно со своими семьями.  
Энергичная Ислаткан и сегодня занимается пошивом и принимает заказы, приносящие ежемесячный доход в сумме 12,500 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ислаткан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку швейной машинки, и машинки - оверлок. Она планирует взять на работу двух помощниц, что позволит ей увеличить объем заказов. В будущем, Ислаткан мечтает открыть мини швейный цех.
texts.en:
Islatkan was born in the Toktogul region, in the Ozgorush village (south Kyrgyzstan). After finishing high school in 1983 Islatkan attended Osh Pedagogical Institute, but unfortunately after the first semester she was kidnapped for marriage (the ancient tradition of stealing girls for brides has lasted a long time but currently occurs rarely and is punishable by law). Since she had been married she had to quit college and became a house wife. In 1984 Islatkan gave birth to her daughter and in 1986 she divorced her husband and started to work as a nurse in the Zhalal-Abad hospital. In 1987 Islatkan found happiness in a second marriage and gave birth to a son and a daughter. Unfortunately in 2004 she divorced again and moved with her children to the city of Karabalt. To feed her family Islatkan opened a sewing business and has been making mattresses and pillows which she sells wholesale on the market. Because of her hard work and determination Islatkan's business has flourished in 2008 and she was able to buy an apartment in the Kalininskoe village. After her move Islatkan has married off all of her children, who now live with their own families.

The energetic Islatkan is still running her sewing business and takes in orders that yield 12,500 som (KGS) in monthly profits. To grow her business further she has turned to "Bai-Tushum and partners" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS). She is planning to use the money to purchase a new sewing machine and a serger/overlock machine. She is also planning to hire two seamstresses for her business which will allow her to take in more orders. In the future Islatkan dreams of opening a small sewing factory.

loans.use: to purchase sewing and overlock machines

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old, married to Catherine and they have one child who is two years old. He has been running a retail shop for the past six months, earning an income of KES.10,000 a month.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the entire loan to buy bales of wheat flour, cooking fat, maize flour and detergent for sale.

He will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour, cooking fat, maize flour and detergent for sale

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.es: La señora Rosa a sus 45 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos, es una emprendedora quien decide comprarle a un conocido por un bajo precio varios computadores y cabinas para iniciar su propio negocio de cibercafé, en el cual lleva un año. Inicialmente, la señora Rosa no contaba con el conocimiento sobre informática, pero sus hijos le sirvieron de apoyo y profesores mientras la señora Rosa aprendía sobre este tema. La señora Rosa requiere de la compra de un computador que le permita mejorar los servicios en su negocio, incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, especialmente del menor de ellos que sufre de cáncer en el colón y a su vez cumplir sus sueños de continuar creciendo en su negocio y ver que su hijo enfermo logre recuperarse totalmente.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa is a 45-year-old mother of six children. She is an entrepreneur who decided to buy several low-priced computers and work stations so that she could start her own cybercafé. Rosa has been in business for one year. Initially Rosa did not know anything about computers, but her children helped her and taught her while she learned about this subject.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a computer, which will improve the services she offers in her business. This will increase her earnings and improve the quality of life for her children, especially the youngest one who has colon cancer. In time, she hopes to fulfill her dreams of continuing to grow her business and seeing her son make a complete recovery.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Cristina; ella es conviviente y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de cevicheria, ella tiene un puesto donde vende ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local grande para que pueda vender el ceviche. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pescado, verduras y platos.

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de zapatos, negocio de hotelería, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de crianza de pollos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Reyna del Carmen" communal bank, located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.  

Cristina is forty-six, lives with her partner, has four children, and has a ceviche business. She sells ceviche, a fish dish, from her mobile cart.  She works from 8AM until 6PM.  The business helps her bring success to her children.  Cristina's dream is to have a large locale where she can sell her ceviche.  She is seeking a loan to buy cooking supplies including fish, vegetables, and plates.

Other members' businesses include a restaurant, shoe sales, hotel management, taxi service, a grocery store, and chicken farming.

Cristina is grateful to those who are part of this dream and she promises to make all of her payments in full and on time.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies including fish, vegetables, and plates.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a 30-year-old married mother of three children between the ages of five and eight, has sold fruits and vegetables for the past year. Operating a well-organized business, Grace works from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. everyday. 

Grace has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more pineapples, green bananas, mangoes, etc. to sell. She will reinvest her profits in her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more pineapples, green bananas, mangoes, etc.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio es una  persona  emprendedora  y  muy responsable,  el  cual  se a  dedicado   durante  ya  varios años   a la venta  de  elotes,  la cual realiza  por  las  calles  de  la localidad y ya  cuenta  con   sus clientes  frecuentes, el  esta  muy   feliz  de   habernos  encontrado  ya  que  realizara  su  proyecto,el cual  consiste   en   construir   un cuarto que  acondicionara   como local  para  continuar  ofreciendo su  servicio, agradece  el apoyo  brindado para  hacer realidad  su sueño  ya  que  ve  en  el crédito  la  posibilidad  de  aumentar  su   numero de   clientes, esto    permitiéndole   generar  un mayor  numero de  ingresos  y  a  su  vez  seguir   brindado a sus  clientes  el excelente  servicio  que  lo a caracterizado.
texts.en: Mr. Antonio is an enterprising, responsible person who has been selling corn for several years.  He works as a street vendor in his town and has many frequent customers.  He is glad to have found us because he will be able to carry out his project, which is building a room that he will fix up as a sales point to continue his business.  He is grateful for the support in realizing his dream since he believes the loan will make it possible for him to increase his customer base and generate more income.  This will allow him to continue providing the excellent customer service that he is known for.

loans.use: To build a room to fix up as a sales point.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 29-year-old man. He is married and fathers one child. He sells household utensils in different markets in Ruaka. His wife is a farmer who sells eggs from her layers. Anthony has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of 60,000 KES.

This will be Anthony’s third loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase cups, spoons, cooking pots, and serving spoons to sell. With the profit that he will get, he wants to increase his variety of items. 

In the future, he wants to be able to build rental units on his piece of land.

loans.use: to increase stock of household utensils

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: DIEU EST GRAND est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Nathalie Armelle Ghislaine (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 37 ans. Nathalie Armelle Ghislaine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Nathalie Armelle Ghislaine est mariée à un certain Gaston. Le couple a trois enfants, dont scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Nathalie Armelle Ghislaine vend des tissus et divers produits depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Nathalie Armelle Ghislaine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Nathalie Armelle Ghislaine sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et divers produits.

loans.name: Leonides

texts.es:
Leonides con 49 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive junto a su esposa, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado caprino, las compras lo realiza en caseríos aledaños así como en el suyo. Adicionalmente se dedica al comercio de aves como gallinas,patos y cultivo y venta de cacao,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 15 años.El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de animales con ello le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

Leonides es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, firmará con su esposa.

loans.use: será para invertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de animales

loans.name: Chanthon

texts.en:
K. Chanthon has born ten children, six of them are still living with her. She is a widow and supports her family with a small business she is running with her four grown children. They sell dry food in front of the numerous factories in this area. The five of them can sell for 160,000 Riel ($40) per day, out of which 40,000 Riel ($10) profit.

K. Chanthon wants to start a new business. Her plan is to open a real shop in front of a factory. She could sell clothes, spices and even more…

She needs $500 to have the shop built and would like to purchase for $500 stock. She will probably also invest her own savings.

K. Chanthon is confident because she knows that two of her grown sons, who are employed in factories, would help her if anything wrong happened. If this business is successful, she is already considering another one, which would be building a house to rent it.

loans.use: Build a small shop in front of the factories

loans.name: Adjelenye

texts.en: Adjelenye trades in banku, a local product made from corn. Her business is a fast food venture. She prepares this cooked food made from corn and sells to the public in a local restaurant. She has participated in the TEACH lending skills program and graduated in Basic Business development programme. She needs a loan of $800 from Kiva.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en: Tuinanau is 47 years old and has raised six children.  All six of her children are married and have their own families.  Tuinanau is a very independent-minded woman and does not want to depend on her children and their families for financial support so she used an initial SPBD loan to start a business selling flavored ices (locally referred to as “ice cakes”) to the children at the local primary school.  Her business has strong sales, and she is applying for an additional loan in order to purchase supplies in bulk (and thus at better rates) and continue to make her product.  A loan to Tuinanau will help ensure that she can continue to run her business and remain financially independent.

loans.use: Buy purified water, sugar, cordials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase basic bakery ingredients

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Mrs Nidia S. is 52 years old. She is separated and has three children: they are 32, 25 and 23 years old, respectively. The older one does not live with her any more. The other two work and study at the university. She is very proud of her children because they are very responsible and studious. Nidia has been selling products from her home for 22 years. She lives at a good location right at the center of town. She sells primary need products such as vegetables, drinks, milk products, bread, etc.

Nowadays, demand has grown, since Nidia's store has progressed both in quantity and quality. Nidia wishes to continue growing her business. Therefore, she wants to purchase plenty of merchandise.

She requests $800 which she will use to purchase wholesale canned food, meat, bread products, flour, oil and noodles to get important discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Nidia Sánchez tiene 52 años, es separada, y es madre de 3 hijos; ellos tienen 32,25 y 23 años respectivamente. La mayor ya no vive con ella, los otros dos trabajan y estudian en la universidad, ella se siente muy orgullosa de sus hijos pues son muy responsables y estudiosos. Nidia tiene una despensa en su casa hace 22 años, posee una buena ubicación pues se encuentra en el centro mismo de la ciudad. En su despensa vende productos de primera necesidad tales como bebidas, verduras, lácteos, panificados, etc. Hoy día la demanda se ha vuelto más grande, pues la ciudad ha crecido y progresado y Nidia desea seguir creciendo a la par; para ello desea comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías y así ir ampliando el negocio. Solicita el crédito de $ 800 que los utilizará para comprar productos enlatados, carne, panificados, harina, aceite y fideos en grandes cantidades, así de esta forma también podrá conseguir importantes descuentos.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale canned food, meat, bread, flour, oil and noodles

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyen Thi H., 44 years old, has a happy family with a supporting husband and two well-behaved children. She became a TYM Fund member since 1996. She has a shop at a very good location, and the selection of goods sold are really varied. Her shop is divided into three rooms. In one room she sells sundry goods, in one room her husband fixes bicycles and sells parts of bicycles, in the last room they sell cattle foods. Although very busy, she still spends time with TYM Fund activities. She has been an excellent officer of her cluster. Ms. H. is now the team leader of TYM Fund’s Soc Son. Her group is ranked as “Good” every month. Her business is doing well. Her family’s monthly income is 200USD. She wants to borrow 1200USD to upgrade her shop and sell more variety of goods.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 44 tuổi, đang có một gia đình êm ấm, hạnh phúc với người chồng luôn ủng hộ chị trong công việc và hai đứa con ngoan ngoãn. Chị bắt đầu tham gia từ khi Quỹ triển khai hoạt động tại xã Phú Cường năm 1996. Chị có một cửa hàng với vị trí khá thuận lợi cho việc buôn bán, chẳng thế mà gian hàng của chị thật phong phú và đa dạng. Một gian hàng tạp hóa với rất nhiều mặt hàng tiêu dùng hàng ngày, một gian để anh sửa chữa, bán phụ tùng xe đạp, gian còn lại anh chị để bán thức ăn gia súc. Công việc bộn bề là vậy nhưng chị vẫn luôn sắp xếp được để có thời gian dành cho Quỹ Tình thương. Nhiều năm liền chị luôn là cán bộ cụm xuất sắc, hiện tại chị là nhóm trưởng của Quỹ Tình thương Sóc Sơn và nhóm của chị luôn được xếp loại Tốt hàng tháng. Công việc kinh doanh hiện tại của anh chị đang tiến triển rất tốt, thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình là 200 USD. Chị tâm sự rằng nếu được vay thêm 1200 USD thì nhất định chị sẽ nâng cấp cho cửa hàng rộng rãi, khang trang hơn và đầu tư thêm nhiều mặt hàng nữa.

loans.use: Upgrade her shop and sell more goods

loans.name: Lesya

texts.en:
Lesya is married and has two children. Her family lives in the small town of Bogorodchany in the Ivano-Frankivsk region of Ukraine. After Lesya was laid off from her previous job, she had to find some other way to provide for her family. That is how she became a market vendor. Today Lesya sells women’s clothing, footwear, and purses in a small retail store in downtown Bogorodchany. Her prices are always reasonable. Moreover, Lesya is the only entrepreneur selling this type of inventory in that area of the city. She has been in business for five years. Financial assistance has helped her business grow and expand. Currently, she has about $6,000 in inventory, and her monthly income is about $600.

Lesya is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase 15 pairs of pants wholesale to sell over this Christmas season. Her business is the only source of income for her family. That is why she is determined to work 24/7 to provide for their needs and stimulate the growth of her trade. One of her plans is to open a new vending facility in the local market and hire an employee to help her run the business. We believe her natural liveliness and enthusiasm will help Lesya achieve her goals and continue as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy 15 pairs of women’s pants to sell at her store

loans.name: Altaf Hussin

texts.en: Altaf Hussin lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two daughters. He is uneducated but he is a carpet weaver with good experience. He has lots of students so he need to expand his business.
